E.Name: CIRoleCode
E.Doc: This codelist gives the possible roles for the responsible party. Must select only one role. Only list one role code using the following prioritization if more than one of individual, system and organization are provided: 1. individual name, 2. system name 3. organization name. (ISO19115 - role (379))(ISO19115 - B.5.5)

P.Name: ResourceProvider
P.Doc: Party that supplies the resource.

P.Name: Custodian
P.Doc: Party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource.

P.Name: Owner
P.Doc: Party that owns the resource.

P.Name: User
P.Doc: Party who uses the resource.

P.Name: Distributor
P.Doc: Party who distributes the resource.

P.Name: Originator
P.Doc: Party who created the resource.

P.Name: PointOfContact
P.Doc: Party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource.

P.Name: PrincipalInvestigator
P.Doc: Key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research.

P.Name: Processor
P.Doc: Party who has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified.

P.Name: Publisher
P.Doc: Party who published the resource.

P.Name: Author
P.Doc: Party who authored the resource.

E.Name: CIDateTypeCode
E.Doc: Identification of when a given event occurred. (ISO19115 - B.5.2 CodeList)

P.Name: Creation
P.Doc: Date identifies when the resource of the feature data was brought into existence. (ISO19115 - B.5.2)

P.Name: Publication
P.Doc: Date identifies when the resource for the feature data was issued. (ISO19115 - B.5.2)

P.Name: Revision
P.Doc: Date identifies when the resource for the feature data was examined or re-examined and improved or amended. (ISO19115 - B.5.2)

E.Name: DQEvaluationMethodTypeCode
E.Doc: Annex B.5.6 from ISO19115. Type of method for evaluating an identified data quality measure.

P.Name: DirectInternal
P.Doc: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated.

P.Name: DirectExternal
P.Doc: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required.

P.Name: Indirect
P.Doc: Method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge.

E.Name: MDProgressCode
E.Doc: Same as ISO19115 B.5.23. Gives status of the feature timeslice data.

P.Name: Completed
P.Doc: production of data has been completed

P.Name: HistoricalArchive
P.Doc: data has been stored in an offline storage facility

P.Name: Obsolete
P.Doc: data is no longer relevant

P.Name: OnGoing
P.Doc: data is continually being updated

P.Name: Planned
P.Doc: fixed date has been established upon or by which the data will be created or updated

P.Name: Required
P.Doc: data needs to be generated of updated

P.Name: UnderDevelopment
P.Doc: data is currently in the process of being created

E.Name: UomFL
E.Doc: Unit of measurement for flight levels.

P.Name: FL
P.Doc: Flight level in hundreds of feet.

P.Name: SM
P.Doc: Standard meters (tens of meters).

E.Name: UomDistance
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for a horizontal distance. For example, metres, feet, nautical miles, kilometres, etc...

P.Name: NM
P.Doc: Nautical miles.

P.Name: MI
P.Doc: Statute Mile

E.Name: UomDistanceVertical
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for a vertical distance. For example, Flight Level, metres, feet.

P.Name: FL
P.Doc: Flight level in hundreds of feet.

P.Name: SM
P.Doc: Standard meters (tens of meters).

E.Name: UomDuration
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for time. For example, seconds, minutes, hours

E.Name: UomFrequency
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for a frequency. For example,. Hz, kHz, MHz, GHz.

E.Name: UomPressure
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for pressure values.

P.Name: PA
P.Doc: Pascal (Pa)

P.Name: MPA
P.Doc: Mega Pascal.

P.Name: PSI
P.Doc: Pounds per square inch.

P.Name: BAR
P.Doc: 100000 Pascals (Pa).

P.Name: TORR
P.Doc: mm of mercury (mmHg).

P.Name: ATM
P.Doc: Standard Atmosphere.

E.Name: UomSpeed
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for speed.

P.Name: KM_H
P.Doc: Kilometres per hour.

P.Name: MACH
P.Doc: Mach number.

P.Name: M_MIN
P.Doc: Metres per minute.

P.Name: FT_MIN
P.Doc: Feet per minute.

P.Name: M_SEC
P.Doc: Metres per second.

P.Name: FT_SEC
P.Doc: Feet per second.

P.Name: MPH
P.Doc: Miles per hour.

E.Name: UomTemperature
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for temperature.

P.Name: C
P.Doc: Degrees Celsius.

P.Name: F
P.Doc: Degrees Fahrenheit.

P.Name: K
P.Doc: Degrees Kelvin.

E.Name: UomWeight
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for weight values.

P.Name: T
P.Doc: Tonne (metric).

P.Name: TON
P.Doc: Non-metric US short ton (2000 ob or 907.18474 kg).

E.Name: UomDepth
E.Doc: Unit of measurement for depth.

E.Name: UomLightIntensity
E.Doc: A unit of measurement for light intensity.

P.Name: CD
P.Doc: Candela, the base unit of luminous intensity.

E.Name: CodeAircraftEngineNumber
E.Doc: A coded indication for the number of engines of an aircraft.

P.Doc: One engine.
Two engines.
Three engines.
Four engines.
Six engines.
Eight engines.

P.Name: 2C
P.Doc: Two coupled engines driving one propeller.

E.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity
E.Doc: A code indicating the primary activity taking place in the airspace or the reason for its establishment.

P.Name: AD_TFC
P.Doc: All traffic on the manoeuvring area of an aerodrome and all aircraft flying in the vicinity of an aerodrome.(Annex11). Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: HELI_TFC
P.Doc: Helicopter or gyrocopter operations. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: TRAINING
P.Doc: Flights conducted for the purpose of training. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: AEROBATICS
P.Doc: The usage of unusual or artful flying manoeuvres for recreation, competition, or entertainment. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: AIRSHOW
P.Doc: A show at which aircraft are on view and featuring aerial displays. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: SPORT
P.Doc: The competition or practice by an individual or a group to achieve the best aerial performance. Description: A type of special air traffic. This could be an air race or aerobatic training or competition.

P.Name: ULM
P.Doc: Ultra light flights.

P.Name: GLIDING
P.Doc: Flying a non-power-driven heavier-than-air aircraft. Description: A type of special air traffic. (ICAO derived) A glider derives its lift in flight chiefly from aerodynamic reactions on surfaces which remain fixed under given conditions of flight.

P.Name: PARAGLIDER
P.Doc: Recreational and competitive flying sport using a free-flying, foot launched aircraft. Description: A type of special air traffic. When paragliding, the pilot sits in a harness suspended below a fabric wing, whose shape is formed by the pressure of air entering vents in the front of the wing. It is known in some countries as parapenting.

P.Name: HANGGLIDING
P.Doc: Recreational and competitive flying sport using a small glider from which the operator is suspended in a frame and which is controlled by movements of the body. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: PARACHUTE
P.Doc: Exiting a flying aircraft by an individual using a parachute. Description: A type of special air traffic. A parachute is a soft fabric device used to slow the motion through the atmosphere by generating drag.

P.Name: AIR_DROP
P.Doc: The dropping of troops, supplies, bombs, etc., from an aircraft. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: BALLOON
P.Doc: Flight activity involving a bag called the envelope that is capable of containing heated air, with a gondola or basket suspended beneath. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: RADIOSONDE
P.Doc: The lifting of devices through the atmosphere, which are tied to a helium or hydrogen filled balloon. Description: A type of special air traffic. Radio probe and meteorological balloons are examples.

P.Name: SPACE_FLIGHT
P.Doc: Vertical launch for space flight operations. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: UAV
P.Doc: The operation of a powered, aerial vehicle that does not carry a human operator. Description: A type of special air traffic. (NATO derived) An Unmanned Aerial Vehicle uses aerodynamic forces to provide vehicle lift, can fly autonomously or be piloted remotely, can be expendable or recoverable, and can carry a lethal or non-lethal payload.

P.Name: AERIAL_WORK
P.Doc: Operations in which an aircraft is used for specialized services. Description: A type of special air traffic. Services such as agriculture, construction, photography, surveying, observation and patrol, search and rescue, aerial advertisement, etc. are examples.

P.Name: CROP_DUSTING
P.Doc: Spraying crops with fertilizers, pesticides, and fungicides from an agricultural aircraft. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: FIRE_FIGHTING
P.Doc: Intense fire fighting activity involving chemical agents being laid down from fire fighting aircraft. Description: A type of special air traffic.

P.Name: MILOPS
P.Doc: The execution of operations by the military. Description: A type of military activity (usually).

P.Name: REFUEL
P.Doc: Transfer of fuel between aircraft in the air. Description: A type of military activity (usually).

P.Name: JET_CLIMBING
P.Doc: Climb-out of jet aircraft via predefined and common tracks. Description: A type of military activity (usually).

P.Name: EXERCISE
P.Doc: Intercepting and destroying of hostile aircraft or conducting similar training activities. Description: A type of military activity (usually).

P.Name: TOWING
P.Doc: Drawing or pulling through the air a target for aerial shooting practice. Description: A type of military activity (usually).

P.Name: NAVAL_EXER
P.Doc: Naval forces (for example: vessels or aircraft) conduct firing and/or munitions exercises. Description: Distinguished from areas where Naval forces conduct general operations and manoeuvres.

P.Name: MISSILES
P.Doc: The launch, transit, and targeting of guided missiles. Description: A type of military activity (usually). (NATO) A guided missile is an unmanned self-propelled vehicle whose trajectory or course, while in flight, is controlled.

P.Name: AIR_GUN
P.Doc: The delivery of air to air or air to ground weapons for the destruction of a target. Description: A type of military activity (usually).

P.Name: ARTILLERY
P.Doc: The discharge of a projectile into the air for the destruction of a target. Description: A type of military activity (usually).

P.Name: SHOOTING
P.Doc: The discharge of a gun or bow to propel arrows, bullets, etc swiftly or violently direct and sharply in specified directions. Description: A type of military activity (usually). This could be a shooting range or hunting area.

P.Name: BLASTING
P.Doc: Controlled use of explosives to excavate or remove rock. Description: A type of hazard.

P.Name: WATER_BLASTING
P.Doc: The action or an act of forcing out or emitting something suddenly underwater. Description: A type of hazard. Usually involving violence and noise.

P.Name: ANTI_HAIL
P.Doc: The use of small rockets to protect crops by seeding clouds with small particles that prevent hailstorms from forming. Description: A type of hazard.

P.Name: BIRD
P.Doc: Bird hazard.

P.Name: BIRD_MIGRATION
P.Doc: A high number of bird species as they fly instinctual routes based on breeding or diverse environmental urges. Description: A type of hazard. For Example: Large scale movements of migrating birds occur during various months in the European-Mediterranean and UK areas. There are also large concentrations of nesting, breeding, and wintering birds, often numbering in the millions.

P.Name: FIREWORK
P.Doc: Launching of pyrotechnic devices. Description: A type of hazard. .

P.Name: HI_RADIO
P.Doc: Electromagnetic fields produced by high intensity radio transmission. Description: A type of hazard.

P.Name: HI_LIGHT
P.Doc: Non-navigational lights with high visibility potential. Description: A type of hazard.

P.Name: LASER
P.Doc: The emission of photons in a coherent beam by an optical source. Description: A type of hazard. Laser stands for Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation. An example is a laser light show.

P.Name: NATURE
P.Doc: Wildlife, flora, fauna or features of geological or other special interest which is reserved and managed for conservation. Description: A type of protection. This is given a protective status. This could provide special opportunities for study or research. For example, a national park. .

P.Name: FAUNA
P.Doc: The animals or animal life of a given area, habitat, or epoch which is easily and dangerously aroused by excessive aerial noise such as from an aircraft. Description: A type of protection. Examples include mink or turkey farms and zoos.

P.Name: NO_NOISE
P.Doc: Airspace in which special procedures or other precautionary measures are established for reducing noise. Description: A type of protection.

P.Name: ACCIDENT
P.Doc: Airspace needing a protective status due to an investigation of a flight catastrophe. Description: A type of protection.

P.Name: POPULATION
P.Doc: An area with a high concentration of inhabitants. Description: A type of protection.

P.Name: VIP
P.Doc: The presence of an individual of renowned status and considered as a very important person. Description: A type of protection.

P.Name: VIP_PRES
P.Doc: The presence of an individual with status of head of state. Description: A type of protection.

P.Name: VIP_VICE
P.Doc: The presence of an individual with status of Vice-Head of State. Description: A type of protection.

P.Name: OIL
P.Doc: An area in which oil occurs in quantities worthy of exploitation. Description: A type of industrial hazard.

P.Name: GAS
P.Doc: Pumping natural gas from the ground or converting gasoline into vapour. Description: A type of industrial hazard.

P.Name: REFINERY
P.Doc: A facility where petroleum and/or petroleum products are refined. Description: A type of industrial hazard.

P.Name: CHEMICAL
P.Doc: A facility utilizing a chemical process for manufacturing. Description: A type of industrial hazard.

P.Name: NUCLEAR
P.Doc: An installation which provides power, derived from fission or fusion of atomic nuclei. Description: A type of industrial hazard.

P.Name: TECHNICAL
P.Doc: Generic technical activity affecting air traffic. Description: A type of industrial hazard. .

P.Name: ATS
P.Doc: Custom specific flight information service, alerting service, air traffic advisory service, air traffic control service, area control service, approach control service, or airport control service is provided. Description: A type of procedure/service. This could be a service in the air or on the ground.

P.Name: PROCEDURE
P.Doc: Special procedures established for use by operational personnel in execution of their flight. Description: A type of procedure/service. An overhead approach is an example of a special procedure.

E.Name: CodeAircraftCategory
E.Doc:
Classification of aircraft based on 1.3 times stall speed in landing configuration at maximum certified landing mass.
Category A: - less than 169 km/h (91 kt) IAS Category B: - 169 km/h (91 kt) or more but less than 224 km/h (121 kt) IAS Category C: - 224 km/h (121 kt) or more but less than 261 km/h (141 kt) IAS Category D: - 261 km/h (141 kt) or more but less than 307 km/h (166 kt) IAS Category E: - 307 km/h (166 kt) or more but less than 391 km/h (211 kt) IAS Category H: - helicopter (the stall speed method of calculating aircraft category does not apply)
(IAS = indicated air speed)

P.Name: A
P.Doc: Category A

P.Name: B
P.Doc: Category B.

P.Name: C
P.Doc: Category C.

P.Name: D
P.Doc: Category D.

P.Name: E
P.Doc: Category E.

P.Name: H
P.Doc: Category H - Helicopter.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All aircraft and helicopter categories.

E.Name: CodeFireFighting
E.Doc: A code indicating the category of the fire fighting service provided at the aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: H1
P.Doc: H1 [(Helicopter) rescue and fire category 1..] [note: (ICAO) Up to but not including 15m in length. .]

P.Name: H2
P.Doc: H2 [(Helicopter) rescue and fire category 2..] [note: (ICAO) From 15m up to but not including 24m in length. .]

P.Name: H3
P.Doc: H3 [(Helicopter) rescue and fire category 3..] [note: (ICAO) From 24m up to but not including 35m in length. .]

P.Name: A1
P.Doc: A1 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 1..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 0 up to but not including 9m over-all length and 2m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A2
P.Doc: A2 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 2..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 9m up to but not including 12m over-all length and 2m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A3
P.Doc: A3 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 3..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 12m up to but not including 18m over-all length and 3m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A4
P.Doc: A4 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 4..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 18m up to but not including 24m over-all length and 4m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A5
P.Doc: A5 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 5..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 24m up to but not including 28m over-all length and 4m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A6
P.Doc: A6 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 6..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 28m up to but not including 39m over-all length and 5m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A7
P.Doc: A7 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 7..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 39m up to but not including 49m over-all length and 5m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A8
P.Doc: A8 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 8..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 49m up to but not including 61m over-all length and 7m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A9
P.Doc: A9 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 9..] [note: (ICAO, NATO) 61m up to but not including 76m over-all length and 7m maximum fuselage width. .]

P.Name: A10
P.Doc: A10 [(Aircraft) rescue and fire category 10.] [note: 76m up to but not including 91m over-all length and 8m maximum fuselage width. .]

E.Name: CodeFuel
E.Doc: A code indicating the category of fuel available at an aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: AVGAS
P.Doc: AVGAS [Octane 100 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: AVGAS_LL
P.Doc: AVGAS-LL [Octane 100 Low Lead aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT73
P.Doc: OCT73 [Octane 73 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT80
P.Doc: OCT80 [Octane 80 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT82UL
P.Doc: OCT82UL [Octane 82 low-octane unleaded aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT80_87
P.Doc: OCT80-87 [Octane 80-87 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT91_98
P.Doc: OCT91-98 [Octane 91-98 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT100_130
P.Doc: OCT100-130 [Octane 100-130 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT108_135
P.Doc: OCT108-135 [Octane 108-135 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: OCT115_145
P.Doc: OCT115-145 [Octane 115-145 aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: MOGAS
P.Doc: MOGAS [MOGAS aviation gasoline.]

P.Name: JET
P.Doc: Jet aviation fuel.

P.Name: A
P.Doc: Jet A Aviation fuel.

P.Name: A1
P.Doc: Jet A1 aviation fuel.

P.Name: A1_PLUS

P.Name: B

P.Name: JP1
P.Doc: Jet JP-1 aviation fuel.

P.Name: JP2

P.Name: F18

P.Name: F34

P.Name: F35

P.Name: F40
P.Doc: F-40 [(NATO) jet aviation fuel with FSII - equivalent JP-4.]

P.Name: F44

P.Name: TR0
P.Doc: TR0 [(France) jet TR0 aviation fuel.]

P.Name: TR4

P.Name: TS1

P.Name: RT
P.Doc: RT [(Russia) jet RT aviation fuel.]

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: ALL [All regular fuel types.]

E.Name: CodeOil
E.Doc: A code indicating the category of oil available at an aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: PISTON
P.Doc: Piston engine oil.

P.Name: TURBO
P.Doc: Turbo oil.

P.Name: HYDRAULIC
P.Doc: Hydraulic oil.

E.Name: CodeDMEChannel
E.Doc: A code indicating the channel of a DME.

E.Name: CodeMLSChannel
E.Doc: A code indicating the channel of an MLS.

E.Name: CodeTACANChannel
E.Doc: A code indicating the channel of a TACAN.

E.Name: CodeHelicopterPerformance
E.Doc: A code indicating the performance class of a helicopter.

P.Doc: Helicopter class 1.
Helicopter class 2.
Helicopter class 3.

E.Name: CodeMarkerBeaconSignal
E.Doc: A code indicating the class of a radio marker.

P.Name: FAN
P.Doc: Fan marker.

P.Name: LOW_PWR_FAN
P.Doc: Low powered fan marker.

P.Name: Z
P.Doc: Z marker.

P.Name: BONES
P.Doc: Bone Shaped Fan marker.

E.Name: CodeNDBUsage
E.Doc: A code indicating the class of an NDB.

P.Name: ENR
P.Doc: Enroute NDB.

P.Name: L
P.Doc: Locator - low powered NDB used as an aid for final approach (also known as a compass locator).

P.Name: MAR
P.Doc: Marine beacon.

E.Name: CodeColour
E.Doc: A code indicating a colour. The list of allowable values comprises 'named' colours, not colours being only describable using the RGB or the CYMK or another colour system combination.

P.Name: LIGHT_GREY
P.Doc: Light grey

E.Name: CodeTimeEventCombination
E.Doc: A code indicating which event in a list of events in time should be given precedence over the others. E.g. the earliest or the latest.

E.Name: CodeComparison
E.Doc: A list of comparison operators.

P.Name: LESS_OR_EQUAL
P.Doc: Lower or equal.

P.Name: GREATER_OR_EQUAL
P.Doc: Greater or equal.

E.Name: CodeSurfaceComposition
E.Doc: A code indicating the composition of a surface. For example, asphalt, concrete etc..

P.Name: ASPH_GRASS
P.Doc: Asphalt and grass.

P.Name: CONC_ASPH
P.Doc: Concrete and asphalt.

P.Name: CONC_GRS
P.Doc: Concrete and grass.

P.Name: GRASS
P.Doc: Grass including portions of turf or bare earth.

P.Name: BITUM
P.Doc: Bituminous tar or asphalt and/or oil or bitumen bound, mix-in-place surfaces (often referred to as "earth cement"). [note: A bituminous tar or asphalt surface is prepared by digging up the surface, mixing the material with bitumen or oil binder, and surfacing the surface with the resulting mixture. Bitumen is the family name for tar which is derived from coal, or asphalt which is derived from oil. .]

P.Name: MACADAM
P.Doc: A macadam or tarmac surface consisting of water-bound crushed rock.

P.Name: LATERITE
P.Doc: Laterite - a high iron clay formed in tropical areas.

P.Name: EARTH
P.Doc: Earth (in general).

P.Name: MEMBRANE
P.Doc: A protective laminate usually made of rubber.

P.Name: METAL
P.Doc: Metal - steel, aluminium.

P.Name: MATS
P.Doc: Landing mat portable system usually made of aluminium.

P.Name: PIERCED_STEEL
P.Doc: Pierced steel planking.

P.Name: NON_BITUM_MIX
P.Doc: Non Bituminous mix.

E.Name: CodeSurfaceCondition
E.Doc: A code indicating the condition of a surface, such as a runway, taxiway, the marking of a threshold, etc..

P.Name: UNSAFE
P.Doc: Unsafe for use.

P.Name: DEFORMED
P.Doc: Presenting deformations.

E.Name: CodeDay
E.Doc: A code indicating a particular day. For example, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, the day preceding a holiday, a legal holiday, the day following a holiday, the day preceding a working day, a working day, the day following a working day.

P.Name: WORK_DAY
P.Doc: Working Day. This value indicates any day which is neither a Legal Holiday nor a weekly non-working day.

P.Name: BEF_WORK_DAY
P.Doc: The day preceding a working day.

P.Name: AFT_WORK_DAY
P.Doc: The day after a working day.

P.Name: HOL
P.Doc: Legal Holiday. The value does not include the weekly non-working days (for example, Saturday and Sunday in most European States).

P.Name: BEF_HOL
P.Doc: The day preceding a legal holiday.

P.Name: AFT_HOL
P.Doc: The day after a legal holiday.

P.Name: ANY
P.Doc: Any day.

P.Name: BUSY_FRI
P.Doc: Formally declared as 'Busy Friday' by the authority responsible for aeronautical information provision in the area concerned, in order to activate special traffic management arrangements.

E.Name: CodeAltitudeUse
E.Doc: A code indicating, in situations where both an upper and a lower altitude may be specified, how the altitude information should be interpreted.

P.Name: ABOVE_LOWER
P.Doc: At or above the lower altitude.

P.Name: BELOW_UPPER
P.Doc: At or below the higher altitude.

P.Name: AT_LOWER
P.Doc: At the lower altitude.

P.Name: BETWEEN
P.Doc: Between the lower and the upper altitude.

P.Name: RECOMMENDED
P.Doc: Lower altitude is recommended.

P.Name: EXPECT_LOWER
P.Doc: Expect lower altitude by ATC.

P.Name: AS_ASSIGNED
P.Doc: To be assigned at the time of operations (for example, by ATC)

E.Name: CodeDirection
E.Doc: A code indicating a 1-dimensional direction, for example, forward or backward.

E.Name: CodeDirectionReference
E.Doc: A code indicating a direction with regard to a reference point, e.g. to or from.

P.Name: TO
P.Doc: Towards the reference point.

P.Name: FROM
P.Doc: From the reference point.

E.Name: CodeDirectionTurn
E.Doc: A code indicating the direction of a turn.

P.Name: EITHER
P.Doc: Either left or right.

E.Name: CodeVerticalReference
E.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid; 2) distance based on a difference of pressures, according to the standard atmosphere.

P.Name: SFC
P.Doc: The distance measured from the surface of the Earth (equivalent to AGL - Above Ground Level).

P.Name: MSL
P.Doc: The distance measured from mean sea level (equivalent to altitude).

P.Name: W84
P.Doc: The distance measured from the WGS84 ellipsoid.

P.Name: STD
P.Doc: The vertical distance is measured with an altimeter set to the standard atmosphere.

E.Name: CodeRadioEmission
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of emission, as defined at the 1979 ITU World Administrative Radio Conference. For example, A3E, NONA2a, G1D.

P.Name: A2
P.Doc: Telegraphy, no voice.

P.Name: A3A
P.Doc: Single side-band, reduced carrier.

P.Name: A3B
P.Doc: Two independent side-bands.

P.Name: A3E
P.Doc: AM double side-band telephony.

P.Name: A3H
P.Doc: Single side-band, full carrier.

P.Name: A3J
P.Doc: Single side-band, suppressed carrier.

P.Name: A3L
P.Doc: Lower single side-band, carrier unknown.

P.Name: A3U
P.Doc: Upper single side-band, carrier unknown

P.Name: J3E
P.Doc: AM double side-band suppressed carrier telephony.

P.Name: NONA1A
P.Doc: Unmod trans. morse ident. carrier emission interrupted.

P.Name: NONA2A
P.Doc: Unmod. trans. morse ident. carrier emission continuous.

P.Name: A8W
P.Doc: AM (unkeyed) plus ON/OFF keying of ident tone.

P.Name: A9W
P.Doc: Composite AM/FM (unkeyed) plus ON/OFF keying of ident tone.

P.Name: NOX
P.Doc: Unmodulated carrier.

P.Name: G1D
P.Doc: DPSK Data Transmission.

E.Name: CodeFlowConditionOperation
E.Doc: A coded value used to indicate a type of operation combining an elementary flow condition or a previously defined combination of flow conditions with another elementary flow condition or previously defined combination.

P.Name: AND
P.Doc: 1st condition fulfilled AND 2nd condition fulfilled.

P.Name: ANDNOT
P.Doc: 1st condition fulfilled AND 2nd condition NOT fulfilled.

P.Name: OR
P.Doc: 1st condition fulfilled OR 2nd condition fulfilled.

P.Name: SEQ
P.Doc: 1st condition is fulfilled BEFORE 2nd condition is fulfilled.

P.Name: NONE
P.Doc: No operation (used for flows identified by a single condition).

E.Name: CodeFlightStatus
E.Doc: A code indicating status of a flight.

P.Name: HEAD
P.Doc: Head of state.

P.Name: STATE
P.Doc: State aircraft. (Other than head of state).

P.Name: HUM
P.Doc: Humanitarian flight.

P.Name: HOSP
P.Doc: Hospital flight.

P.Name: SAR
P.Doc: Search and rescue.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All aircraft types.

P.Name: EMERGENCY
P.Doc: The aircraft has declared an emergency situation.

E.Name: CodeFlight
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of a flight.

P.Name: OAT
P.Doc: Operational air traffic.

P.Name: GAT
P.Doc: General air traffic.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: Both Operational and General Air Traffic.

E.Name: CodeProcedureFixRole
E.Doc: A code indicating the role of a fix within an instrument approach procedure. Examples: initial approach fix, final approach fix, missed approach point, etc.

P.Name: IAF
P.Doc: Initial approach fix.

P.Name: IF
P.Doc: Intermediate fix.

P.Name: IF_IAF
P.Doc: Intermediate Fix or an Initial Approach Fix

P.Name: FAF
P.Doc: Final approach fix.

P.Name: VDP
P.Doc: (FAA AIM) Visual descent point. The VDP is a defined point on the final approach course of a non precision straight-in approach procedure from which normal descent from the MDA to the runway touchdown point may be commenced, provided visual reference required by 14 CFR Section 91.175(c)(3) is established.

P.Name: SDF
P.Doc: Step down fix.

P.Name: FPAP
P.Doc: Flight Path Alignment Point.

P.Name: FTP
P.Doc: Fictitious threshold point. The equivalent of the landing threshold point (LTP) when the final approach course is offset from runway centreline. It is the intersection of the final course and a line perpendicular to the final course that passes through the LTP. Offset direction L/R distance from centreline

P.Name: FROP
P.Doc:
Final Rollout Point - Where a course change is required within the Final Approach Segment (FAS), the point that the aircraft rolls to a wings-level attitude aligned with the runway centreline extended is considered the FROP.
FROP is used in an RNP-SAAAR procedure when a turn is required in the final between the FAF and the threshold.

P.Name: TP
P.Doc: Turn Point

P.Name: MAPT
P.Doc: Missed approach point.

P.Name: MAHF
P.Doc: Missed approach holding fix.

E.Name: CodeLevelTableDesignator
E.Doc: A code identifying the table of discreet cruising levels. For example, ICAO IFR, ICAO VFR, ICAO RVSM, etc..

P.Name: IFR
P.Doc: ICAO IFR

P.Name: IFR_METRES
P.Doc: ICAO IFR in meters.

P.Name: VFR
P.Doc: ICAO VFR

P.Name: VFR_METRES
P.Doc: ICAO VFR in meters

P.Name: IFR_RVSM
P.Doc: ICAO IFR in areas with RVSM

P.Name: IFR_METRES_RVSM
P.Doc: ICAO IFR in meters in areas with RVSM

P.Name: VFR_RVMS
P.Doc: ICAO VFR in areas with RVSM.

P.Name: VFR_METRES_RVSM
P.Doc: ICAO VFR in meters in areas with RVSM.

E.Name: CodeRouteOrigin
E.Doc: Code indicating if a route is international or domestic.

E.Name: CodeLightIntensity
E.Doc: A code indicating the intensity level of a light source. For example, LIL, LIM, LIH, etc.

P.Name: LIL
P.Doc: Light intensity low.

P.Name: LIM
P.Doc: Light intensity medium.

P.Name: LIH
P.Doc: Light intensity high.

P.Name: LIL_LIH
P.Doc: Low intensity for night use; high intensity for day use, as determined by a photo-cell.

P.Name: PREDETERMINED
P.Doc: A predetermined intensity step, in the approach lighting system that takes precedence for air-to-ground radio control over the runway lighting system which is set, based on expected visibility conditions.

E.Name: CodeAviationStandards
E.Doc: A code indicating the standard referred to by a list of values, in case where different aviation authorities use different categorisation criteria.

P.Name: ICAO
P.Doc: The values refer to ICAO standards.

P.Name: IATA
P.Doc: The values refer to IATA standards.

P.Name: NATO
P.Doc: The values refer to NATO military standards.

P.Name: FAA
P.Doc: The values refer to US FAA standards.

E.Name: CodeLevel
E.Doc: A code indicating the level: upper airspace, lower airspace or both.

P.Name: UPPER
P.Doc: Upper airspace.

P.Name: LOWER
P.Doc: Lower airspace.

P.Name: BOTH
P.Doc: Both upper and lower airspace.

E.Name: CodeMilitaryStatus
E.Doc: A code distinguishing between military and civil status.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: Both civil and military.

E.Name: CodeAirspaceAggregation
E.Doc: An 'operator' in coded form according to which two 'operands' will be 'associated' in order to produce a result.

P.Name: BASE
P.Doc: 'Parent' airspace is the basis for subsequent operations.

P.Name: UNION
P.Doc: 'Parent' airspace is second operand in a union operation.

P.Name: INTERS
P.Doc: 'Parent' airspace is second operand in intersection operation.

P.Name: SUBTR
P.Doc: 'Parent' airspace is second operand in subtraction operation.

E.Name: CodeFlightOrigin
E.Doc: A coded list of values indicating the source of a flight (local, national, international, etc.)

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: Any origin.

P.Name: HOME_BASED
P.Doc: The flight is operated with an aircraft currently stationed at the airport in question.

E.Name: CodePCNMethod
E.Doc: A code indicating the method used in the evaluation of a PCN number.

P.Name: TECH
P.Doc: [T] Technical evaluation.

P.Name: ACFT
P.Doc: [U] Based on aircraft experience.

E.Name: CodePCNTyrePressure
E.Doc: A code indicating the maximum allowable tyre pressure category related to a PCN number.

P.Name: W
P.Doc: High: No pressure limit.

P.Name: X
P.Doc: Medium: Pressure limited to 1.5 MPa (217 psi).

P.Name: Y
P.Doc: Low: Pressure limited to 1.00 MPa (145 psi).

P.Name: Z
P.Doc: Very low: Pressure limited to 0.50 MPa (73 psi).

E.Name: CodePCNSubgrade
E.Doc: A code indicating the sub-grade strength category related to a PCN number.

P.Name: A
P.Doc: High strength sub-grade.

P.Name: B
P.Doc: Medium strength sub-grade.

P.Name: C
P.Doc: Low strength sub-grade.

P.Name: D
P.Doc: Ultra-low strength sub-grade.

E.Name: CodePCNPavement
E.Doc: A code indicating the pavement behaviour (rigid or flexible) used for the ACN determination.

P.Name: RIGID
P.Doc: [R] Rigid pavement.

P.Name: FLEXIBLE
P.Doc: [F] Flexible pavement.

E.Name: CodeProcedurePhase
E.Doc: A code indicating a phase of a SID, STAR or IAP.

P.Name: RWY
P.Doc: Runway transition.

P.Name: COMMON
P.Doc: Common route

P.Name: EN_ROUTE
P.Doc: En-route transition

P.Name: APPROACH
P.Doc: Approach transition (IAP only)

P.Name: FINAL
P.Doc: Final transition (IAP only).

P.Name: MISSED
P.Doc: Missed approach (IAP only)

P.Name: MISSED_P
P.Doc: Primary Missed Approach (IAP only)

P.Name: MISSED_S
P.Doc: Secondary Missed Approach (IAP only)

P.Name: ENGINE_OUT
P.Doc: Engine out (SID only)

E.Name: CodeSurfacePreparation
E.Doc: A code indicating the preparation technique for a surface area.

P.Name: NATURAL
P.Doc: Natural surface; no treatment.

P.Name: GROOVED
P.Doc: Cut or plastic grooved.

P.Name: PFC
P.Doc: Porous friction coat.

P.Name: AFSC
P.Doc: Aggregate friction seal coat.

P.Name: RFSC
P.Doc: Rubberised friction seal coat.

P.Name: NON_GROOVED
P.Doc: This covers such items as 'APSHALT NON GROOVED' .

E.Name: CodeApronSection
E.Doc: A code indicating a location on the surface of an apron. For example: apron edge.

P.Name: EDGE
P.Doc: Apron edge.

E.Name: CodePositionInILS
E.Doc: A code indicating a position in the ILS system. For example, outer, middle, inner, backcourse.

E.Name: CodeSide
E.Doc: A code describing a position, relative to an axis. For example: left/right of runway centreline.

P.Name: LEFT
P.Doc: On the left side of the axis.

P.Name: RIGHT
P.Doc: On the right side of the axis.

P.Name: BOTH
P.Doc: Distributed on both sides of the axis.

E.Name: CodeRunwaySection
E.Doc: A code indicating the position of an item on a surface of a runway. Eg: THR, runway end, runway centre line, TDZ, etc.

P.Name: TDZ
P.Doc: Touch down zone.

P.Name: AIM
P.Doc: Aiming point.

P.Name: CL
P.Doc: Centre line.

P.Name: DESIG
P.Doc: Runway designation.

P.Name: AFT_THR
P.Doc: After threshold (for fixed distance markings.)

P.Name: DTHR
P.Doc: Displaced threshold.

P.Name: END
P.Doc: Runway end.

P.Name: TWY_INT
P.Doc: Taxiway intersection.

P.Name: RPD_TWY_INT
P.Doc: Rapid taxiway intersection.

P.Name: 1_THIRD
P.Doc: The first third of the runway, starting from the threshold with the lower designation number.

P.Name: 2_THIRD
P.Doc: The second third of the runway, starting from the threshold with the lower designation number.

P.Name: 3_THIRD
P.Doc: The last third of the runway, starting from the threshold with the lower designation number.

E.Name: CodeTLOFSection
E.Doc: A code indicating the position of an item on the surface of a Touch Down and Lift-off Area.

P.Name: AIM
P.Doc: Aiming point.

P.Name: EDGE
P.Doc: TLOF edge.

E.Name: CodeTaxiwaySection
E.Doc: A code indicating the position of an item on the surface of a taxiway.

P.Name: CL
P.Doc: Centre line.

P.Name: END
P.Doc: Taxiway end.

P.Name: RWY_INT
P.Doc: Runway intersections.

P.Name: TWY_INT
P.Doc: Taxiway intersections.

E.Name: CodeFlightPurpose
E.Doc: A coded list of values indicating the nature of a flight (scheduled, non-scheduled, private, etc.)

P.Name: SCHEDULED
P.Doc: A commercial flight (carrying passenger or cargo for a pay) that takes place in accordance with an airlines published regular timetable, as opposed to a charter flight or special flight.

P.Name: NON_SCHEDULED
P.Doc: A commercial charter or special flight executed by an airline, not published in a regular timetable.

P.Name: PRIVATE
P.Doc: A flight executed for the benefit of the aircraft owner and not for commercial purpose.

P.Name: AIR_TRAINING
P.Doc: A flight executed in order to develop or test the flying skills of the crew on board the aircraft.

P.Name: AIR_WORK
P.Doc: Operations in which an aircraft is used for specialized services.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All flight purpose.

P.Name: PARTICIPANT
P.Doc: Aircraft participating in a specified activity.

E.Name: CodeLocationQualifier
E.Doc: A code qualifying a location (such as an airspace, aerodrome, point, etc.) in relation with a flight or with its availability.

P.Name: DEP
P.Doc: Departing from location.

P.Name: XNG
P.Doc: Crossing location.

P.Name: ARR
P.Doc: Arriving at location.

P.Name: ACT
P.Doc: Location is active.

P.Name: AVBL
P.Doc: Location is available.

E.Name: CodeATCReporting
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of position report required by an ATC Unit. Eg.: compulsory or on request.

P.Name: ON_REQUEST
P.Doc: On request.

P.Name: NO_REPORT
P.Doc: No report.

E.Name: CodeRouteAvailability
E.Doc: A code indicating the route segment availability.

P.Name: OPEN
P.Doc: the route segment may be flown according to its timetable.

P.Name: COND
P.Doc: Special use. note: This value is needed as long as 'special' types of routes exist. Examples:- routes which are closed during some time periods, but still may be used for landings on a specified aerodrome;- flights may be performed below the minimum level of the route in order to arrive at a specified aerodrome.

E.Name: CodeRVSMPointRole
E.Doc: A code indicating that the point has a specific role in the RVSM context.

P.Name: IN
P.Doc: RVSM Entry Point.

P.Name: OUT
P.Doc: RVSM Exit point.

P.Name: IN_OUT
P.Doc: RVSM Entry/Exit Point.

E.Name: CodeSpecialDate
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of a special date, such as 'holiday', 'busy Friday', etc.

P.Name: HOL
P.Doc: Legal holiday.

P.Name: BUSY_FRI
P.Doc: Busy Friday. note: The main usage is related to conditional weekend routes, when early access is allowed on Friday these routes. Such 'busy Fridays' are typically declared in AIP Supplements.

E.Name: CodeSpeedReference
E.Doc: A code indicating the reference system for a speed value.

P.Name: IAS
P.Doc: Indicated airspeed.

P.Name: TAS
P.Doc: True air speed.

P.Name: GS
P.Doc: Ground speed.

E.Name: CodeTimeEvent
E.Doc: A code indicating an event occurrence during any day. For example, sunrise, sunset.

E.Name: CodeTimeReference
E.Doc: A coded indication of a time reference system - UTC or local.

P.Name: UTC
P.Doc: Co-ordinated Universal Time

P.Name: UTC-12
P.Doc: UTC minus 12 hours.

P.Name: UTC-11
P.Doc: UTC minus 11 hours.

P.Name: UTC-10
P.Doc: UTC minus 10 hours.

P.Name: UTC-9
P.Doc: UTC minus 9 hours.

P.Name: UTC-8
P.Doc: UTC minus 8 hours.

P.Name: UTC-7
P.Doc: UTC minus 7 hours.

P.Name: UTC-6
P.Doc: UTC minus 6 hours.

P.Name: UTC-5
P.Doc: UTC minus 5 hours.

P.Name: UTC-4
P.Doc: UTC minus 4 hours.

P.Name: UTC-3
P.Doc: UTC minus 3 hours.

P.Name: UTC-2
P.Doc: UTC minus 2 hours.

P.Name: UTC-1
P.Doc: UTC minus 1 hour.

P.Name: UTC+1
P.Doc: UTC plus 1 hour.

P.Name: UTC+2
P.Doc: UTC plus 2 hours.

P.Name: UTC+3
P.Doc: UTC plus 3 hours

P.Name: UTC+4
P.Doc: UTC plus 4 hours

P.Name: UTC+5
P.Doc: UTC plus 5 hours

P.Name: UTC+6
P.Doc: UTC plus 6 hours.

P.Name: UTC+7
P.Doc: UTC plus 7 hours.

P.Name: UTC+8
P.Doc: UTC plus 8 hours.

P.Name: UTC+9
P.Doc: UTC plus 9 hours.

P.Name: UTC+10
P.Doc: UTC plus 10 hours.

P.Name: UTC+11
P.Doc: UTC plus 11 hours.

P.Name: UTC+12
P.Doc: UTC plus 12 hours.

P.Name: UTC+13
P.Doc: UTC plus 13 hours.

P.Name: UTC+14
P.Doc: UTC plus 14 hours.

E.Name: CodeAircraft
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of an aircraft

P.Name: TILT_WING
P.Doc: Tilt-wing aircraft

P.Name: STOL
P.Doc: Short Take-Off and Landing (STOL)

P.Name: ULTRA_LIGHT
P.Doc: Ultra light

P.Name: UAV
P.Doc: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) drone

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All aircraft types.

E.Name: CodeAircraftEngine
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of aircraft engine (for example, jet, piston, turbo).

P.Name: JET
P.Doc: Jet Engine

P.Name: PISTON
P.Doc: Piston Engine

P.Name: TURBOPROP
P.Doc: Turbo Propeller Engine

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All aircraft engine types.

E.Name: CodeAirportHeliport
E.Doc: A code specifying whether a particular entity occurrence is an Aerodrome or a Heliport.

P.Name: AD
P.Doc: Aerodrome only.

P.Name: AH
P.Doc: Aerodrome with heliport landing area.

P.Name: HP
P.Doc: Heliport only.

P.Name: LS
P.Doc: Landing site.

E.Name: CodeAirportHeliportCollocation
E.Doc: A code indicating the extent of collocation between two airports/heliports.

P.Name: FULL
P.Doc: Full collocation, there is only one aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: RWY
P.Doc: The two aerodromes share all their RWYs and TWYs, but not their aprons.

P.Name: PARTIAL
P.Doc: Partial collocation, the RWYs of the 1st aerodrome are available to the traffic on the 2nd aerodrome..]

P.Name: UNILATERAL
P.Doc: Unilateral co-location, the RWYs, the TWYs and the aprons of the 1st aerodrome are available to traffic on the 2nd aerodrome.

P.Name: SEPARATED
P.Doc: Separated. Even if it is physically possible for an aircraft to taxi between the two aerodrome's manoeuvring areas, this is not operationally allowed.

E.Name: CodeGroundLighting
E.Doc: A code indicating a type of aeronautical ground light. For example, Marine, RWY BCN, ABN, IBN, etc.

P.Name: IBN
P.Doc: Identification Beacon

P.Name: HEL_BCN
P.Doc: Heliport Beacon

P.Name: ABN
P.Doc: Airport Beacon

P.Name: MAR_BCN
P.Doc: Marine Beacon

P.Name: RSP_BCN
P.Doc: Responder Beacon

P.Name: TWR_BCN
P.Doc: Control tower signalling beacon

P.Name: HAZ_BCN
P.Doc: An aeronautical beacon used to designate a danger to air navigation.

E.Name: CodeApproachLighting
E.Doc: A regional or organisation specific classification of the Runway approach lighting system equipment. Could also be a brand name.

P.Name: ALSAF
P.Doc: 3000 Foot high intensity Approach Lighting System with Sequenced Flashing Lights.

P.Name: MALS
P.Doc: 1400 Foot Medium Intensity Approach Lighting System.

P.Name: MALSR
P.Doc: 1400 Foot Medium Intensity Approach Lighting System with Runway Alignment Indicator Lights.

P.Name: SALS
P.Doc: Simple Approach Lighting System.

P.Name: SSALS
P.Doc: Simplified Short Approach Lighting System.

P.Name: SSALR
P.Doc: Simplified Short Approach Lighting System with Runway Alignment Indicator Lights.

P.Name: LDIN
P.Doc: Lead-In Lighting System.

P.Name: ODALS
P.Doc: Omni Directional Approach Lighting System.

P.Name: AFOVRN
P.Doc: US Air Force Overrun 1000 Foot Standard Approach Lighting System.

P.Name: MILOVRN
P.Doc: Military Overrun.

P.Name: CALVERT
P.Doc: Calvert Approach Lighting System

E.Name: CodeBearing
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of angle: magnetic, bearing, VOR radial.

P.Name: TRUE
P.Doc: True bearing.

P.Name: MAG
P.Doc: Magnetic bearing.

P.Name: RDL
P.Doc: VOR radial.

E.Name: CodeAirspace
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicates a type of airspace.

P.Name: NAS
P.Doc: National Airspace System. [note: The airspace within which a State provides Air Traffic Services is usually composed of:1) the territories over which the State has jurisdiction;2) those portions of the airspace over the high seas or in airspace of undetermined sovereignty where the provision of ATS are provided as determined by regional agreements. It can usually be determined by the UNION of FIRs (including, where appropriate, NO-FIRs) of the UNION of NAS-P. .]

P.Name: FIR
P.Doc: Flight information region. Airspace of defined dimensions within which flight information service and alerting service are provided. Description: ICAO Recognized. Might, for example, be used if service provided by more than one unit.

P.Name: FIR_P
P.Doc: Part of an FIR.

P.Name: UIR
P.Doc: Upper flight information region. An upper airspace of defined dimensions within which flight information service and alerting service are provided. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Each state determines its definition for upper airspace.

P.Name: UIR_P
P.Doc: Part of a UIR. [note: Might, for example, be used if more than one unites provide service in different parts of a UIR .]

P.Name: CTA
P.Doc: Control area. A controlled airspace extending upwards from a specified limit above the earth. Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: CTA_P
P.Doc: Part of a CTA.

P.Name: OCA_P
P.Doc: Part of an OCA.

P.Name: OCA
P.Doc: Oceanic control area. A Control Area extending upwards in the upper airspace. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: UTA
P.Doc: Upper control area. A Control Area extending upwards in the upper airspace. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: UTA_P
P.Doc: Part of a UTA.

P.Name: TMA
P.Doc: Terminal control area. Control area normally established at the confluence of ATS routes in the vicinity of one or more major aerodromes. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Mainly used in Europe under the Flexible Use of Airspace concept.

P.Name: TMA_P
P.Doc: Part of a TMA.

P.Name: CTR
P.Doc: Control zone. A controlled airspace extending upwards from the surface of the earth to a specified upper limit. Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: CTR_P
P.Doc: Part of a CTR.

P.Name: OTA
P.Doc: Oceanic transition area.

P.Name: SECTOR
P.Doc: Control sector. A subdivision of a designated control area within which responsibility is assigned to one controller or to a small group of controllers. Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: SECTOR_C
P.Doc: Temporary consolidated (collapsed) sector.

P.Name: TSA
P.Doc: Temporary segregated area (FUA). Airspace of pre-defined dimensions within which activities require the reservation of airspace for the exclusive use of specific users during a predetermined period of time. Description: (NATO) An area in which there are special restrictive measures employed to prevent or minimize interference between friendly forces. An area under military jurisdiction in which special security measures are employed to prevent unauthorized entry.

P.Name: CBA
P.Doc: Cross border area (FUA). Airspace of defined dimensions, above the land areas or territorial waters of more than one state. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Mainly used in Europe under the Flexible Use of Airspace concept.

P.Name: RCA
P.Doc: Reduced co-ordination area (FUA). Portion of airspace of defined dimensions within which general aviation traffic is permitted "off-route" without requiring general aviation traffic controllers to initiate co-ordination with OAT controllers. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Mainly used in Europe under the Flexible Use of Airspace concept.

P.Name: RAS
P.Doc: Regulated airspace (not otherwise covered).

P.Name: AWY
P.Doc: Airway (corridor). A control area or portion thereof established in the form of a corridor.

P.Name: MTR
P.Doc: Military Training Route buffer. A control area or portion thereof, established in the form of a corridor around a military training route in order to protect it from other traffic.

P.Name: P
P.Doc: Prohibited area. Airspace of defined dimensions, above the land areas or territorial waters of a State, within which the flight of aircraft is prohibited. Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: R
P.Doc: Restricted area. Airspace of defined dimensions, above the land areas or territorial waters of a State, within which the flight of aircraft is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions. Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: D
P.Doc: Danger area. Airspace of defined dimensions within which activities dangerous to the flight of aircraft may exist at specified times. Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: ADIZ
P.Doc: Air Defence Identification Zone. Special designated airspace of defined dimensions within which aircraft are required to comply with special identification and/or reporting procedures additional to those related to the provision of air traffic services (ATS). Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: NO_FIR
P.Doc: Airspace for which not even an FIR is defined. [note: There are parts in the world for which there is neither an FIR nor any other airspace-type is defined. These airspaces will be marked as NO-FIR .]

P.Name: PART
P.Doc: Part of an airspace (used in airspace aggregation).

P.Name: CLASS
P.Doc: Airspace having a specified class.

P.Name: POLITICAL
P.Doc: Political/administrative area.

P.Name: D_OTHER
P.Doc: Activities of dangerous nature (other than a danger area).

P.Name: TRA
P.Doc: Temporary reserved area (FUA). Airspace of pre-defined dimensions within which activities require the reservation of airspace during a predetermined period of time. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Mainly used in Europe under the Flexible Use of Airspace concept.

P.Name: A
P.Doc: Alert area. Airspace which may contain a high volume of pilot training activities or unusual type of aerial activity, neither of which is hazardous to aircraft. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Mainly used in contiguous United States and its territories.

P.Name: W
P.Doc: Warning area. A non-regulatory airspace of defined dimensions designated over international waters that contains activity which may be hazardous to aircraft not participating in the activity. The purpose of such warning areas is to warn non participating pilots of the potential danger. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Mainly used in contiguous United States and its territories.

P.Name: PROTECT
P.Doc: Airspace protected from specific air traffic.

P.Name: AMA
P.Doc: Minimum altitude area. The lowest altitude to be used under instrument meteorological conditions (IMC) which will provide a minimum vertical clearance of 300 m (1 000 ft) or in designated mountainous terrain 600 m (2 000 ft) above all obstacles located in the area specified. Description: ICAO Recognized. Published by many States as rectangles of 1 x 1 degree on the ENR 6 charts. Note - In the exact calculation 984 feet can be used as an equivalent to 300 metres.

P.Name: ASR
P.Doc: Altimeter setting region. Airspace of defined dimensions within which standardized altimeter setting procedures apply. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. For example, during flight the altimeter shall be set to the current altimeter setting of the nearest station along the route of flight.

P.Name: ADV
P.Doc: Advisory Area. An area of defined dimensions within which air traffic advisory service is available. Description: ICAO Recognized. Air traffic control service provides a much more complete service than air traffic advisory service; advisory areas and routes are therefore not established within controlled airspace, but air traffic advisory service may be provided below and above.

P.Name: UADV
P.Doc: Upper Advisory Area. An area of defined dimensions in upper airspace within which air traffic advisory service is available. Description: ICAO Recognized. Air traffic control service provides a much more complete service than air traffic advisory service; advisory areas and routes are therefore not established within controlled airspace, but air traffic advisory service may be provided below and above.

P.Name: ATZ
P.Doc: Airport Traffic Zone. Airspace of defined dimensions established around an airport for the protection of airport traffic. Description: ICAO Recognized.

P.Name: ATZ_P
P.Doc: Part of an airport traffic zone

P.Name: HTZ
P.Doc: Helicopter traffic zone

P.Name: NAS_P
P.Doc: A part of a national airspace system

E.Name: CodeAuthority
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of responsibility that one organisation/authority has for an aeronautical feature (for example, an airspace).

P.Name: OWN
P.Doc: An authority has the legal right of possession and proprietorship over the feature.

P.Name: DLGT
P.Doc: An authority is assigned or entrusted with the responsibility for that feature.

P.Name: AIS
P.Doc: The organization is responsible for the provision of aeronautical information in relation with that feature.

E.Name: CodeAirspacePointRole
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of association between a significant point and an airspace. For example, entry point, exit point, etc..

P.Name: ENTRY
P.Doc: The first reporting point, determined by reference to a significant point, over which an aircraft passes or is expected to pass upon entering an airspace.

P.Name: EXIT
P.Doc: Exit point. The last reporting point, determined by reference to a significant point, over which an aircraft passes or is expected to pass before leaving an airspace.

P.Name: ENTRY_EXIT
P.Doc: Entry/exit point. The first or the last reporting point, determined by reference to a significant point, over which an aircraft passes or is expected to pass upon entering or before leaving an airspace.

E.Name: CodeOrganisationHierarchy
E.Doc: The values indicating the type of association between two organisations/authorities.

P.Name: MEMBER
P.Doc: Child ORG is a member of the parent ORG.

P.Name: OWNED_BY
P.Doc: Indicates that the current feature is hierarchically positioned immediately below the parent organisation.

P.Name: SUPERVISED_BY
P.Doc: Indicates that the current feature is under the supervision of the parent organisation.

E.Name: CodeMLSAzimuth
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of azimuth equipment: normal or backward.

E.Name: CodeCourse
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of course to be observed. For example, true track, magnetic track, heading, VOR radial, true bearing, magnetic bearing.

P.Name: TRUE_TRACK
P.Doc: True track.

P.Name: MAG_TRACK
P.Doc: Magnetic track.

P.Name: TRUE_BRG
P.Doc: True bearing.

P.Name: MAG_BRG
P.Doc: Magnetic bearing.

P.Name: RDL
P.Doc: VOR radial.

E.Name: CodeDeclaredDistance
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of conventional declared distance for a runway. For example, TORA, TODA, LDA, etc...

P.Name: LDA
P.Doc: Landing distance available

P.Name: TORA
P.Doc: Take-off run available

P.Name: TODA
P.Doc: Take-off distance available

P.Name: ASDA
P.Doc: Accelerate-stop distance available

P.Name: DTHR
P.Doc: Threshold displacement (from the physical start of the runway direction).

P.Name: TODAH
P.Doc: Take-Off Distance Available for Helicopters

P.Name: RTODAH
P.Doc: Rejected TODA for Helicopters

P.Name: LDAH
P.Doc: LDA for Helicopters

E.Name: CodeDesignatedPoint
E.Doc: A code indicating a specific type of designated point, in direct relation with the designator allocated to that point.

P.Name: ICAO
P.Doc: ICAO 5 letter name code designator.

P.Name: COORD
P.Doc: Point with identifier derived from its geographical coordinates.

P.Name: CNF
P.Doc: Computer Navigation Fix - A point used for the purpose of defining the navigation track for an airborne computer system (i.e., GPS or FMS). CNFs include unnamed DME fixes, beginning and ending points of DME arcs and sensor final approach fixes (FAFs) on some GPS overlay approaches.

P.Name: DESIGNED
P.Doc: A point with bearing/distance designator used as control point for procedure design, which is not published.

P.Name: MTR
P.Doc: Point used on a military training route.

P.Name: TERMINAL
P.Doc: Point with a five-alphanumeric name-code, used as waypoint in RNAV procedures and which does not have a globally unique ICAO 5-letter designator.

P.Name: BRG_DIST
P.Doc: Point with a five-alphanumeric name-code, composed according to the rules provided by the ARINC 424 Specification for unnamed bearing/distance reference waypoints.

E.Name: CodeDME
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of UHF distance measuring equipment.

P.Name: NARROW
P.Doc: DME/N, narrow spectrum characteristics.

P.Name: PRECISION
P.Doc: DME/P, improved accuracy compared to DME/N

P.Name: WIDE
P.Doc: DME/W, wide spectrum characteristics.

E.Name: CodeFlightRule
E.Doc: Flight rules to be observed by aircraft. For example, VFR and/or IFR.

P.Name: IFR
P.Doc: Instrument flight rules (IFR)

P.Name: VFR
P.Doc: Visual flight rules (VFR)

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: Both IFR and VFR.

E.Name: CodeGeoBorder
E.Doc: The type of geographical border. The most common situation is the border between two countries.

P.Name: STATE
P.Doc: State border.

P.Name: WATER
P.Doc: Territorial waters limit.

P.Name: RIVER
P.Doc: River centreline.

P.Name: BANK
P.Doc: River bank.

E.Name: CodeHoldingUsage
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of holding procedure. For example, en-route holding, terminal area holding.

P.Name: ENR
P.Doc: En-route holding.

P.Name: TER
P.Doc: Terminal area holding.

E.Name: CodeLightSource
E.Doc: A code indicating a type of light source, such as strobe or flood.

P.Name: FLOOD
P.Doc: Flood light. [note: This indicates that the light source contains a large powerful lamp that produces a strong broad beam of artificial light and is used to illuminate the outside at night. .]

P.Name: STROBE
P.Doc: Strobe light. [note: This indicates that the light source contains a high intensity flashing beam of light produced by charging a capacitor to a very high voltage then discharging it as a high-intensity flash of light in a tube. .]

E.Name: CodeMilitaryOperations
E.Doc: A code indicating in terms of civil or military, the type of operations.

P.Name: CIVIL
P.Doc: Only Civil Air traffic is concerned.

P.Name: MIL
P.Doc: Only Military Air traffic is concerned.

P.Name: JOINT
P.Doc: Both Civil and Military air traffic are concerned.

E.Name: CodeRadioFrequencyArea
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of radio navigation aid limitation.

P.Name: COV
P.Doc: Actual coverage range (flight checked). Equivalent to Operational Service Volume.

P.Name: T_COV
P.Doc: Theoretical coverage range (not flight checked). Equivalent to Standard Service Volume.

P.Name: RHG
P.Doc: Roughness (signal roughness experienced).

P.Name: RES
P.Doc: Restricted (use is restricted to defined sectors).

P.Name: UUS
P.Doc: Un-usability (use is not permitted in the defined sectors).

P.Name: OUT
P.Doc: Out of tolerance.

P.Name: ESV
P.Doc: Extended Service Volume (Coverage)

E.Name: CodeNitrogen
E.Doc: A code describing the type of nitrogen supplies for aviation usage.

P.Name: LPNG
P.Doc: Low pressure nitrogen serving.

P.Name: HPNG
P.Doc: High pressure nitrogen servicing.

P.Name: LHNG
P.Doc: Low and high pressure nitrogen servicing.

P.Name: LNG
P.Doc: Liquid nitrogen servicing.

P.Name: NGRB
P.Doc: Nitrogen replacement bottles.

P.Name: HNGRB
P.Doc: High pressure nitrogen replacement bottles.

P.Name: LNGRB
P.Doc: Low pressure nitrogen replacement bottles.

P.Name: NG
P.Doc: Indicates nitrogen servicing when type of servicing is unspecified.

E.Name: CodeNorthReference
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of the North reference used.

P.Name: TRUE
P.Doc: True north.

P.Name: MAG
P.Doc: Magnetic north.

P.Name: GRID
P.Doc: The direction of the north-south lines of the Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) grid imposed on topographic maps by the United States and NATO.

E.Name: CodeOrganisation
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of an Organisation/Authority. For example, State, Association of States, International Organisation, etc..

P.Name: STATE_GROUP
P.Doc: Group of States.

P.Name: ORG
P.Doc: Organisation within a State.

P.Name: INTL_ORG
P.Doc: International organisation.

P.Name: ACFT_OPR
P.Doc: Aircraft operating agency.

P.Name: HANDLING_AGENCY
P.Doc: Handling agency.

P.Name: NTL_AUTH
P.Doc: National authority.

P.Name: ATS
P.Doc: Air traffic services provider.

P.Name: COMMERCIAL
P.Doc: Other commercial organisation.

E.Name: CodeOxygen
E.Doc: A code describing the type of oxygen supplies for aviation usage.

P.Name: LPOX
P.Doc: Low pressure oxygen servicing.

P.Name: HPOX
P.Doc: High pressure oxygen servicing.

P.Name: LHOX
P.Doc: Low and high pressure oxygen servicing.

P.Name: LOX
P.Doc: Liquid oxygen servicing.

P.Name: OXRB
P.Doc: Oxygen replacement bottles.

P.Name: HOXRB
P.Doc: High pressure oxygen replacement bottles.

P.Name: LOXRB
P.Doc: Low pressure oxygen replacement bottles.

P.Name: OX
P.Doc: Indicates oxygen servicing when type of servicing is unspecified.

E.Name: CodeSegmentPath
E.Doc: A code that defines a specific type of flight path and a specific type of termination of that flight path. Although we agree with the ARINC idea that procedures should be designed with the aim to permit FMS equipped aircraft to fly tracks instead of procedural headings, for the time being we must allow all representation of these procedures (especially reversal procedures) as they are published by the States. This is the explanation of the differences between the allowable values for attributes in this domain and the ARINC leg types.

P.Name: AF
P.Doc: (ARINC) constant DME arc to a fix.

P.Name: HF
P.Doc: (ARINC) hold pattern terminating at a fix after one circuit.

P.Name: HA
P.Doc: (ARINC) hold pattern term. at fix after reach. an altitude.

P.Name: HM
P.Doc: (ARINC) holding pattern terminating manually.

P.Name: IF
P.Doc: (ARINC) initial fix.

P.Name: PI
P.Doc: (ARINC) procedure turn followed by a course to a fix (CF).

P.Name: PT
P.Doc: (non ARINC) timed outbound leg to a procedure turn.

P.Name: TF
P.Doc: (ARINC) track between two fixes.

P.Name: CA
P.Doc: (ARINC) course to an altitude.

P.Name: CD
P.Doc: (ARINC) course to a DME distance.

P.Name: CI
P.Doc: (ARINC) course to next leg followed by course oriented leg.

P.Name: CR
P.Doc: (ARINC) course to a radial termination.

P.Name: CF
P.Doc: (ARINC) course to a fix.

P.Name: DF
P.Doc: (ARINC) Computed track direct to a fix.

P.Name: FA
P.Doc: (ARINC) course from a fix to an altitude.

P.Name: FC
P.Doc: (ARINC) course from a fix to a distance.

P.Name: FT
P.Doc: (non ARINC) course from a fix during a specified time.

P.Name: FM
P.Doc: (ARINC) course from a fix to a manual termination.

P.Name: VM
P.Doc: (ARINC) heading to a manual termination.

P.Name: FD
P.Doc: (ARINC) course from a fix to a DME distance.

P.Name: VR
P.Doc: (ARINC) heading to a radial termination.

P.Name: VD
P.Doc: (ARINC) heading to a DME distance.

P.Name: VI
P.Doc: (ARINC) heading to next leg.

P.Name: VA
P.Doc: (ARINC) heading to an altitude (position unspecified).

P.Name: RF
P.Doc: (ARINC) constant radius to a fix.

E.Name: CodeRunwayProtectionArea
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of protection area for a runway For example, clearway, obstacle free zone, ILS protection area, etc..

P.Name: RESA
P.Doc: Runway end safety area.

P.Name: OFZ
P.Doc: Obstacle free zone or surface

P.Name: IOFZ
P.Doc: Inner Obstacle free zone or surface

P.Name: POFZ
P.Doc: Precision Obstacle Free Zone

P.Name: ILS
P.Doc: ILS protection area. Protects ILS signal distortion by forbidding large objects in the area.

P.Name: VGSI
P.Doc: Visual Glide Slope Indicator (VGSI) protection area. Protects VGSI signal coverage by forbidding objects in the area.

P.Name: STOPWAY
P.Doc: A defined rectangular area on the ground at the end of take-off run available prepared as a suitable area in which an aircraft can be stopped in the case of an abandoned take-off.

E.Name: CodeFlightRestriction
E.Doc: A code indicating if the restriction is an interdiction or a mandatory routing.

P.Name: CLSD
P.Doc: Closed for cruising. [note: It is allowed to climb or descend through the levels associated with the restriction but it is not allowed to fly straight and level on the said levels, in any part of the route. .]

P.Name: ALLOWED
P.Doc: Flight that comply with the condition are explicitly permitted to use the associated routings, even if other more general flight restrictions forbid the routings (for the same flight conditions).

E.Name: CodeRouteNavigation
E.Doc: The type of the route from the navigation point of view. For example, conventional, RNAV, etc..

P.Name: CONV
P.Doc: Conventional navigation route.

P.Name: RNAV
P.Doc: Area navigation route.

P.Name: TACAN
P.Doc: TACAN route.

E.Name: CodeRouteSegmentPath
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of segment path.

P.Name: GRC
P.Doc: Great circle.

P.Name: RHL
P.Doc: Rhumb line.

E.Name: CodeAircraftGroundService
E.Doc: A code indicating a type of service provided to aircraft on the ground.

P.Name: DEICE
P.Doc: De-icing service.

P.Name: HAND
P.Doc: Handling service.

P.Name: HANGAR
P.Doc: Hangar service

P.Name: REPAIR
P.Doc: Repairing service.

P.Name: REMOVE
P.Doc: Removal of disabled aircraft.

E.Name: CodeSpecialNavigationStation
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of service provided by a station in a special navigation system chain, depending on the type of the system.

P.Name: MASTER
P.Doc: Master station of a LORAN or DECCA chain.

P.Name: SLAVE
P.Doc: LORAN slave.

P.Name: RED_SLAVE
P.Doc: Red slave station of a DECCA chain.

P.Name: GREEN_SLAVE
P.Doc: Green slave station of a DECCA chain.

P.Name: PURPLE_SLAVE
P.Doc: Purple slave station of a DECCA chain.

E.Name: CodeSpecialNavigationSystem
E.Doc: A code indicating a type of special navigation system. For example, LORAN, DECCA, GNSS, etc.

P.Name: LORANA
P.Doc: Long range (area) navigation system A

P.Name: LORANC
P.Doc: Long range (area) navigation system C.

P.Name: LORAND
P.Doc: Long range (area) navigation system D.

P.Name: DECCA
P.Doc: Short and medium range (area) navigation system DECCA.

P.Name: GNSS
P.Doc: Global navigation satellite system.

E.Name: CodeAircraftStand
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of stand. For example, parking position on the apron, isolated aircraft stand, terminal building gate, etc..

P.Name: NI
P.Doc: Nose-in parking position.

P.Name: ANG_NI
P.Doc: Angled nose-in parking position.

P.Name: ANG_NO
P.Doc: Angled nose-out parking position.

P.Name: PARL
P.Doc: Parallel (to building) parking position.

P.Name: RMT
P.Doc: Remote parking position.

P.Name: ISOL
P.Doc: Isolated parking position.

E.Name: CodeTaxiway
E.Doc: A code indicating a type of taxiway. For example, normal taxiway, apron taxiway, air taxiway, etc..

P.Name: AIR
P.Doc: Air taxiway.

P.Name: GND
P.Doc: Ground taxiway.

P.Name: EXIT
P.Doc: Exit/turnoff taxiway.

P.Name: FASTEXIT
P.Doc: Rapid exit/turnoff taxiway.

P.Name: STUB
P.Doc: Stub taxiway.

P.Name: TURN_AROUND
P.Doc: Turn around.

P.Name: PARALLEL
P.Doc: Parallel taxiway.

P.Name: BYPASS
P.Doc: Bypass holding bay.

E.Name: CodeUnit
E.Doc: A unit providing particular ATS services.

P.Name: ACC
P.Doc: Area control centre.

P.Name: ADSU
P.Doc: Automatic dependent surveillance unit.

P.Name: ADVC
P.Doc: Advisory centre.

P.Name: ALPS
P.Doc: Alerting post.

P.Name: AOF
P.Doc: Aeronautical information services office.

P.Name: APP
P.Doc: Approach control office.

P.Name: APP_ARR
P.Doc: Arrivals approach control office.

P.Name: APP_DEP
P.Doc: Departures approach control office.

P.Name: ARO
P.Doc: Aerodrome reporting office/ATS reporting office.

P.Name: ATCC
P.Doc: Air traffic control centre.

P.Name: ATFMU
P.Doc: Air traffic flow management unit.

P.Name: ATMU
P.Doc: Air traffic management unit.

P.Name: ATSU
P.Doc: Air traffic services unit.

P.Name: BOF
P.Doc: Briefing office (note: Note ICAO listed by nonetheless used.)

P.Name: BS
P.Doc: Commercial broadcasting station.

P.Name: COM
P.Doc: Communications office/centre.

P.Name: FCST
P.Doc: Forecasting office.

P.Name: FIC
P.Doc: Flight information centre.

P.Name: GCA
P.Doc: Ground controlled approach systems office.

P.Name: MET
P.Doc: Meteorological office.

P.Name: MWO
P.Doc: Meteorological watch office.

P.Name: NOF
P.Doc: International NOTAM office.

P.Name: OAC
P.Doc: Ocean control centre.

P.Name: PAR
P.Doc: Precision approach radar centre.

P.Name: RAD
P.Doc: Radar unit/office.

P.Name: RAFC
P.Doc: Regional area forecast centre.

P.Name: RCC
P.Doc: Rescue co-ordination centre.

P.Name: RSC
P.Doc: Rescue sub-centre.

P.Name: SAR
P.Doc: Search and rescue centre.

P.Name: SMC
P.Doc: Surface movement control office.

P.Name: SMR
P.Doc: Surface movement radar office.

P.Name: SRA
P.Doc: Surveillance radar approach office/centre.

P.Name: SSR
P.Doc: Secondary surveillance radar office/centre.

P.Name: TAR
P.Doc: Terminal area surveillance radar office/centre.

P.Name: TWR
P.Doc: Aerodrome control tower.

P.Name: UAC
P.Doc: Upper area control centre.

P.Name: UDF
P.Doc: UHF direction finding station.

P.Name: UIC
P.Doc: Upper information centre.

P.Name: VDF
P.Doc: VHF direction finding station.

P.Name: WAFC
P.Doc: World area forecast centre.

P.Name: ARTCC
P.Doc: Air route traffic control centre.

P.Name: FSS
P.Doc: Flight service station.

P.Name: TRACON
P.Doc: Terminal radar approach control.

P.Name: MIL
P.Doc: Military station/unit (or military office in general).

P.Name: MILOPS
P.Doc: Planning/briefing office for military flight operations.

E.Name: CodeILSBackCourse
E.Doc: A code indicating the usability of the localizer signal in the back-course sector.

E.Name: CodeVASIS
E.Doc: A code indicating a type of visual approach slope indicator system. For example, VASIS, AVASIS, 3-BAR VASIS, PAPI, APAPI, etc..

P.Name: PAPI
P.Doc: Precision approach path indicator.

P.Name: APAPI
P.Doc: Abbreviated precision approach path indicator.

P.Name: HAPI
P.Doc: Helicopter approach path indicator.

P.Name: VASIS
P.Doc: Visual approach slope indicator system.

P.Name: AVASIS
P.Doc: Abbreviated visual approach slow indicator system.

P.Name: TVASIS
P.Doc: T-shaped VASIS

P.Name: ATVASIS
P.Doc: Abbreviated TVASIS

P.Name: 3B_VASIS
P.Doc: 3 bar VASIS.

P.Name: 3B_AVASIS
P.Doc: 3 bar AVASIS

P.Name: 3B_ATVASIS
P.Doc: 3 bar ATVASIS.

P.Name: PVASI
P.Doc: Pulsating/steady burning visual approach slope indicator, normally a single light unit projecting two colours.

P.Name: TRCV
P.Doc: Tri-colour visual approach slope indicator, normally a single light unit projecting three colours.

P.Name: PNI
P.Doc: Alignment of elements system.

P.Name: ILU
P.Doc: A number of identical light units.

P.Name: OLS
P.Doc: Optical landing system for strip decks and aircraft carriers (sometimes available on ground air bases for training purposes).

P.Name: LCVASI
P.Doc: Low cost visual approach slope indicator: 3 sets of 4 white lights on 3 mounts usually on only one side of the runway.

E.Name: CodeUsageLimitation
E.Doc: A code indicating whether a limitation is of type permission, interdiction or exclusive usage.

P.Name: CONDITIONAL
P.Doc: Permission but with additional instructions. Failure to comply with the additional instructions invalidates the permission.

P.Name: RESERV
P.Doc: Exclusive usage (reservation).

E.Name: CodeYesNoBase
E.Doc: A code for a logical value: Yes or No.

E.Name: CodeStatusConstruction
E.Doc: A code indicating the status of the construction of a Vertical Structure.

P.Name: IN_CONSTRUCTION
P.Doc: In Construction.

P.Name: DEMOLITION_PLANNED
P.Doc: Removal is planned.

P.Name: IN_DEMOLITION
P.Doc: Work in progress to remove the item.

E.Name: CodeStatusOperations
E.Doc: Code indicating operational status.

P.Name: NORMAL
P.Doc: Normal operations.

P.Name: DOWNGRADED
P.Doc: The system is theoretically able to work at a higher level of service, but it is currently limited to the level described.

P.Name: UNSERVICEABLE
P.Doc: Operation is unserviceable (unavailable).

P.Name: WORK_IN_PROGRESS
P.Doc: Operation is under construction.

E.Name: CodeVerticalStructure
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of vertical structure.

P.Name: AG_EQUIP
P.Doc: Agricultural Equipment

P.Name: CABLE_CAR
P.Doc: Cable car.

P.Name: CATENARY
P.Doc: Catenary (wire).

P.Name: COMPRESSED_AIR_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a compressed air system.

P.Name: CONTROL_MONITORING_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of an electronic monitoring and control system (EMCS) including cables, devices, and so on.

P.Name: CONTROL_TOWER
P.Doc: Control tower.

P.Name: COOLING_TOWER
P.Doc: Cooling tower.

P.Name: ELECTRICAL_EXIT_LIGHT
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of an electrical exterior lighting system including cables, switches, devices, transformers, and so on. Does not include field, navaid, or approach lighting

P.Name: ELECTRICAL_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of an electrical distribution system including cables, switches, devices, motors, transformers, and so on.

P.Name: FUEL_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a fuel distribution system consisting of pipes, fittings, fixtures, pumps, tanks, and so on

P.Name: GATE
P.Doc: Area of a fence which may be opened for passage through the fence or closed to prevent passage through the fence.

P.Name: GENERAL_UTILITY
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of utility system which are universal in use and purpose and do not belong to a specific utility

P.Name: GRAIN_ELEVATOR
P.Doc: Grain elevator.

P.Name: HEAT_COOL_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a heating and cooling distribution system consisting of pipes, fittings, fixtures, and so on.

P.Name: INDUSTRIAL_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of an industrial waste collection system including pipes, fittings, fixtures, tanks, lagoons, and so on.

P.Name: NATURAL_GAS_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a natural gas distribution system consisting of pipes, fittings, fixtures, and so on.

P.Name: NATURAL_HIGHPOINT
P.Doc: Natural high point.

P.Name: NAVAID
P.Doc: Navaid (navigation aid)

P.Name: NUCLEAR_REACTOR
P.Doc: Nuclear reactor.

P.Name: POWER_PLANT
P.Doc: Power plant.

P.Name: RIG
P.Doc: Rig (oil rig).

P.Name: SALTWATER_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a salt water collection system.

P.Name: SPIRE
P.Doc: Spire (steeple).

P.Name: STACK
P.Doc: Stack (smoke, industrial).

P.Name: STORM_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a storm drainage collection system including pipes, fittings, fixtures, and so on).

P.Name: TETHERED_BALLOON
P.Doc: Tethered balloon.

P.Name: TRANSMISSION_LINE
P.Doc: Transmission Line.

P.Name: URBAN
P.Doc: Urban Area

P.Name: WASTEWATER_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a wastewater collection system including pipes, fittings, fixtures, treatment plants, collection locations, and so forth.

P.Name: WATER_SYSTEM
P.Doc: AirMAT: The components of a water system including pipes, fittings, fixtures, treatment plants, and so on.

P.Name: WATER_TOWER
P.Doc: Water tower.

P.Name: WINDMILL_FARMS
P.Doc: Windmill Farm.

E.Name: CodeVerticalStructureMarking
E.Doc: A code indicating the type and pattern of markings on a vertical structure.

P.Name: MONOCOLOUR
P.Doc: Markings painted as a single colour.

P.Name: CHEQUERED
P.Doc: Markings painted in a chequered pattern.

P.Name: HBANDS
P.Doc: Markings painted as horizontal bands.

P.Name: VBANDS
P.Doc: Markings painted as vertical bands.

P.Name: FLAG
P.Doc: Flag marked with chequered pattern.

P.Name: MARKERS
P.Doc: Marks attached to cables or wires.

E.Name: CodeCardinalDirection
E.Doc: An angle expressed as compass directions.

P.Name: ENE
P.Doc: East North East

P.Name: ESE
P.Doc: East Southeast

P.Name: SSE
P.Doc: South southeast

P.Name: SSW
P.Doc: South southwest

P.Name: WSW
P.Doc: West southwest

P.Name: WNW
P.Doc: West northwest

P.Name: NNW
P.Doc: North northwest

E.Name: CodeFreeFlight
E.Doc: Code classifying entry and exit points for free flight zones.

P.Name: PITCH
P.Doc: The free flight PITCH point indicating the start of free flight.

P.Name: CATCH
P.Doc: Free flight CATCH point indicating the end of free flight.

E.Name: CodeNavaidService
E.Doc: Types of Navaid Services.

P.Name: VOR
P.Doc: VHF Omnidirectional Radio Range.

P.Name: DME
P.Doc: Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: NDB
P.Doc: Non-Directional Radio Beacon

P.Name: TACAN
P.Doc: Tactical Air Navigation Beacon

P.Name: MKR
P.Doc: Marker Beacon

P.Name: ILS
P.Doc: Instrument Landing System

P.Name: ILS_DME
P.Doc: ILS with collocated DME. Collocation can be with the antenna or the loc. See NavaidComponent collocationGroup

P.Name: MLS
P.Doc: Microwave Landing System

P.Name: MLS_DME
P.Doc: MLS with collocated DME. See NavaidComponent collocationGroup

P.Name: VORTAC
P.Doc: VOR and TACAN collocated.

P.Name: VOR_DME
P.Doc: VOR and DME collocated.

P.Name: NDB_DME
P.Doc: NDB and DME collocated.

P.Name: TLS
P.Doc: Transponder Landing System

P.Name: LOC_DME
P.Doc: LOC and DME collocated.

P.Name: NDB_MKR
P.Doc: Non-Directional Radio Beacon and Marker Beacon

P.Name: DF
P.Doc: Direction Finder.

P.Name: SDF
P.Doc: Simplified Directional Facility.

E.Name: CodeVerticalDatum
E.Doc: List of vertical datums.

P.Name: EGM_96
P.Doc: (ICAO Doc 9674) Earth gravitational model 1996. ICAO recommended vertical datum.

P.Name: AHD
P.Doc: Australian Height Datum

P.Name: NAVD88
P.Doc: North American Vertical Datum of 1988

E.Name: CodeRouteDesignatorPrefix
E.Doc: (ICAO) A prefix for route designators. Note: Includes a non-ICAO value, used for military TACAN routes.

P.Name: T
P.Doc: TACAN Route (military)

E.Name: CodeRVSM
E.Doc: A code indicating that reduced vertical separation minima is applied in the column or not.

P.Name: RVSM
P.Doc: Reduced Vertical Separation Minima

E.Name: CodeRouteDesignatorLetter
E.Doc: (ICAO) A one character designator for the route.

E.Name: CodeRouteDesignatorSuffix
E.Doc: (ICAO) A suffix for the route designator.

P.Name: F
P.Doc: (ICAO) Advisory service only is provided on a portion of the route.

P.Name: G
P.Doc: (ICAO) Flight information service only on a portion of the route.

E.Name: CodeStatusAirspace
E.Doc: A coded list of values indicating the activation status of an Airspace.

P.Name: AVBL_FOR_ACTIVATION
P.Doc: The feature may be activated.

P.Name: ACTIVE
P.Doc: The airspace is active (but it might not be in use yet).

P.Name: IN_USE
P.Doc: The airspace is actually used inside the activation period.

P.Name: INACTIVE
P.Doc: The airspace is not active.

P.Name: INTERMITTENT
P.Doc: The Airspace is active but with periods of no real usage.

E.Name: CodeRunwayPointRole
E.Doc: Role of the Runway Centreline Point.

P.Name: START
P.Doc: Physical start of a runway direction.

P.Name: DISTHR
P.Doc: Displaced threshold.

P.Name: TDZ
P.Doc: Touchdown Zone

P.Name: MID
P.Doc: The mid point of the runway

P.Name: END
P.Doc: Physical end of a runway direction

P.Name: START_RUN
P.Doc: Start of take off run

P.Name: LAHSO
P.Doc: Point indicating Land And Hold Short Operation location

P.Name: ABEAM_GLIDESLOPE
P.Doc: The point perpendicular to the Glideslope Antenna on the Runway Centreline. Also known as the Aiming Point.

P.Name: ABEAM_PAR
P.Doc: The point perpendicular to the Precision Approach Radar (PAR) Antenna on the Runway Centreline.

P.Name: ABEAM_ELEVATION
P.Doc: The point perpendicular to the Elevation Antenna on the Runway Centreline.

P.Name: ABEAM_TDR
P.Doc: The point perpendicular to the Touchdown Reflector (TDR) on the Runway Centreline.

P.Name: ABEAM_RER
P.Doc: The point perpendicular to the Runway End Reflector (RER) on the Runway Centreline.

E.Name: CodeRunway
E.Doc: A code that makes a distinction between runways for airplanes and FATO for helicopters.

P.Name: RWY
P.Doc: Runway for airplanes

P.Name: FATO
P.Doc: Final Approach and Take Off Area for helicopters

E.Name: CodeMarkingStyle
E.Doc: A coded list of values indicating styles of painted lines.

P.Name: SOLID
P.Doc: solid line.

P.Name: DASHED
P.Doc: Dashed line.

P.Name: DOTTED
P.Doc: Dotted line.

E.Name: CodeFinalGuidance
E.Doc: Codes describing the guidance used on the final approach segment of an instrument approach procedure.

P.Name: LPV
P.Doc: An LPV approach is classified as an APV procedure based on the lateral OCS dimensions of the precision approach trapezoid, with vertical guidance provided by the WAAS where the VAL is greater than 12 and less than or equal to 50 meters. These procedures are published on RNAV Global Positioning System (GPS) approach charts as the LPV minima line.
