P.Name: LNAV_VNAV
P.Doc: Lateral navigation/Vertical navigation

P.Name: LNAV
P.Doc: Lateral navigation (LNAV) . The lateral navigation without positive vertical guidance. This type of navigation is associated with nonprecision approach procedures.

P.Name: GLS
P.Doc: Global Landing System. LAAS support.

P.Name: ASR
P.Doc: Airport surveillance radar (ASR)

P.Name: ARA
P.Doc: Airborne radar approach (ARA)

P.Name: ARSR
P.Doc: Air Route Surveillance Radar

P.Name: PAR
P.Doc: Precision Approach Radar

P.Name: ILS
P.Doc: Instrument landing system (ILS)

P.Name: ILS_DME
P.Doc: Instrument landing system with Direction measuring equipment

P.Name: ILS_PRM
P.Doc: Instrument landing system using a Precision runway monitor

P.Name: LDA
P.Doc: Localizer Type Directional Aid

P.Name: LDA_DME
P.Doc: Localizer Type Directional Aid with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: LOC_BC
P.Doc: Localizer Back Course.

P.Name: LOC_DME
P.Doc: Localizer with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: LOC_DME_BC
P.Doc: Localizer with Distance Measuring Equipment Back Course.

P.Name: MLS
P.Doc: Microwave Landing System.

P.Name: MLS_DME
P.Doc: Microwave Landing System with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: NDB
P.Doc: Non-Directional Beacon

P.Name: NDB_DME
P.Doc: Non-Directional Beacon with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: SDF
P.Doc: Simplified Directional Facility.

P.Name: TLS
P.Doc: Transponder Landing System.

P.Name: VOR
P.Doc: VHF Omnidirectional Radio

P.Name: VOR_DME
P.Doc: VHF Omnidirectional Radio with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: TACAN
P.Doc: UHF Tactical Air Navigation beacon

P.Name: VORTAC
P.Doc: VHF Omnidirectional Radio with UHF Tactical Air Navigation beacon

P.Name: DME
P.Doc: Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: LP
P.Doc: A Localizer Performance (LP) approach is an RNAV non-vertically guided approach procedure evaluated using the lateral obstacle evaluation area dimensions of the precision localizer trapezoid, with adjustments specific to the WAAS. These procedures are published on RNAV GPS approaches as the LP minima line.

E.Name: CodeMissedApproach
E.Doc: Types of missed approach.

P.Name: PRIMARY
P.Doc: The default missed approach.

P.Name: SECONDARY
P.Doc: An alternate missed approach to be used instead of primary.

P.Name: ALTERNATE
P.Doc: A missed approach to be used when directed by ATC.

P.Name: TACAN
P.Doc: A missed approach to be used when using TACAN guidance.

P.Name: TACANALT
P.Doc: An alternate missed approach to be used instead of TACAN missed approach when directed by ATC.

P.Name: ENGINEOUT
P.Doc: Missed Approach to be used when Engine Out

E.Name: CodeUpperAlpha
E.Doc: Letters of the Latin alphabet.

E.Name: CodeApproachPrefix
E.Doc: Code indicating the prefix used in support of current approach procedure naming conventions

P.Name: HI
P.Doc: Approach procedures with segments such as a high altitude teardrop penetration that are within the high airspace stratum, requested by Military. Normally C, D and E Minimums only.

P.Name: COPTER
P.Doc: Indicates helicopter approach

P.Name: CONVERGING
P.Doc: Parallel or joining operation with parallel or joining ILS courses

E.Name: CodeApproach
E.Doc: A code describing the type of instrument approach procedure.

P.Name: ASR
P.Doc: Airport surveillance radar (ASR)

P.Name: ARA
P.Doc: Airborne radar approach (ARA)

P.Name: ARSR
P.Doc: Air Route Surveillance Radar

P.Name: PAR
P.Doc: Precision Approach Radar

P.Name: ILS
P.Doc: Instrument landing system (ILS)

P.Name: ILS_DME
P.Doc: Instrument landing system with Direction measuring equipment

P.Name: ILS_PRM
P.Doc: Instrument landing system using a Precision runway monitor

P.Name: LDA
P.Doc: Localizer Type Directional Aid

P.Name: LDA_DME
P.Doc: Localizer Type Directional Aid with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: LOC_BC
P.Doc: Localizer Back course

P.Name: LOC_DME
P.Doc: Localizer with Distance Measuring Equipment

P.Name: LOC_DME_BC
P.Doc: Localizer with Distance Measuring Equipment back course

P.Name: MLS
P.Doc: Microwave Landing System

P.Name: MLS_DME
P.Doc: Microwave Landing System with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: NDB
P.Doc: Non-Directional Beacon.

P.Name: NDB_DME
P.Doc: Non-Directional Beacon with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: SDF
P.Doc: Simplified Directional Facility.

P.Name: TLS
P.Doc: Transponder Landing System.

P.Name: VOR
P.Doc: VHF Omnidirectional Radio

P.Name: VOR_DME
P.Doc: VHF Omnidirectional Radio with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: TACAN
P.Doc: UHF Tactical Air Navigation beacon

P.Name: VORTAC
P.Doc: VHF Omnidirectional Radio with UHF Tactical Air Navigation beacon

P.Name: DME
P.Doc: Distance Measuring Equipment

P.Name: DME_DME
P.Doc: Distance Measuring Equipment with Distance Measuring Equipment.

P.Name: RNP
P.Doc: Required Navigation Performance.

P.Name: GPS
P.Doc: Global Positioning System

P.Name: RNAV
P.Doc: Area Navigation

P.Name: IGS
P.Doc: Instrument Guidance System

E.Name: CodeApproval
E.Doc: Indicates an approval code

P.Name: NOT_AUTHORISED
P.Doc: Not authorized

E.Name: CodeDesignStandard
E.Doc: A code indicating the rules used to design and evaluate terminal procedures

P.Name: PANS_OPS
P.Doc: ICAO PANS-OPS

P.Name: TERPS
P.Doc: US TERPS (Terminal Procedure criteria)

P.Name: CANADA_TERPS
P.Doc: Canadian variant of US TERPS

E.Name: CodeApproachEquipmentAdditional
E.Doc: A code indicating the additional equipment needed to fly the procedure not listed in approachType

P.Name: ADF
P.Doc: ADF Required

P.Name: DME
P.Doc: DME Required

P.Name: RADAR
P.Doc: Radar required

P.Name: RADARDME
P.Doc: Radar or DME required.

P.Name: DUALVORDME
P.Doc: Dual VOR or VOR/DME required

P.Name: DUALADF
P.Doc: Dual ADF required

P.Name: ADFMA
P.Doc: ADF required for missed approach.

P.Name: SPECIAL
P.Doc: al aircraft and aircrew certification required

P.Name: DUALVHF
P.Doc: Dual VHF communication required.

P.Name: GPSRNP3
P.Doc: GPS or RNP-0.3 required.

P.Name: ADFILS
P.Doc: ADF required for ILS approach.

P.Name: DUALADF_DME
P.Doc: DME and dual ADF required for LOC approach

P.Name: RADAR_RNAV
P.Doc: Radar or RNAV required.

E.Name: CodeEquipmentUnavailable
E.Doc: A code to indicate the type of unavailable equipment

P.Name: NONSTANDARD
P.Doc: Non standard

E.Name: CodeHoldingUse
E.Doc: A code to identify the holding is used by a segment

P.Name: PT
P.Doc: The holding pattern is used as a procedure turn. (Commonly referred to as Holding in Lieu of Procedure Turn.)

P.Name: ARRIVAL
P.Doc: Arrival holding. A holding pattern provided at any Initial Approach Fix (IAF) and should be aligned with the initial segment track.

P.Name: MISSED_APPROACH
P.Doc: Missed Approach Holding. A holding pattern provided at the end of the missed approach

P.Name: CLIMB
P.Doc: A holding pattern used in conjunction with climb and hold instructions.

P.Name: ATC
P.Doc: A holding pattern defined specifically for ATC use.

E.Name: CodeProcedureDistance
E.Doc: Indicates the distance and altitude type associated with an approach procedure.

P.Name: HAT
P.Doc: Height Above Touchdown

P.Name: OM
P.Doc: Outer marker

P.Name: MM
P.Doc: Middle marker

P.Name: IM
P.Doc: Inner marker

P.Name: PFAF
P.Doc: Precision final approach fix

P.Name: GSANT
P.Doc: Glideslope antenna

P.Name: FAF
P.Doc: Final Approach Fix

P.Name: MAP
P.Doc: Missed Approach Point

P.Name: THLD
P.Doc: Runway Threshold

P.Name: VDP
P.Doc: Visual Descent Point

P.Name: RECH
P.Doc: Runway End Crossing Height

E.Name: CodeMinimaFinalApproachPath
E.Doc: Code indicating final approach path type for establishing valid set of minima on a procedure.

P.Name: STRAIGHT_IN
P.Doc:
Final approach path is straight in to a landing surface (S 9R).
[FAAO 8260.3] A descent in an approved procedure where the navigation facility alignment is normally on the runway centreline, and glide slope (GS) information is provided.

P.Name: CIRCLING
P.Doc: Final approach path is circling above the airport. [ICAO] Circling approach. An extension of an instrument approach procedure which provides for visual circling of the aerodrome prior to landing.

P.Name: SIDESTEP
P.Doc: [FAAO 8260.19] A sidestep manoeuvre is the visual alignment manoeuvre, required by a pilot executing an approach to one runway and cleared to land on a parallel runway.

E.Name: CodeMinimumAltitude
E.Doc: A code classifying altitudes for approach procedure minima.

P.Name: OCA
P.Doc: [ICAO] Obstacle clearance altitude (OCA). The lowest altitude used in establishing compliance with appropriate obstacle clearance criteria.

P.Name: DA
P.Doc: Decision altitude (DA). [FAAO 8260.3] A specified altitude in reference to mean sea level in an approach with vertical guidance at which a missed approach must be initiated if the required visual references to continue the approach have not been established.

P.Name: MDA
P.Doc: [ICAO] Minimum descent altitude (MDA). A specified altitude in a non-precision approach or circling approach below which descent must not be made without the required visual reference.

E.Name: CodeMinimumHeight
E.Doc: A code classifying heights for approach procedure minima.

P.Name: DH
P.Doc: [ICAO] Decision height. A specified height in the precision approach or approach with vertical guidance at which a missed approach must he initiated if the required visual reference to continue the approach has not been established.

P.Name: OCH
P.Doc: [ICAO] Obstacle clearance height (OCH). The lowest height above the elevation of the relevant runway threshold or the aerodrome elevation as applicable, used in establishing compliance with appropriate obstacle clearance criteria.

P.Name: MDH
P.Doc: [ICAO] Minimum descent height. A specified height in a nonprecision approach or circling approach below which descent must not be made without the required visual reference.

E.Name: CodeProcedureCodingStandard
E.Doc: Code indicating the standard used to encode the approach procedure.

P.Name: PANS_OPS
P.Doc: ICAO PANS-OPS.

P.Name: ARINC_424_15
P.Doc: ARINC 424 version 15

P.Name: ARINC_424_18
P.Doc: ARINC 424 Version 18

P.Name: ARINC_424_19
P.Doc: ARINC 424 Version 19.

E.Name: CodeSafeAltitude
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of altitude used, MSA or ESA.

P.Name: MSA
P.Doc: Minimum Sector/Safe Altitude

P.Name: ESA
P.Doc: Emergency Safe/Sector Altitude

E.Name: CodeObstacleAssessmentSurface
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of surface assessment. Used for indicating assessment surfaces used in design and evaluation activities such as approach procedure design.

P.Name: 40_TO_1
P.Doc: 40 to 1 sloped surface.

P.Name: 72_TO_1
P.Doc: 72 to 1 sloped surface.

P.Name: MA
P.Doc: Missed approach area.

P.Name: FINAL
P.Doc: Final approach area.

P.Name: PT_ENTRY_AREA
P.Doc: Procedure turn entry area.

P.Name: PRIMARY
P.Doc: Primary area.

P.Name: SECONDARY
P.Doc: Secondary Area.

P.Name: ZONE1
P.Doc: Zone 1

P.Name: ZONE2
P.Doc: Zone 2

P.Name: ZONE3
P.Doc: Zone 3

P.Name: AREA1
P.Doc: AREA 1

P.Name: AREA2
P.Doc: AREA 2

P.Name: AREA3
P.Doc: AREA 3

P.Name: DER
P.Doc: Departure End of Runway Area

E.Name: CodeAltitudeAdjustment
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of adjustment used to produce a usable altitude.

P.Name: RA
P.Doc: Remote altimeter

P.Name: AT
P.Doc: Air traffic

P.Name: AC
P.Doc: Accuracy code

P.Name: SI
P.Doc: Straight-in minimums

P.Name: XL
P.Doc: Excessive length of final

P.Name: PR
P.Doc: Precipitous terrain

P.Name: HAA
P.Doc: Minimum required HAA (height above airport) calculated, round to a reportable value, and applied for charted

P.Name: MA
P.Doc: Missed approach due to obstacle penetration of missed approach slope (segment assessment area)

P.Name: PT
P.Doc: Procedure turn

P.Name: DG
P.Doc: Descent gradient

P.Name: GS
P.Doc: Glideslope - adjustment to set altitude at glideslope intercept

P.Name: CA
P.Doc: Cardinal altitude

P.Name: MT
P.Doc: Mountainous terrain

P.Name: MAH
P.Doc: Missed approach hold

P.Name: SA
P.Doc: Secondary area (also X/y surfaces, transition areas)

P.Name: AAO
P.Doc: Adverse Assumption Obstruction. Designates adjustment to a terrain value to account for natural vegetation growth, uncharted cell phone towers, buildings, and other man-made obstructions.

P.Name: VA
P.Doc: Vegetation Allowance. Designates an adjustment to a terrain value to account for natural vegetation growth.

E.Name: CodeTAA
E.Doc: Indicates one of the three area types of the Terminal Arrival Area.

P.Name: LEFT_BASE
P.Doc: Left base

P.Name: RIGHT_BASE
P.Doc: Right base

E.Name: CodeArcDirection
E.Doc: A code indicating the direction of an arc (clockwise or counterclockwise).

P.Name: CWA
P.Doc: Clockwise arc

P.Name: CCA
P.Doc: Counter clockwise arc

E.Name: CodeLevelSeries
E.Doc: A series of predefined levels. For example Odd, Even.

P.Name: ODD
P.Doc: "Odd" flight levels (10, 30, 50, 70, ...)

P.Name: EVEN
P.Doc: "Even" flight levels (20, 40, 60, 80, ...)

P.Name: ODD_HALF
P.Doc: Intermediate flight levels, above odd levels (15, 35, 55, 75, ...)

P.Name: EVEN_HALF
P.Doc: Intermediate flight levels, above even levels (5, 25, 45, 65, ...)

E.Name: CodeSegmentTermination
E.Doc: A code indicating the end point of a terminal procedure segment leg.

P.Name: ALTITUDE
P.Doc: Leg is terminated when reaching the altitude conditions specified in the segment leg.

P.Name: DISTANCE
P.Doc: Leg is terminated when the distance has passed.

P.Name: DURATION
P.Doc: Leg is terminated when the duration has passed.

P.Name: INTERCEPT
P.Doc: Leg is terminated when reaching the limited angle indication or reaching the limiting distance indication associated with the leg.

E.Name: CodeReferenceRole
E.Doc: A list describing the valid Point Reference makeups for use by navigation receivers.

P.Name: INTERSECTION
P.Doc: An intersection is where two or more "things" cross. An intersection will be the intersection of two angle indications or two distance indications (DME/DME fix). The indications must reference different navaids.

P.Name: RECNAV
P.Doc: The recommended navaid providing information for the segment. Used for ARINC leg types that need navaid information other then what is supplied by standard angle and distance indications.

P.Name: ATD
P.Doc: Along Track Distance. Defined the distance along the guidance course to/from another significant point.

P.Name: RAD_DME
P.Doc: Defined by a bearing (angle indication) and a distance (distance Indication) from a navaid.

E.Name: CodeTrajectory
E.Doc: A code classifying the trajectory of a segment path.

P.Name: PT
P.Doc: Procedure Turn.

P.Name: BASETURN
P.Doc: Base turn.

E.Name: CodeRunwayMarking
E.Doc: Type of runway marking related to landing categories such as precision, non-precision and basic.

P.Name: PRECISION
P.Doc: Markings appropriate for precision approach runway. Precision Instrument runway marking elements include markings for Runway Designation, Centreline, Threshold, Aiming Point, Touchdown Zone and Side Stripes.

P.Name: NONPRECISION
P.Doc: Markings appropriate for non-precision approach runway. Non-Precision Instrument runway marking elements include markings for Runway designation, Centreline, threshold and Aiming Point.

P.Name: BASIC
P.Doc: Basic (or Visual) runway marking elements include markings for Runway Designation, Centreline, Threshold (On runways sued or intended to be used by international commercial transports) and Aiming Point (On runways 4000 ft (1200M) or longer used by jet aircraft).

P.Name: NONE
P.Doc: No runway markings present.

P.Name: RUNWAY_NUMBERS
P.Doc: The only runway marking element present is the Runway Designation.

P.Name: NON_STANDARD
P.Doc: Runway marking elements such as Runway Designation, Centreline, Threshold and Aiming Point may be present, but they are Not standard markings.

P.Name: HELIPORT
P.Doc: Heliport specific marking elements are present.

E.Name: CodeRVRReading
E.Doc: A code indicating the position where the RVR reading is reported.

P.Name: MID
P.Doc: Middle or centre of runway

P.Name: TO
P.Doc: Takeoff or rollout point.

E.Name: CodeStatusNavaid
E.Doc: The operational status of a Navaid or NavaidEquipment

P.Name: OPERATIONAL
P.Doc: Operating normally.

P.Name: UNSERVICEABLE
P.Doc: Not available.

P.Name: ONTEST
P.Doc: On test, do not use.

P.Name: INTERRUPT
P.Doc: Expect interruptions of the signal.

P.Name: PARTIAL
P.Doc: Operating with limited capabilities. For example, used when just the DME part of a VOR/DME is working.

P.Name: CONDITIONAL
P.Doc: Operative subject to published limitations or conditions.

P.Name: FALSE_INDICATION
P.Doc: Giving false indication, do not use.

P.Name: FALSE_POSSIBLE
P.Doc: False indication possible, use with caution.

P.Name: IN_CONSTRUCTION
P.Doc: In Construction

E.Name: CodeOperationAirportHeliport
E.Doc: A coded identifier indicating an operation executed by an aircraft in relation with an airport/heliport.

P.Name: TAKEOFF
P.Doc: Take off

P.Name: TOUCHGO
P.Doc: Touch and go

P.Name: TRAIN_APPROACH
P.Doc: Practice low approaches.

P.Name: ALTN_LANDING
P.Doc: Landing at an Alternate Airport/Heliport.

P.Name: AIRSHOW
P.Doc: Air show

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All operation types.

E.Name: CodeDistanceIndication
E.Doc: Coding indicating the type of distance indication.

P.Name: DME
P.Doc: Distance provided by DME indication.

P.Name: GEODETIC
P.Doc: Distance calculated using geodetic calculations.

E.Name: CodeObstacleArea
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of obstacle coverage area, according to ICAO Annex 15.

P.Name: AREA1
P.Doc: ICAO Area 1: entire territory of a State.

P.Name: AREA2
P.Doc: ICAO Area 2: terminal control area.

P.Name: AREA3
P.Doc: ICAO Area 3: aerodrome/heliport area.

P.Name: AREA4
P.Doc: ICAO Area 4: Category II or III operations area.

P.Name: OLS
P.Doc: ICAO Annex 14 Obstacle Limitation Surface.

P.Name: FAR77
P.Doc: FAA Regulations Part 77 Obstacle Limitation Surfaces.

P.Name: MANAGED
P.Doc: A 'virtual' area containing the VerticalStructures included in the data collection exercise, which do not qualify yet as Obstacles in any specific Area

E.Name: CodeAirspaceClassification
E.Doc: A coded list of values that which determines the operating rules, flight requirements, and services provided in an airspace. According to Annex 11, Appendix 4.

P.Name: A
P.Doc: Class of Airspace per ICAO Annex 11. Appendix 4. IFR flights only are permitted; all flights are provided with air traffic control service and are separated from each other.

P.Name: B
P.Doc: Class of Airspace per ICAO Annex 11. Appendix 4. IFR and VFR flights are permitted; all flights are provided with air traffic control service and are separated from each other.

P.Name: C
P.Doc: Class of Airspace per ICAO Annex 11. Appendix 4. IFR and VFR flights are permitted; all flights are provided with air traffic control service and IFR flights are separated from other IFR flights and from VFR flights. VFR flights are separated from IFR flights and receive traffic information.

P.Name: D
P.Doc: Class of Airspace per ICAO Annex 11. Appendix 4. IFR and VFR flights are permitted and all flights are provided with air traffic control service, IFR flights are separated from other IFR flights and receive traffic information in respect of VFR flights, VFR flights receive traffic information in respect of all other flights.

P.Name: E
P.Doc: Class of Airspace per ICAO Annex 11. Appendix 4. IFR and VFR flights are permitted; IFR flights are provided with air traffic control service and are separated from other IFR flights. All flights receive traffic information as far as is practical. Class E shall not be used for control zones.

P.Name: F
P.Doc: Class of Airspace per ICAO Annex 11. Appendix 4. IFR and VFR flights are permitted, all participating IFR flights receive an air traffic advisory service and all flights receive flight information service if requested. Description: Where air traffic advisory service is implemented, this is considered normally as a temporary measure only until such time as it can be replaced by air traffic control.

P.Name: G
P.Doc: Class of Airspace per ICAO Annex 11. Appendix 4. IFR and VFR flights are permitted and receive flight information service if requested.

E.Name: CodeApronElement
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of Apron.

P.Name: NORMAL
P.Doc: The default type.

P.Name: PARKING
P.Doc: Parking Stand Area (from AMDB)

P.Name: RAMP
P.Doc: Access pavement between maintenance hangers opening to the apron and the apron edge. (AirMAT)

P.Name: CARGO
P.Doc: Cargo Loading Area used for loading and unloading cargo. (AirMAT)

P.Name: FUEL
P.Doc: Area used for aircraft fuelling. (AirMAT)

P.Name: HARDSTAND
P.Doc: Area for parking a single aircraft more temporary than a parking area (AirMAT)

P.Name: MAINT
P.Doc: Area used for aircraft maintenance. (AirMAT)

P.Name: MILITARY
P.Doc: Apron used by military (AirMAT)

P.Name: LOADING
P.Doc: Passenger loading area used for loading/unloading of passengers (AirMAT)

P.Name: TAXILANE
P.Doc: Area where plane is still under terminal control (airline dispatched) as opposed to tower control. (AirMAT)

P.Name: TURNAROUND
P.Doc: Area for aircraft to turn around (AirMAT)

E.Name: CodeRunwayElement
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of Runway or Taxiway element.

P.Name: NORMAL
P.Doc: The default type.

P.Name: INTERSECTION
P.Doc: Intersection element - with a runway or with a taxiway.

P.Name: DISPLACED
P.Doc: The element between the start of the runway and the position of the displaced threshold.

P.Name: SHOULDER
P.Doc: Runway or taxiway shoulder element.

E.Name: CodeAuthorityRole
E.Doc: A code indicating the role of the OrganisationAuthority for the aeronautical feature.

P.Name: OWN
P.Doc: The OrganisationAuthority owns the feature.

P.Name: OPERATE
P.Doc: The OrganisationAuthority operates the feature.

P.Name: SUPERVISE
P.Doc: The OrganisationAuthority exercises regulatory role over the facility.

E.Name: CodeVOR
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of path to the next point. For example, great circle, clockwise arc, counter clockwise arc, etc.

P.Name: VOR
P.Doc: Conventional VOR.

P.Name: DVOR
P.Doc: Doppler VOR.

P.Name: VOT
P.Doc: VOR test facility

E.Name: CodeApproachLightingICAO
E.Doc: Classification of the approach lighting system using as criteria the ICAO Annex 14 standards and recommended practices.

P.Name: SIMPLE
P.Doc: Simple approach lighting system (ICAO Annex 14, Vol 1, 5.3.4.2)

P.Name: CAT1
P.Doc: Precision approach category I lighting system (ICAO Annex 14, Vol 1, 5.3.4.10)

P.Name: CAT23
P.Doc: Precision approach category II and III lighting system (ICAO Annex 14, Vol 1, 5.3.4.22)

P.Name: CIRCLING
P.Doc: Circling guidance lighting system (ICAO Annex 14, Vol 1, 5.3.6)

P.Name: LEADIN
P.Doc: Runway lead-in lighting system (ICAO Annex 14, Vol 1, 5.3.7)

P.Name: NONE
P.Doc: Does not classify as an ICAO type

E.Name: CodeLightingJAR
E.Doc: Classification of the approach lighting system using as criteria JAR-OPS 1 - Subpart E, Appendix 1 to 1.430]

P.Name: FALS
P.Doc: Full approach light facilities; comprise runway markings, 720 m or more of high/medium intensity approach lights, runway edge lights, threshold lights and runway end lights.

P.Name: IALS
P.Doc: Intermediate approach light facilities; comprise runway markings, 420 to 720 m of high/medium intensity approach lights, runway edge lights, threshold lights and runway end lights.

P.Name: BALS
P.Doc: Basic approach light facilities; comprise runway markings, less than 420 m of high/medium intensity approach lights (or any length of low intensity approach lights), runway edge lights, threshold lights and runway end lights.

P.Name: NALS
P.Doc: None or insufficient approach light facilities; comprise runway markings, runway edge lights, threshold lights, runway end lights or no lights at all.

E.Name: CodeWorkArea
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of work performed in the work area.

P.Name: CONSTRUCTION
P.Doc: The work area is used for construction. Used for AMDB (DO272/ED99) Construction Area.

P.Name: SURFACEWORK
P.Doc: The work area is used for surface improvements.

P.Name: PARKED
P.Doc: Parked or disabled aircraft or machinery.

E.Name: CodeVerticalStructureMaterial
E.Doc: A coded list of values indicating the type(s) of material that could compose the load-bearing structure and/or exterior facing of a vertical construction.

P.Name: ADOBE_BRICK
P.Doc: Brick made of adobe clay and straw, dried in the sun rather than by oven firing (as are standard bricks). Larger than standard bricks, adobe bricks require a type of clay that contains between 25 and 45 percent aluminium salts.

P.Name: ALUMINIUM
P.Doc: A light silvery ductile and malleable metal, not readily tarnished by air, which is a chemical element, atomic number 13. (Symbol Al)

P.Name: BRICK
P.Doc: Clay kneaded, moulded, and baked or sun-dried, used as a building material.

P.Name: CONCRETE
P.Doc: A heavy-duty building material made from a mixture of broken stone or gravel, sand, cement and water, that forms a stonelike mass on hardening.

P.Name: FIBREGLASS
P.Doc: Any material consisting of glass filaments woven into a textile or paper, or embedded in plastic, for use as a construction or insulation material.

P.Name: GLASS
P.Doc: A substance made by fusing soda and/or potash with other ingredients. Usually transparent, lustrous, hard, and brittle.

P.Name: IRON
P.Doc: A malleable, magnetic, readily oxidizable metal which is a chemical element of the transition series, atomic number 26. (Symbol Fe) Occurs abundantly in certain ores and in meteorites, and is widely used, chiefly in alloys such as steel.

P.Name: MASONRY
P.Doc: Building materials (for example: stone, brick, concrete, hollow-tile, concrete block, gypsum block, or other similar building units or materials and/or combination of the same) bonded together with mortar to form a structure (for example: a wall, a pier).

P.Name: METAL
P.Doc: Any of the class of substances that are characteristically lustrous, ductile, fusible, malleable solids and are good conductors of heat and electricity. For example, gold, silver, copper, iron, lead, tin, and certain alloys (as brass and bronze).

P.Name: MUD
P.Doc: Constructed principally from mud applied to a structural scaffold of plant material (for example: wooden posts). Effective only in extremely dry climates and usually must be resurfaced on a regular basis (for example: yearly) otherwise the structure steadily disintegrates under the effect of weather.

P.Name: PLANT
P.Doc: Plant material (for example: straw and/or tall coarse grass), possibly also containing the slices of soil to which the plant material is attached. For example, used in thatching or sodding a roof.

P.Name: PRESTRESSED_CONCRETE
P.Doc: Reinforced concrete in which internal stresses have been introduced to reduce potential tensile stress in the concrete resulting from loads.

P.Name: REINFORCED_CONCRETE
P.Doc: Poured concrete containing steel bars or metal netting to increase its tensile strength.

P.Name: SOD
P.Doc: A usually square or oblong piece or slice of earth together with the grass growing on it.

P.Name: STEEL
P.Doc: Any of numerous artificially produced alloys of iron containing up to 3 per cent of other elements (including less than about 2.2 per cent carbon) and having great strength and malleability. Able to be tempered to many different degrees of hardness. Used for making tools, weapons, and/or machinery.

P.Name: STONE
P.Doc: Pieces of rock or mineral substance (other than metal) of definite form and size, usually artificially shaped, and used for some special purpose. Used, for example, for building, for paving, or in the form of a block, slab, or pillar set up as a memorial and/or a boundary-mark.

P.Name: TREATED_TIMBER
P.Doc: A timber that has been impregnated with chemicals (for example: creosote oil) to reduce damage from wood rot and/or insects. Often used for the portions of a structure that are likely to be in ongoing contact with soil and/or water.

P.Name: WOOD
P.Doc: The hard, compact, fibrous substance of which the roots, trunks, and branches of trees and shrubs consist. Consists largely of secondary xylem, which forms the strengthening and water-transporting tissue of the plant.

E.Name: CodeGuidanceLine
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of guidance line.

P.Name: RWY
P.Doc: Taxi line on a runway surface, leading between the runway and other airport surfaces.

P.Name: TWY
P.Doc: Taxi line on a taxiway surface, leading between the taxiway and other airport surfaces.

P.Name: APRON
P.Doc: Taxi line on the apron surface.

P.Name: GATE_TLANE
P.Doc: Taxi line on the apron surface, leading to a gate/stand.

P.Name: LI_TLANE
P.Doc: Lead-in taxi line.

P.Name: LO_TLANE
P.Doc: Lead-out taxi line.

P.Name: AIR_TLANE
P.Doc: A virtual taxi line in the air, used by helicopters.

E.Name: CodeAirportWarning
E.Doc: A code indicating a reason for caution in airport operations. For example, work in progress on a runway.

P.Name: WIP
P.Doc: Work in progress.

P.Name: EQUIP
P.Doc: Men and Equipment.

P.Name: BIRD
P.Doc: Bird hazard

P.Name: ANIMAL
P.Doc: Animal hazard.

P.Name: RUBBER_REMOVAL
P.Doc: Removal of rubber deposits from runways.

P.Name: PARKED_ACFT
P.Doc: Parked or Disabled Aircraft located on the surface.

P.Name: RESURFACING
P.Doc: Resurfacing work in progress.

P.Name: PAVING
P.Doc: Surface paving work in progress.

P.Name: PAINTING
P.Doc: Surface painting work in progress.

P.Name: INSPECTION
P.Doc: Presence of people or equipment due to ground facilities inspection work in progress.

P.Name: GRASS_CUTTING
P.Doc: Presence of people or equipment due to grass cutting work in progress.

P.Name: CALIBRATION
P.Doc: Presence of people or equipment due to calibration work for ground facilities.

E.Name: CodeProtectAreaSection
E.Doc: A code indicating the location of the Protect Area lighting.

P.Name: EDGE
P.Doc: Area edge.

P.Name: END
P.Doc: Area end.

P.Name: CL
P.Doc: Area centreline

E.Name: CodeRoute
E.Doc: The route classification as ATS route or North Atlantic Tracks.

P.Name: ATS
P.Doc: ATS Route as described in ICAO Annex 11.

P.Name: NAT
P.Doc: North Atlantic Track (part of Organized Track System)

E.Name: CodeAirspacePointPosition
E.Doc: A code indicating the location of a significant point in relation to airspace. Description: Ex: In, Out, On Border.

P.Name: IN
P.Doc: Situated inside the airspace.

P.Name: OUT
P.Doc: Situated outside the airspace.

P.Name: BORDER
P.Doc: Situated on the border of the airspace.

E.Name: CodeContamination
E.Doc: An enumeration of substance types, which can contaminate airport/heliport movement areas.

P.Name: NONE
P.Doc: Clear and dry.

P.Name: DAMP
P.Doc: A wee bit wet.

P.Name: WATER
P.Doc: Wet or water patches.

P.Name: FROST
P.Doc: Rime or Frost covered (depth less than 1 mm)

P.Name: DRY_SNOW
WET_SNOW
P.Doc: Snow which, if compacted by hand, will stick together and tend to or form a snowball; specific gravity: 0.35 up to but not including 0.5.

P.Name: SLUSH
P.Doc:
Water-saturated snow which with a heel-and-toe slapdown motion against the ground will be displaced with a splatter; specific gravity: 0.5 up to 0.8.
Note.- Combinations of ice, snow and/or standing water may, especially when rain, rain and snow, or snow is falling, produce substances with specific gravities in excess of 0.8. These substances, due to their high water/ice content, will have a transparent rather than a cloudy appearance and, at the higher specific gravities, will be readily distinguishable from slush.

P.Name: COMPACT_SNOW
P.Doc: Snow which has been compressed into a solid mass that resists further compression and will hold together or break up into lumps if picked up; specific gravity: 0.5 and over.

P.Name: RUT
P.Doc: Frozen ruts or ridges.

P.Name: ASH
P.Doc: Ash from volcanic activity.

P.Name: OIL
P.Doc: Oil and gas.

P.Name: RUBBER
P.Doc: Rubber deposits.

P.Name: GRAS
P.Doc: Overgrown grass

E.Name: CodeFrictionDevice
E.Doc: An enumeration of equipment types used to determine the friction coefficient on an airport/heliport movement area.

P.Name: GRT
P.Doc: Grip tester.

P.Name: RFT
P.Doc: Runway friction tester.

P.Name: SFH
P.Doc: Surface friction tester (high-pressure tire).

P.Name: SFL
P.Doc: Surface friction tester (low-pressure tire).

P.Name: SKH
P.Doc: Skiddometer (high-pressure tire).

P.Name: SKL
P.Doc: Skiddometer (low-pressure tire).

P.Name: TAP
P.Doc: Tapley meter.

E.Name: CodeFrictionEstimate
E.Doc: An enumeration of qualitative estimates of the friction on a movement area.

P.Name: MEDIUM_GOOD
P.Doc: Medium to good.

P.Name: MEDIUM_POOR
P.Doc: Medium to poor.

P.Name: UNRELIABLE
P.Doc: The surface conditions or available friction measuring device do not permit a reliable surface friction measurement to be made.

E.Name: CodeHeightReference
E.Doc: A code indicating the reference surface for a height value, especially for approach procedures related heights.

P.Name: HAT
P.Doc: Height above threshold.

P.Name: HAA
P.Doc: Height above airport.

P.Name: HAL
P.Doc: Height above landing (for helicopters).

P.Name: HAS
P.Doc: Height above surface (for a point in space).

E.Name: CodeAerialRefuellingPoint
E.Doc: Defines the usage type of an aerial refuelling point.

P.Name: INITIAL
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Initial Point

P.Name: CONTROL
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Control Point

P.Name: CHECK
P.Doc: Navigation check point

P.Name: EXIT
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Exit Point

P.Name: ENTRY
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Entry Point (Anchors Only)

P.Name: ANCHOR
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Anchor Point (Anchors Only)

P.Name: PATTERN
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Anchor Pattern point (Anchors Only).

E.Name: CodeAerialRefuelling
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of aerial refuelling pattern.

P.Name: TRACK
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Track of type TRACK, which is linear.

P.Name: ANCHOR
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Track of type ANCHOR, with the shape of a race track.

P.Name: BOTH
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Track with the shape of both TRACK and ANCHOR.

E.Name: CodeLoadingBridge
E.Doc: An coded list of values that indicate types of passenger loading bridges.

P.Name: MOVABLE_ARM
P.Doc: Movable arm

P.Name: PORTABLE_RAMP
P.Doc: Portable ramp

P.Name: PORTABLE_STAIRS
P.Doc: Portable stairs

E.Name: CodeApproachGuidance
E.Doc: Degree to which navigation aids provide accurate approach guidance. Precision approaches utilize both lateral (course) and vertical (glideslope) information

P.Name: NON_PRECISION
P.Doc: Non-precision approach runway

P.Name: ILS_PRECISION_CAT_I
P.Doc: ILS precision approach runway, category I

P.Name: ILS_PRECISION_CAT_II
P.Doc: ILS precision approach runway, category II

P.Name: ILS_PRECISION_CAT_IIIA
P.Doc: ILS precision approach runway category III A

P.Name: ILS_PRECISION_CAT_IIIB
P.Doc: ILS precision approach runway category III B

P.Name: ILS_PRECISION_CAT_IIIC
P.Doc: ILS precision approach runway category III C

P.Name: ILS_PRECISION_CAT_IIID
P.Doc: ILS precision approach runway category III D

P.Name: MLS_PRECISION
P.Doc: Microwave landing system precision approach

E.Name: CodeAircraftWingspanClass
E.Doc: A grouping of airplanes based on wingspan.

P.Name: I
P.Doc: Up to but not including 49 ft (15 m)

P.Name: II
P.Doc: 49 ft (15 m) up to but not including 79 ft (24 m)

P.Name: III
P.Doc: 79 ft (24 m) up to but not including 118 ft (36 m)

P.Name: IV
P.Doc: 118 ft (36 m) up to but not including 171 ft (52 m)

P.Name: V
P.Doc: 171 ft (52 m) up to but not including 214 ft (65 m)

P.Name: VI
P.Doc: 214 ft (65 m) up to but not including 262 ft (80 m)

E.Name: CodeArrestingGearEngageDevice
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of device (for example: a hook) that is used to engage an aircraft upon landing in order to immediately stop it.

P.Name: 61QSII
P.Doc: 61QSII, a barricade net system

P.Name: 62NI
P.Doc: 62NI, a net barrier with hook cable interconnect

P.Name: 63PI
P.Doc: 63PI, a dual cable interconnect for hook engagements

P.Name: NET_A30
P.Doc: A30, an AERAZUR (manufacturer name) 30-element net (F30)

P.Name: NET_A40
P.Doc: A40, an AERAZUR (manufacturer name) 40-element net (F40)

P.Name: BAK_11_STRUT
P.Doc: BAK-11, a main strut engaging device.

P.Name: BAK_12
P.Doc: BAK-12, engaging device.

P.Name: BAK_14_HOOK
P.Doc: BAK-14, a retractable hook cable engaging device that may be used bi-directionally. The cable takes 5 seconds to be raised.

P.Name: BAK_15_STANCHION_NET
P.Doc: BAK-15, a 61QSIIM stanchion and net barricade system.

P.Name: BAK_15_HOOK
P.Doc: BAK-15 (NI), a web barrier interconnected with hook pickup cable.

P.Name: EMAS
P.Doc: Engineered Materials Arresting System. High-energy-absorbing material located in the runway overrun that is designed to crush under the weight of an aircraft as the material exerts deceleration forces on the aircraft landing gear.

P.Name: HOOK_CABLE
P.Doc: An unspecified type of hook cable (tail hook) engagement.

P.Name: HP_NET
P.Doc: HP-NET, an ADEC (brand name) high performance net.

P.Name: J_BAR
P.Doc: J-BAR, a generic 'barrier' (non-hook cable) engagements.

P.Name: JET_BARRIER
P.Doc: An unspecified barrier used to stop aircraft.

P.Name: MA_1_NET
P.Doc: MA-1, a main gear cable engagement net barrier (early MA-1A).

P.Name: MA_1A_HOOK_CABLE
P.Doc: MA-1A (MOD), an MA-1A main gear cable engagement net barrier with interconnected hook cable.

P.Name: NET
P.Doc: An unspecified type of net engagement.

P.Name: HOOK_H
P.Doc: Type H, a retractable hook cable engaging device that may be used bi-directionally. The cable takes 1.5 seconds to be raised.

E.Name: CodeObstructionIdSurfaceZone
E.Doc: Specifies zones within obstruction identification surfaces (OIS)

E.Name: CodeBuoy
E.Doc: Code indicating the type of Buoy

P.Name: BLACK_RED_FL2
P.Doc: Danger - Black and red alternating horizontal stripes indicates position of isolated danger

P.Name: GREEN
P.Doc: Lateral buoy - Marks port side of the channel when sailing toward the sea

P.Name: GREEN_RED_GFL
P.Doc: Lateral buoy - Preferred channel is to port when a red horizontal stripe is sandwiched between two green horizontal stripes

P.Name: Q3_VQ3
P.Doc: Cardinal buoy - Yellow stripe sandwiched between two black stripes and/or two triangles, apex on one pointing up and apex of other pointing down indicates safe water is to the east

P.Name: Q6_VQ6
P.Doc: Cardinal buoy - Yellow stripe is atop a black stripe and/or twp triangles, apex of both pointing down indicates safe water is to the south

P.Name: Q9_VQ9
P.Doc: Cardinal buoy - Black stripe sandwiched between two yellow stripes and/or two triangles apex of both point toward each other indicates safe water is to the west

P.Name: Q_VQ
P.Doc: Cardinal buoy - Black stripe atop a yellow stripe and/or two triangles apex of both point up indicates safe water is to the north

P.Name: RED
P.Doc: Lateral buoy - Marks port side of the channel when returning from the sea

P.Name: RED_GREEN_RFL
P.Doc: Lateral buoy - Preferred channel to starboard when a green horizontal strips is sandwiched between two red horizontal stripes

P.Name: RED_WHITE
P.Doc: Safe water buoy - Alternating red and white vertical stripes indicates safe water

P.Name: WHITE
P.Doc: No colour is stated on the chart

P.Name: YELLOW
P.Doc: Special buoy - Area used by navies, pipelines, surfing

E.Name: CodeRoad
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of a road.

P.Name: SERVICE
P.Doc: Service road

P.Name: PUBLIC
P.Doc: Public road

E.Name: CodeAerialRefuellingPrefix
E.Doc: A prefix for the designator of the Aerial Refuelling route.

P.Name: AR
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling.

E.Name: CodeMilitaryTraining
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of flying on a military training route.

P.Name: IR
P.Doc: IFR Training route

P.Name: VR
P.Doc: VFR Training Route

P.Name: SR
P.Doc: Slow Speed Low Altitude Training Route

E.Name: CodeFacilityRanking
E.Doc: The order of priority of a facility, within a range of similar facilities. For example, "primary", "secondary" or "alternate".

E.Name: CodeMilitaryRoutePoint
E.Doc: A code indicating the usage of a point on a military training route.

P.Name: S
P.Doc: Entry Point (Starting Point)

P.Name: T
P.Doc: Turning Point

P.Name: X
P.Doc: Exit Point (Ending Point)

P.Name: AS
P.Doc: Alternate Entry Point

P.Name: AX
P.Doc: Alternate Exit Point

P.Name: ASX
P.Doc: Alternate Entry/Exit Point

E.Name: CodeArrestingGearEnergyAbsorb
E.Doc: The type of energy absorber (for example: a rotary brake) by which the arresting gear system rapidly dissipates the kinetic energy of a moving aircraft that engages the arresting system, bringing the aircraft to a stop.

P.Name: ROTARY_1300
P.Doc: 1300 rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'BA'.

P.Name: ROTARY_2800
P.Doc: 2800 rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'BB'.

P.Name: ROTARY_34B_1A
P.Doc: 34B-1A rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AA'.

P.Name: ROTARY_34B_1B
P.Doc: 34B-1B rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AB'.

P.Name: ROTARY_34B_1C
P.Doc: 34B-1C rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AC'.

P.Name: ROTARY_34D_1F
P.Doc: 34D-1F rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AL'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_2C
P.Doc: 44B-2C rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AD'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_2D
P.Doc: 44B-2D rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AE'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_2E
P.Doc: 44B-2E rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AF'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_2F
P.Doc: 44B-2F rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AG'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_2H
P.Doc: 44B-2H rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AH'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_2I
P.Doc: 44B-2I rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AJ'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_2L
P.Doc: 44B-2L rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AI'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_3A
P.Doc: 44B-3A rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AN'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_3H
P.Doc: 44B-3H rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AO'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_3L
P.Doc: 44B-3L rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AK'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_4C
P.Doc: 44B-4C rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AP'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_4E
P.Doc: 44B-4E rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AQ'.

P.Name: ROTARY_44B_4H
P.Doc: 44B-4H rotary hydraulic water brake. May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AR'.

P.Name: ROTARY_500S
P.Doc: 500S rotary friction brake that may carry a nameplate showing 'Bliss', 'Esco', or 'Gulf+Western' (the 'G+W' logo). May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AS'.

P.Name: ROTARY_500S_4
P.Doc: 500S-4 rotary friction brake that may carry a nameplate showing 'Bliss', 'Esco', or 'Gulf+Western' (the 'G+W' logo). May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AT'.

P.Name: ROTARY_500S_6
P.Doc: 500S-6 rotary friction brake that may carry a nameplate showing 'Bliss', 'Esco', or 'Gulf+Western' (the 'G+W' logo). May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AU'.

P.Name: ROTARY_500S_8
P.Doc: 500S-8 rotary friction brake that may carry a nameplate showing 'Bliss', 'Esco', or 'Gulf+Western' (the 'G+W' logo). May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AW'.

P.Name: ROTARYTRANS_500S_8
P.Doc: 500S-8 rotary friction brake transportable arresting gear that may carry a nameplate showing 'Bliss', 'Esco', or 'Gulf+Western' (the 'G+W' logo). May be used with any type of engagement device. May be designated as 'AV'.

P.Name: MOBILROTARY_M21

E.Name: CodeEmissionBand
E.Doc: The type of emission band

P.Name: U
P.Doc: Ultra high frequency

P.Name: H
P.Doc: High frequency

P.Name: M
P.Doc: Medium frequency

E.Name: CodeMeteoConditions
E.Doc: A code indicating whether the meteorological conditions allow visual or instrumental operations.

P.Name: IMC
P.Doc: [Instrument Meteorological Conditions] Weather conditions that normally require pilots to fly primarily by reference to instruments, and therefore under Instrument Flight Rules (IFR).

P.Name: VMC
P.Doc: [Visual Meteorological Conditions] Weather conditions in which visual flight rules (VFR) flight is permitted. That is, conditions in which pilots have sufficient visibility to fly the aircraft maintaining visual separation from terrain and other aircraft.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: Both IMC and VMC.

E.Name: CodeValueInterpretation
E.Doc: A code indicating how a value needs to be interpreted when used as a filter or condition. For example: above the value or below the value.

P.Name: ABOVE
P.Doc: Higher than the value.

P.Name: AT_OR_ABOVE
P.Doc: Equal or higher than the value.

P.Name: AT_OR_BELOW
P.Doc: Equal or lower than the value.

P.Name: BELOW
P.Doc: Lower than the value.

E.Name: CodeNavigationArea
E.Doc: code indicating the type of navigation area

P.Name: PNA
P.Doc: Pilot Navigation Area

P.Name: OMNI
P.Doc: Omnidirectional area

P.Name: DVA
P.Doc: Diverse Vector Area

E.Name: CodeProcedureAvailability
E.Doc: A code indicating the availability of a procedure for use.

P.Name: USABLE
P.Doc: The procedure may be flown according to its timetable. Is active and can be used.

P.Name: UNUSABLE
P.Doc: Temporarily suspended because, for example, a temporary obstacle makes the procedure unsafe

E.Name: CodePilotControlledLighting
E.Doc: A list to indicate the standard with which the pilot controlled lighting service complies.

P.Name: STANDARD_FAA
P.Doc: FAA Standard.

E.Name: CodeIntensityStandBy
E.Doc: Enumeration to indicate the intensity level of the lighting when not in use.

E.Name: CodeTelecomNetwork
E.Doc: Codelist containing the Telecom Networks that can be used to address an organisation.

P.Name: AFTN
P.Doc: The data interchange in the AFS is performed by the Aeronautical Fixed Telecommunications Network, AFTN. This is a message handling network running according to ICAO Standards documented in Annex 10 to the ICAO Convention

P.Name: AMHS
P.Doc: Aeronautical Message Handling System. A standard for aeronautical ground-ground communications (e.g. for the transmission of NOTAM, Flight Plans or Meteorological Data) based on X.400 profiles. It has been defined by the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO)

P.Name: INTERNET
P.Doc: The Internet is a worldwide, publicly accessible series of interconnected computer networks that transmit data by packet switching using the standard Internet Protocol (IP)

P.Name: SITA
P.Doc: SITA network

P.Name: ACARS
P.Doc: Aircraft Communications Addressing and Reporting System. A datalink system that enables ground stations (airports, aircraft maintenance bases, etc.) and commercial aircraft to communicate without voice using a datalink system.

P.Name: ADNS
P.Doc: ARINC Data Network Service (retired Mar 2007)

E.Name: CodeFlightDestination
E.Doc: A coded list of values that designate the intentions of a flight in relation with a location, such as arrival, departure or over-flight.

P.Name: ARR
P.Doc: Arrival flights.

P.Name: DEP
P.Doc: Departing flights.

P.Name: OVERFLY
P.Doc: Overflying flights.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All types (arrival, departure and overflying).

E.Name: CodeServiceInformation
E.Doc: A list of codes used to designate information provision services.

P.Name: AFIS
P.Doc: Aerodrome flight information service, as defined in the ICAO Annex 11.

P.Name: AIS
P.Doc: Aeronautical information service, as defined in the ICAO Annex 15.

P.Name: ATIS
P.Doc: Automated terminal information service, as defined in the ICAO Annex 11.

P.Name: BRIEFING
P.Doc: Pre-flight and post-flight briefing service.

P.Name: FIS
P.Doc: A service provided for the purpose of giving advice and information useful for the safe and efficient conduct of flights.

P.Name: OFIS_VHF
P.Doc: VHF operational flight information service (OFIS) broadcasts, as defined by the ICAO Annex 11.

P.Name: OFIS_HF
P.Doc: HF operational flight information service (OFIS) broadcasts, as defined by the ICAO Annex 11.

P.Name: NOTAM
P.Doc: Provision of NOTAM service, as defined by ICAO Annex 15.

P.Name: INFO
P.Doc: Limited ad-hoc information provision, about a specific activity at a particular location.

P.Name: RAF
P.Doc: Regional area forecasting service.

P.Name: METAR
P.Doc: Aviation routine weather report

P.Name: SIGMET
P.Doc: Information issued by a meteorological watch office concerning the occurrence or expected occurrence of specified en-route weather phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations.

P.Name: TWEB
P.Doc: Transcribed weather broadcast service.

P.Name: TAF
P.Doc: Terminal area meteorological forecast service.

P.Name: VOLMET
P.Doc: Meteorological information for aircraft in flight broadcast service.

P.Name: ALTIMETER
P.Doc: Altimeter setting information provision service.

P.Name: ASOS
P.Doc: Automated Surface Observation System

P.Name: AWOS
P.Doc: Automated Weather Observation Service

E.Name: CodeServiceATFM
E.Doc: A list of codes used to designate flight planning and air traffic flow management services.

P.Name: FPL
P.Doc: A service that provides flight planning acceptance and distribution to the ATC Unites concerned.

P.Name: FPLV
P.Doc: A service that provides flight planning validation.

P.Name: ATFM
P.Doc: Air traffic flow management service.

P.Name: CLEARANCE
P.Doc: A service providing permissions (entry, landing, overflying, exit, etc.) for a given location.

P.Name: SCHED
P.Doc: Scheduling and slot allocation service.

E.Name: CodeServiceATC
E.Doc: A list of codes used to designate flight separation and ground control services.

P.Name: ACS
P.Doc: En-route area control service (same as ARTCC service in US)

P.Name: UAC
P.Doc: Upper area control service

P.Name: OACS
P.Doc: Oceanic area control service.

P.Name: APP
P.Doc: Approach area control service (includes departure and arrival).

P.Name: TWR
P.Doc: Aerodrome control tower service.

P.Name: ADVS
P.Doc: Advisory service.

P.Name: EFAS
P.Doc: En-route flight advisory service.

P.Name: CTAF
P.Doc: Common traffic advisory frequency service.

E.Name: CodeServiceSAR
E.Doc: A list of codes used to designate services in relation with search and rescue.

P.Name: ALRS
P.Doc: Alerting service.

P.Name: SAR
P.Doc: Search and rescue service.

P.Name: RCC
P.Doc: Rescue co-ordination service.

E.Name: CodeCommunicationChannel
E.Doc:
A codified value that indicates a pair of frequencies or a band used for radio communications.
Note: unable yet to provide a list of values in the current version of the model.

E.Name: CodePassengerService
E.Doc: A code indicating a type of service provided to passengers at the airport.

P.Name: CUST
P.Doc: Customs and immigration service.

P.Name: SAN
P.Doc: Health and sanitation service.

P.Name: SECUR
P.Doc: Security service.

P.Name: VET
P.Doc: Veterinary service.

P.Name: HOTEL
P.Doc: Hotel reservations/bookings.

P.Name: TRANSPORT
P.Doc: Transport facilities and information.

P.Name: REST
P.Doc: Restaurant/cafe/bar facility.

P.Name: INFO
P.Doc: Tourist information.

P.Name: BANK
P.Doc: Banking/currency exchange facilities.

P.Name: POST
P.Doc: Letter/parcel post.

P.Name: MEDIC
P.Doc: Medical facilities.

E.Name: CodeServiceGroundControl
E.Doc: A code indicating the type of ground traffic control service.

P.Name: TWR
P.Doc: Aerodrome control tower service.

P.Name: SMGCS
P.Doc: Surface movement control service.

P.Name: TAXI
P.Doc: Taxi clearance service.

E.Name: CodeStatusService
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicate the operational capability of a service.

P.Name: NORMAL
P.Doc: Normal operations.

P.Name: LIMITED
P.Doc: Operating with limited capabilities.

P.Name: ONTEST
P.Doc: On test, do not use.

P.Name: UNSERVICEABLE
P.Doc: Unserviceable (unavailable).

E.Name: CodeCommunicationMode
E.Doc: A coded indicator for the type of communication channel.

P.Name: HF
P.Doc: High Frequency radio voice channel.

P.Name: VHF
P.Doc: Very High Frequency radio voice channel with 25 KHz spacing.

P.Name: VDL1
P.Doc: Legacy VHF data link protocol employing CSMA. Being replaced by VDL2

P.Name: VDL2
P.Doc: VHF data link protocol employing CSMA but much more efficient than VDL1.

P.Name: VDL4
P.Doc: VHF data link protocol using TDMA; being considered for use by ADS-B.

P.Name: AMSS
P.Doc: Aeronautical Mobile Satellite Service, currently used by ACARS.

P.Name: ADS_B
P.Doc: Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast: standard mode.

P.Name: ADS_B_VDL
P.Doc: Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast: extended mode, using VDL 4.

P.Name: HFDL
P.Doc: High Frequency Data Link.

P.Name: VHF_833
P.Doc: Very High Frequency radio voice channel with 8.33 KHz spacing.

P.Name: UHF
P.Doc: Ultra High Frequency radio voice channel.

E.Name: CodeCommunicationDirection
E.Doc: A coded indicator for the directionality of a communication channel.

P.Name: UPLINK
P.Doc: Channel carries Ground-to-air traffic only.

P.Name: DOWNLINK
P.Doc: Channel carries Air-to-Ground traffic only.

P.Name: BIDIRECTIONAL
P.Doc: Channel carries traffic both ways.

P.Name: UPCAST
P.Doc: Broadcast from ground to aircraft.

P.Name: DOWNCAST
P.Doc: Broadcast from aircraft.

E.Name: CodeCheckpointCategory
E.Doc: The position of the checkpoint; airborne or ground

E.Name: CodeLightHoldingPosition
E.Doc: A coded list of light signs provided for a taxiway holding position.

P.Name: STOP_BAR
P.Doc: Stop-bar (on the surface of the taxiway).

P.Name: SIGN
P.Doc: Lighted sign on the side of the holding position.

E.Name: CodeNavigationAreaRestriction
E.Doc: Indicates the type of restricted area that aircraft should avoid

P.Name: VECTOR
P.Doc: Vectoring area restriction

P.Name: OMNIDIRECTIONAL
P.Doc: Omnidirectional departure restriction

E.Name: CodeSystemActivation
E.Doc: A code indicating the activation / deactivation of a system following a specific comand.

P.Name: ON
P.Doc: System in status "on-line".

P.Name: ON_OR_OFF
P.Doc: System changes between "ON" and "OFF", depending on the previous state.

P.Name: OFF
P.Doc: System in status "off-line".

E.Name: CodeWakeTurbulence
E.Doc: A coded indication of the wake turbulence category of the aircraft.

P.Name: LOW
P.Doc: Low wake turbulence.

P.Name: MEDIUM
P.Doc: Medium wake turbulence.

P.Name: HIGH
P.Doc: High wake turbulence.

E.Name: CodePAR
E.Doc: Type of Precision Approach Radar equipment.

P.Name: FPN16
P.Doc: Made by Raytheon. Range 15 miles. QKH1811 coaxial Magnetron. Similar to CPN-4 and MPN-11.

P.Name: FPN62
P.Doc: Made by Raytheon. Range 15 miles. QKH1811 coaxial Magnetron. Known as Normal PAR.. The version produced for Britain is called Falconner. Replaced CPN-4 and FPN-16.

P.Name: GPN22
P.Doc: Made by Raytheon. Derived from TPN-25. HIPAR = High Performance Precision Approach Radar. 20 mile range on 1 metre target. Can track 6 targets at once.

P.Name: GPN25
P.Doc: Made by Raytheon. Fixed base version of TPN-25. Part of TPN-19 Air Traffic Control System.

P.Name: MPN14K
P.Doc: Made by ITT Gillfilan. Mobile ATC radar for military use. Comprises two Radars, a PAR with 2 x 80Kw Transmitters in I/J Band, and an approach Surveillance Radar with dual 1Mw Transmitters in

P.Name: TPN19
P.Doc: Built by Raytheon. Described in some sources as launching control, having two Radars; Surveillance and PAR. TPN-24 and TPN-25.

E.Name: CodePrimaryRadar
E.Doc: Type of Radar System (not to be confused with the component list)

P.Name: ASR
P.Doc:
Airport Surveillance Radar system.
Airport Surveillance Radar (ASR) is a category of surveillance radars. ASR is designed to provide relatively short-range coverage in the general vicinity of an airport and to serve as an expeditious means of handling terminal traffic through observation of precise aircraft locations on a radarscope. The ASR can also be used as an instrument approach aid.

P.Name: ARSR
P.Doc:
Air Route Surveillance Radar system.
Air Route Surveillance Radar (ARSR) or Route Surveillance Radar (RSR) is a system of remotely located, long-range radars that primarily provides a display of aircraft locations over large areas to air route traffic control centres

E.Name: CodeRadarService
E.Doc: A list of service types for Radar Systems.

P.Name: PAR
P.Doc:
Precision Approach Radar
Precision Approach Radar (PAR) is designed for use as a landing aid rather than an aid for sequencing and spacing aircraft to provide lateral and vertical guidance to an aircraft pilot for landing up to the missed approach point. PAR equipment may be used as a primary landing aid or it may be used to monitor other types of approaches. It is designed to display range, azimuth, and elevation information. It is similar to an instrument landing system (ILS) but requires control instructions. One type of instrument approach that can make use of PAR is the ground-controlled approach (GCA).

P.Name: ARSR
P.Doc:
Air Route Surveillance Radar
Air Route Surveillance Radar (ARSR) or Route Surveillance Radar (RSR) is a system of remotely located, long-range radars that primarily provides a display of aircraft locations over large areas to air route traffic control centres

P.Name: ASR
P.Doc:
Airport Surveillance Radar
Airport Surveillance Radar (ASR) is a category of surveillance radars. ASR is designed to provide relatively short-range coverage in the general vicinity of an airport and to serve as an expeditious means of handling terminal traffic through observation of precise aircraft locations on a radarscope. The ASR can also be used as an instrument approach aid.

P.Name: SSR
P.Doc:
Secondary Surveillance Radar or ATCRBS (Air Traffic Control Radar Beacon System)
Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR) (aka Secondary Radar (SECRA) or ATC Radar Beacon System (ATCRBS)) is a radar system in which the object to be detected is fitted with the cooperative equipment in the form of a radio receiver/transmitter (transponder). Radar pulses transmitted from the searching transmitter/receiver (interrogator) site are received in the cooperative equipment and used to trigger a distinctive transmission from the transponder. This reply transmission, rather than a reflected signal, is then received back at the transmitter/receiver site for processing and display at an air traffic control facility.

E.Name: CodeReflector
E.Doc: Type of Reflector associated to the PAR.

P.Name: TOUCHDOWN
P.Doc: Touchdown Reflector

P.Name: RUNWAY_END
P.Doc: Reflector placed off the end of the runway

P.Name: REFERENCE
P.Doc: Reference Reflector

E.Name: CodeStandbyPower
E.Doc: Type of power used when the radar is required to operate on standby.

E.Name: CodeTransponder
E.Doc: A code indicating a transponder mode.

P.Name: MODE_1
P.Doc: Mode 1 provides 2-digit 5-bit mission code. (military only - cockpit selectable)

P.Name: MODE_2
P.Doc: Mode 2 provides 4-digit octal unit code. (military only - set on ground for fighters, can be changed in flight by transport aircraft)

P.Name: MODE_3A
P.Doc: Mode 3/A provides a 4-digit octal identification code for the aircraft, assigned by the air traffic controller. (military and civilian)

P.Name: MODE_4
P.Doc: Mode 4 provides a 3-pulse reply to crypto coded challenge. (military only)

P.Name: MODE_5
P.Doc: Mode 5 provides a cryptographically secured version of Mode S and ADS-B GPS position. (military only)

P.Name: MODE_C
P.Doc: Mode C provides 4-digit octal code for aircraft's pressure altitude. (military and civilian)

P.Name: MODE_S
P.Doc:
Mode S provides multiple information formats to a selective interrogation. Each aircraft is assigned a fixed 24-bit address. (military and civilian)
Mode S, or mode select, despite also being called a transponder radar system replacement for Air Traffic Control Radar Beacon System (ATCRBS), is actually a data packet protocol which can be used to augment ATCRBS transponder positioning equipment (radar and TCAS). Mode S is designed to fully interface with ATCRBS systems: mode S SSRs can interrogate ATCRBS transponders, and AIS-P transponders will also reply to older ATCRBS and TCAS interrogations.

E.Name: CodeAirspaceDependency
E.Doc: A code indicating the extent of dependency relation between an AirspaceVolume and another Airspace.

P.Name: FULL_GEOMETRY
P.Doc: The overall geometry of the Airspace is used.

P.Name: HORZ_PROJECTION
P.Doc: The horizontal projection of the Airspace is inherited.

E.Name: CodeUnitDependency
E.Doc: A list of coded values that indicate the kind of dependency between a Unit and a RelatedUnit.

P.Name: OWNER
P.Doc: The Unit is owned by (subordinated to) the RelatedUnit.

P.Name: PROVIDER
P.Doc: In the provision of its services, the Unit uses the services of the RelatedUnit.

P.Name: ALTERNATE
P.Doc: The RelatedUnit provide an alternate/replacement service to the current Unit.

E.Name: CodeVisualDockingGuidance
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicate types of systems used at aircraft stands in order to help the pilot align and position the aircraft.

P.Name: AGNIS
P.Doc: Azimuth Guidance for Nose-In Stand, providing centreline guidance only by using two coloured lights mounted side by side.

P.Name: PAPA
P.Doc: Parallax Aircraft Parking Aid consisting of a large grey/black box that uses the effect of perspective in order to indicate the relative position of the aircraft along the centreline.

P.Name: SAFE_GATE
P.Doc: A type of A-VDGS that uses an aircraft symbol on a display indicating the relative position along the centreline.

P.Name: SAFE_DOC
P.Doc: Safe dock allows aircraft to park up to an accuracy of 10 cm using lasers to attain the aircraft's position.

P.Name: APIS
P.Doc: Aircraft Positioning and Information System that shows azimuth information using a series of parallel and black bars which kink at their midpoint.

P.Name: A_VDGS
P.Doc: (Generic) Advanced Visual Docking Guidance System that features electronic displays which perform the functions of an AGNIS/PAPA installation, although with much greater accuracy. They may also provide collision avoidance from static objects.

P.Name: AGNIS_STOP
P.Doc: AGNIS system complemented with a simple stop light, on the side of the AGNIS display.

P.Name: AGNIS_PAPA
P.Doc: Combined AGNIS and PAPA device.

E.Name: CodeMarkingCondition
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicate the status of the painted surface marking elements.

P.Name: GOOD
P.Doc: Marking is in good condition.

P.Name: FAIR
P.Doc: Marking is in fair condition.

P.Name: POOR
P.Doc: Marking is in poor condition.

P.Name: EXCELLENT
P.Doc: Marking is in perfect condition.

E.Name: CodeNavaidPurpose
E.Doc: A coded list of values indicating the intended usage of a navaid (enroute or airport)

P.Name: TERMINAL
P.Doc: Intended for usage in the terminal area, in particular for approach, landing and departure procedures

P.Name: ENROUTE
P.Doc: Intended for en-route usage

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: Intended for all usages

E.Name: CodeRuleProcedure
E.Doc: An open coded list of values indicating the purpose of a rule or procedure.

P.Name: RULE
P.Doc: A prescribed guide for conduct or action.

P.Name: LAW
P.Doc: A binding rule, enforced by the national/international legislation.

P.Name: PROCEDURE
P.Doc: A particular way of accomplishing something or of acting

P.Name: PRACTICE
P.Doc: The usual way of doing something, even if it is not formally prescribed

P.Name: ICAO_DIFF
P.Doc: A difference between the national rules/procedures and the ICAO Standards, Recommended Practices and Procedures.

E.Name: CodeRuleProcedureTitle
E.Doc: An open list of values indicating a general heading by which a rule or procedure is usually identified in the Aeronautical Information Publications (AIP) or similar/related documents.

P.Name: ENTRY_TRANSIT_DEPARTURE_OF_AIRCRAFT
P.Doc: Rules and procedures governing the entry, transit and departure of aircraft.

P.Name: ENTRY_TRANSIT_DEPARTURE_SCHEDULED
P.Doc: Rules and procedures governing the entry, transit and departure of scheduled flights.

P.Name: ENTRY_TRANSIT_DEPARTURE_NON_SCHEDULED
P.Doc: Rules and procedures governing the entry, transit and departure of non-scheduled flights.

P.Name: ENTRY_TRANSIT_DEPARTURE_PRIVATE
P.Doc: Rules and procedures governing the entry, transit and departure of private flights.

P.Name: PUBLIC_HEALTH_MEASURES_AIRCRAFT
P.Doc: Public health measures applied to arriving, departing or transit aircraft.

P.Name: CUSTOMS_REQUIREMENTS
P.Doc: Customs formalities for passengers and crew.

P.Name: IMMIGRATION_REQUIREMENTS
P.Doc: Immigration formalities for passengers and crew.

P.Name: PUBLIC_HEALTH_MEASURES_PASSENGERS
P.Doc: Public health measures applied to disembarking or departing passengers and crew.

P.Name: ENTRY_TRANSIT_DEPARTURE_CARGO
P.Doc: Regulations concerning entry, transit and departure of cargo.

P.Name: AIRCRAFT_INSTRUMENTS_EQUIPMENT_FLIGHT_DOCUMENTS
P.Doc: Aircraft instruments, equipment and flight documents to be carried on aircraft.

P.Name: NATIONAL_REGULATIONS
P.Doc: National regulations affecting air navigation.

P.Name: INTERNATIONAL_AGREEMENTS_CONVENTIONS
P.Doc: International agreements in which the State is part and which affect air navigation.

P.Name: DIFFERENCES_ICAO_STANDARDS_RECOMMENDED_PRACTICES_PROCEDURES
P.Doc: Significant differences between national regulations and practices of the State and related ICAO provisions.

P.Name: MEASURING_SYSTEM_AIRCRAFT_MARKINGS_HOLIDAYS
P.Doc: A table of units of measurement, calendar, time systems, geodetic reference system, EGM-96 and public holidays.

P.Name: ABBREVIATIONS_AIS_PUBLICATIONS
P.Doc: A list of alphabetically arranged abbreviations used by the State in its AIP.

P.Name: AERODROME_HELIPORT_CHARGES
P.Doc: Type of charges which may be applicable at aerodromes/heliports.

P.Name: AIR_NAVIGATION_SERVICES_CHARGES
P.Doc: Charges which may be applicable to air navigation services provided for international use, approach control, route air navigation services.

P.Name: FLIGHT_RULES_GENERAL
P.Doc: General flight rules as applied within the State.

P.Name: VISUAL_FLIGHT_RULES
P.Doc: Visual flight rules as applied within the State.

P.Name: INSTRUMENT_FLIGHT_RULES
P.Doc: Instrument flight rules as applied within the State.

P.Name: ATS_AIRSPACE_CLASSIFICATION
P.Doc: Description of ATS airspace classes as applied within the State.

P.Name: HOLDING_APPROACH_DEPARTURE_PROCEDURES
P.Doc: The criteria on which holding, approach and departure procedures are established for arriving flights and departing flights from any aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: ATS_SURVEILLANCE_SERVICES_PROCEDURES
P.Doc: Primary radar services and procedures, secondary surveillance radar (SSR) operating procedures and automatic dependent surveillance - broadcast (ADS-B) coverage.

P.Name: ALTIMETER_SETTING_PROCEDURES
P.Doc: Altimeter setting procedures in use, containing procedures applicable to operators and cruising levels.

P.Name: REGIONAL_SUPPLEMENTARY_PROCEDURES
P.Doc: Regional supplementary procedures (SUPPS) affecting the entire area of State responsibility.

P.Name: AIR_TRAFFIC_FLOW_MANAGEMENT
P.Doc: ATFM structure types of flow messages and procedures applicable for departing flights, flight plan requirements and slot allocations.

P.Name: FLIGHT_PLANNING
P.Doc: Procedures for the submission of a flight plan; repetitive flight plan system; and changes to the submitted flight plan.

P.Name: ADDRESSING_FLIGHT_PLAN_MESSAGES
P.Doc: Addresses allocated to flight plans, showing: category of flight (IFR, VFR or both), route and message address.

P.Name: INTERCEPTION_CIVIL_AIRCRAFT
P.Doc: Interception procedures and visual signals to be used.

P.Name: UNLAWFUL_INTERFERENCE
P.Doc: Procedures to be applied in case of unlawful interference.

P.Name: AIR_TRAFFIC_INCIDENTS
P.Doc: Definition of air traffic incidents, use of the "Air Traffic Incident Reporting Form", reporting procedures and purpose of reporting and handling of the form.

P.Name: AERODROME_HELIPORT_AVAILABILITY
P.Doc: The general conditions of the State's designated authority responsible for aerodromes and heliports availability.

P.Name: LOCAL_TRAFFIC_REGULATIONS
P.Doc: Standard routes for taxiing aircraft, parking regulations, school and training flights and similar but excluding flight procedures.

P.Name: NOISE_ABATEMENT_PROCEDURES
P.Doc: Detailed description of noise abatement procedures established at the aerodrome.

P.Name: AERODROME_FLIGHT_PROCEDURES
P.Doc: The conditions and flight procedures, including radar and low visibility procedures at the aerodrome and associated equipment authorized for use under these conditions.

P.Name: AERODROME_BIRD_CONCENTRATION
P.Doc: Indication of bird concentrations at the aerodrome.

E.Name: CodeGradeSeparation
E.Doc: A list of coded values that indicate the placement of an element at a different height from another element.

P.Name: UNDERPASS
P.Doc: The current element is in a tunnel below another element.

P.Name: OVERPASS
P.Doc: The current element is on a bridge above another element.

E.Name: CodeTaxiwayElement
E.Doc: A code list of values indicating a component of the taxiway surface.

P.Name: NORMAL
P.Doc: The default/regular type.

P.Name: INTERSECTION
P.Doc: Intersection element - with a runway or with a taxiway.

P.Name: SHOULDER
P.Doc: Intersection element - with a runway or with another taxiway.

P.Name: HOLDING_BAY
P.Doc: A defined area, on the side of a taxiway, where aircraft can be held, or bypassed, to facilitate efficient surface movement of aircraft.

E.Name: CodeRadioSignal
E.Doc: A coded indicator for the type of information transmitted by a navaid or other radio emission source.

P.Name: AZIMUTH
P.Doc: The signal supports the provision/calculation of horizontal angle information.

P.Name: DISTANCE
P.Doc: The signal supports the provision/calculation of linear separation information.

P.Name: BEAM
P.Doc: The signal provides a directional guidance, in the horizontal or vertical planes.

P.Name: VOICE
P.Doc: The signal provides a carrier for voice information.

P.Name: DATALINK
P.Doc: The signal provides a carrier for data.

E.Name: CodeSignalPerformanceILS
E.Doc: A coded value indicating the signal performance level in space corresponding to the precision of an ILS or MLS system according to ICAO Annex 10, Volume I, Chapter 3.

P.Name: I
P.Doc: Facility Performance category I.

P.Name: II
P.Doc: Facility Performance category II.

P.Name: III
P.Doc: Facility Performance category III.

E.Name: CodeCourseQualityILS
E.Doc: A coded value indicating the signal quality of the ILS course structure based on the location the precision signal is usable to, according to ICAO Annex 10, Volume I, Chapter 3.

P.Name: A
P.Doc: Usable up to a point on the ILS glide path measured along the extended runway centre line in the approach direction to a distance of 7.5km (4NM) from the threshold.

P.Name: B
P.Doc: Usable up to a point on the ILS glide path measured along the extended runway centre line in the approach direction to a distance of 1050m (3500ft) from the threshold.

P.Name: C
P.Doc: Usable up to a point through which the downward extended straight portion of the nominal ILS glide path passes at a height of 30m (100ft) above the horizontal plane containing the threshold.

P.Name: D
P.Doc: Usable up to a point 4m (12ft) above the runway centre line and 600m (2000ft) from the stop end of the runway in the direction of the threshold.

P.Name: E
P.Doc: Usable up to a point at a specified height located above the intersection of the runway centre line and the threshold and through which the downward extended straight portion of the ILS glide path passes.

P.Name: T
P.Doc: Usable up to a point 4m (12ft) above the runway centre line and 900m (3000ft) from the threshold in the direction of the localizer.

E.Name: CodeIntegrityLevelILS
E.Doc: A coded value indicating the quality which relates to the trust which can be placed in the correctness of the information supplied by the ILS facility, according to ICAO Annex 10, Volume I, Attachment C.

P.Doc: Integrity Level 1.
Integrity Level 2.
Integrity Level 3.
Integrity Level 4.

E.Name: CodeHoldingCategory
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicates the type of precision approach for which that holding position is designed.

P.Name: NON_PRECISION
P.Doc: Non precision approaches.

P.Name: CAT_I
P.Doc: Precision approaches cat I.

P.Name: CAT_II_III
P.Doc: Precision approaches cat II/III.

E.Name: CodeNotePurpose
E.Doc: A code list of values that indicate the goal with which a free text Note is provided.

P.Name: DESCRIPTION
P.Doc: A summary of the feature or property characteristics in a human readable form.

P.Name: REMARK
P.Doc: Additional information about the feature or property, to be considered by a human operator.

P.Name: WARNING
P.Doc: A notice that announces a hazard in relation with the feature or property characteristics.

P.Name: DISCLAIMER
P.Doc: A denial or disavowal of legal claim with regard to the feature or property information.

E.Name: CodeNavigationEquipment
E.Doc: A coded list if values indicating the aircraft capability to use a certain ground based, satellite based or on-board system for aerial navigation.

P.Name: DME
P.Doc: DME Receiver.

P.Name: VOR_DME
P.Doc: VOR/DME Receiver.

P.Name: DME_DME
P.Doc: DME/DME Receiver.

P.Name: TACAN
P.Doc: TACAN Receiver.

P.Name: ILS
P.Doc: Instrument Landing System

P.Name: MLS
P.Doc: Microwave Landing System

P.Name: GNSS
P.Doc: Global Navigation Satellite System.

P.Name: WAAS
P.Doc: Wide Area Augmentation System.

P.Name: LORAN
P.Doc: LORAN Receiver.

P.Name: INS
P.Doc: Inertial Navigation System.

P.Name: FMS
P.Doc: Flight Management System.

E.Name: CodeNavigationSpecification
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicate a set of aircraft and flight crew requirements needed to support performance-based navigation operations within a defined airspace. There are two kinds of navigation specifications: RNP (includes the requirement for performance monitoring and alerting) and RNAV (does not include the requirement for performance monitoring and alerting).

P.Name: RNAV_10
P.Doc: RNAV 10 (RNP 10) capability - for oceanic and remote continental navigation applications.

P.Name: RNAV_5
P.Doc: RNAV 5 capability - for en-route and terminal navigation applications.

P.Name: RNAV_2
P.Doc: RNAV 2 capability - for en-route and terminal navigation applications.

P.Name: RNAV_1
P.Doc: RNAV 1 capability - for en-route and terminal navigation applications.

P.Name: RNP_4
P.Doc: RNP 4 capability - for oceanic and remote continental navigation applications.

P.Name: RNP_2
P.Doc: RNP 2 capability (specification to be developed by ICAO) - for various phases of flight.

P.Name: BASIC_RNP_1
P.Doc: Basic RNP 1 capability - for various phases of flight.

P.Name: ADVANCED_RNP_1
P.Doc: Advanced RNP 1 capability (specification to be developed by ICAO) - for various phases of flight.

P.Name: RNP_APCH
P.Doc: RNP approach capability.

P.Name: RNP_AR_APCH
P.Doc: RNP AR approach capability.

E.Name: CodeEquipmentAntiCollision
E.Doc: A coded list if values indicating the aircraft equipment with an anti-collision system.

P.Name: ACAS_I
P.Doc: Airborne Collision Avoidance System - version I, implemented as Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) I.

P.Name: ACAS_II
P.Doc: Airborne Collision Avoidance System - version II, implemented as Traffic Alert and Collision Avoidance System (TCAS) II version 7.

P.Name: GPWS
P.Doc: Ground proximity warning system.

E.Name: CodeLogicalOperator
E.Doc: A boolean operator.

P.Name: AND
P.Doc: The result is true only when all operands are true.

P.Name: OR
P.Doc: The result is true if any operand is true.

P.Name: NOT
P.Doc: The result is the opposite of the operands true/false state (it applies to a single operand).

P.Name: NONE
P.Doc: No operation (used for single conditions).

E.Name: CodeStatusAirport
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicates the availability of an airport/heliport facility for specific flight operations.

P.Name: NORMAL
P.Doc: The facility operates with nominal parameters.

P.Name: LIMITED
P.Doc: The facility operates below its nominal parameters, with additional usage restrictions.

P.Name: CLOSED
P.Doc: The facility is not operational.

E.Name: CodeOperationManoeuvringArea
E.Doc: A coded list of values that indicates a type of activity on an airport/heliport manoeuvring area element.

P.Name: LANDING
P.Doc: Aircraft landing.

P.Name: TAKEOFF
P.Doc: Aircraft take off.

P.Name: TOUCHGO
P.Doc: Aircraft landing followed by an immediate take-off, without deceleration.

P.Name: TRAIN_APPROACH
P.Doc: Aircraft practices low approaches.

P.Name: TAXIING
P.Doc: Aircraft taxiing along an element of the airport/heliport movement area.

P.Name: CROSSING
P.Doc: Crossing an element of the airport/heliport manoeuvring area, as opposed to taxiing along that element.

P.Name: AIRSHOW
P.Doc: Air show and aircraft display activities.

P.Name: ALL
P.Doc: All operation types.

E.Name: CodeRelativePosition
E.Doc: A coded list of values indicating a relative position, in relation with a reference point situated along a given trajectory.

P.Name: BEFORE
P.Doc: A location in advance of the reference point.

P.Name: AT
P.Doc: A location at the reference point.

P.Name: AFTER
P.Doc: A location following the reference point

F.Name: RunwayProtectArea
F.Doc: An area situated in the vicinity of a runway or provided to protect aircraft during manoeuvring, take-off and landing operations.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of protection area. For example, clearway, obstacle free zone, obstacle free surface, etc..

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: Temporal description of the operational state of the feature. This attribute is used to describe real-time status.)

P.Name: ProtectedRunwayDirection
P.Doc:
(DO272/ED99) Each RunwayDisplacedArea features attribute idthr shall provide the idthr object identifier value of the operationally corresponding RunwayThreshold (Rule 7).
()DO272/ED99)Each Stopway features attribute idthr shall provide the idthr object identifier value of the operationally corresponding RunwayThreshold (Rule 8).

F.Name: RunwayDirection
F.Doc: One of the two landing and take-off directions of a runway for which attributes like TORA, TODA, LDA, etc. may be defined.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The full textual designator of the landing and take-off direction. Examples: 27, 35L, 01R.

P.Name: TrueBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the runway direction and True North at a given position. Note : The True North is the north point at which the meridian lines meet.

P.Name: TrueBearingAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the measured angle between the runway direction and True North at a given position.

P.Name: MagneticBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the runway direction and Magnetic North at a given position.

P.Name: PatternVFR
P.Doc: A code indicating the direction of the VFR flight pattern at an aerodrome/heliport, i.e. left or right.

P.Name: SlopeTDZ
P.Doc: Touchdown zone longitudinal slope (slope of 1/3 of the runway length from threshold or first 3000 feet for runways longer than 9000 feet)

P.Name: ElevationTDZ
P.Doc: Elevation of touch down zone: The value of the highest elevation of the runway Touch Down Zone (TDZ).
