P.Name: ElevationTDZAccuracy
P.Doc: The accuracy of the reported Touch Down Zone elevation

P.Name: ApproachMarkingType
P.Doc: Type of marking related to landing categories such as precision, non-precision and basic.

P.Name: ApproachMarkingCondition
P.Doc: The quality of the runway marking such as good, fair, poor and other.

P.Name: ClassLightingJAR
P.Doc: Classification of the approach lighting system using as criteria JAR-OPS 1 - Subpart E, Appendix 1 to 1.430

P.Name: PrecisionApproachGuidance
P.Doc: Degree to which navigation aids provide accurate approach guidance. Precision approaches utilize both lateral (course) and vertical (glideslope) information

P.Name: UsedRunway
P.Doc: (DO272/ED99) Each FinalApproachAndTakeOff features attribute idthr shall provide the idrwy object identifier value of the corresponding HelipadThreshold (Rule 15).

P.Name: StartingElement
P.Doc: The runway element is the start of the runway direction. Typically used to indicate the location of a displaced area.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the RunwayDirection.

F.Name: RunwayCentrelinePoint
F.Doc: An operationally significant position on the centre line of a runway direction. A typical example is the runway threshold.

P.Name: Role
P.Doc: The role of the point along the runway direction centreline.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: A code or name by which the point is identified locally at the airport.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Identifies the geographical position of the runway centreline point.

P.Name: OnRunway
P.Doc: Identifies the runway direction on which the runway centreline point is located.

P.Name: AssociatedDeclaredDistance
P.Doc: Identifies the ruwnay declared distance for which the runway centreline point ensures.

P.Name: NavaidEquipment
P.Doc: Defines the relative position of the Navaid Equipment in relation to the Runway Centreline Point.

F.Name: Runway
F.Doc: A defined rectangular area on a land aerodrome/heliport prepared for the landing and take-off of aircraft. Note: this includes the concept of Final Approach and Take-Off Area (FATO) for helicopters.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The full textual designator of the runway, used to uniquely identify it at an aerodrome/heliport which has more than one. E.g. 09/27, 02R/20L, RWY 1.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type can be either runway for airplanes or final approach and take off area (FATO) for helicopters.

P.Name: NominalLength
P.Doc: The declared longitudinal extent of the runway for operational (performance) calculations.

P.Name: LengthAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the value of the physical length of the runway.

P.Name: NominalWidth
P.Doc: The declared transversal extent of the runway for operational (performance) calculations.

P.Name: WidthAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the value of the physical width of the runway.

P.Name: WidthShoulder
P.Doc: The value of the runway shoulder width.

P.Name: LengthStrip
P.Doc: The value of the physical length of the strip. The runway strip is a defined area including the runway and, if applicable, the stop-way. It is intended (a) to reduce the risk of damage to aircraft running off the runway and (b) to protect aircraft flying over the runway during take-off or landing operations.

P.Name: WidthStrip
P.Doc: The value of the physical width of the strip.

P.Name: LengthOffset
P.Doc:
A value specifying the longitudinal offset of the strip, when it is not symmetrically extended beyond the two runway ends.
Notes: The longitudinal offset defines the distance along the centreline from the middle of the runway centreline towards the middle of the strip centreline. An offset in the direction defined from the threshold with the lower runway direction designation number towards the opposite runway threshold is indicated by a positive value. An offset in the opposite sense is indicated by a negative value.
Example: a runway oriented 09/27 has a strip that is extending 120 m before the threshold of the runway direction 09 and only 100 m before the threshold of the runway direction 27. The value of the longitudinal offset will be -10 m.

P.Name: WidthOffset
P.Doc:
A value specifying the lateral offset of the strip, when it is not symmetrically extended beyond the two runway edges.
Note: The lateral offset defines the distance from the runway centreline to the strip centreline in direction perpendicular to the runway centreline. An offset to the right, based on the direction defined from the threshold with the lower runway direction designation number towards the opposite runway threshold, is indicated by a positive value. An offset to the left is indicated by a negative value.
Example: a runway oriented 09/27 has a strip that is extending 150 m to the right of the runway direction 09 and 300 m to the left of the same runway direction. The value of the lateral offset will be -75 m.

P.Name: Abandoned
P.Doc: Indicating that the surface is no longer in operational use, but it is still physically present and visible, although usually in a degraded state.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of the runway.

P.Name: AssociatedAirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport where the Runway is situated.

P.Name: OverallContaminant
P.Doc: Identifies the contaminant of the runway.

P.Name: AreaContaminant
P.Doc: Area contamination of a runway.

F.Name: ArrestingGear
F.Doc: A series of devices, namely engaging or catching devices and energy absorption devices used to stop an aircraft by absorbing its momentum in a routine, emergency landing or aborted take-off.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: The operational status of the arresting gear device.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: Overall length of the feature.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: Overall width of the feature.

P.Name: EngageDevice
P.Doc: The type of device (for example: a hook) that is used to engage an aircraft upon landing in order to immediately stop it.

P.Name: AbsorbType
P.Doc: The type of energy absorber (for example: a rotary brake) by which the arresting gear system rapidly dissipates the kinetic energy of a moving aircraft that engages the arresting system, bringing the aircraft to a stop.

P.Name: Bidirectional
P.Doc: A boolean describing whether the arresting gear is utilised from both runway directions or not.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: The distance of the arresting system from the closest threshold of the runway /landing area.

P.Name: RunwayDirection
P.Doc: Identifies the runway direction on which the arresting gear is used.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Describes the surface characteristics of the arresting gear.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the shape of the arresting gear.

F.Name: RunwayElement
F.Doc: Runway element may consist of one ore more polygons not defined as other portions of the runway class.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of element.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: The length of the runway element.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: The width of the runway element.

P.Name: GradeSeparation
P.Doc: A code that indicates the placement of the element at a different height from another element.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of the runway element.

P.Name: AssociatedRunway
P.Doc:
Indicates which runways the Runway Element belongs to. Note that Runway Intersection elements will belong to more than one Runway.
(DO272/ED99) Each RunwayElement features attribute idrwy shall provide the idrwy object identifier value corresponding to the name of the real world runway (Rule 1).
(DO272/ED99)Each RunwayIntersection features attribute idrwi shall provide an idrwi object identifier value that corresponds to the names of the real world intersection runways (idrwy) (Rule 2).
(DO272/ED99)Each RunwayShoulder features attribute idrwy shall provide the idrwy object identifier value of the real world runway (Rule 3).

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the Ruwnay Element.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the RunwayElement.

F.Name: VisualGlideSlopeIndicator
F.Doc: A visual guidance system that provides "below/above glidepath" information to an aircraft executing an approach to a specific runway direction.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of the visual approach slope indicator system. For example, VASIS, A-VASIS, PAPI, A-PAPI, etc..

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: A code describing a position, relative to the centreline, of the visual approach slope indicator for a FATO/RWY direction.

P.Name: NumberBox
P.Doc: The number of boxes that compose the visual approach slope indicator system.

P.Name: Portable
P.Doc: A code indicating whether the visual approach slope indicator system is a portable one.

P.Name: SlopeAngle
P.Doc: The appropriate approach slope angle to be used by an aircraft using the approach.

P.Name: MinimumEyeHeightOverThreshold
P.Doc: The Minimum Eye Height over Threshold (MEHT) value. Also known as the threshold crossing height for the Visual Glide Slope Indicator.

P.Name: RunwayDirection
P.Doc: Identifies the Runway Direction for which the Visual Glide Slope Indicator provides guidance for.

F.Name: RunwayVisualRange
F.Doc: A meteorological equipment providing information about the distance over which the pilot of an aircraft on the centre line of a runway can see the runway surface markings or the lights delineating the runway or identifying its centre line.

P.Name: ReadingPosition
P.Doc: The position along the runway direction for which the reading is provided.

P.Name: AssociatedRunwayDirection
P.Doc: The RunwayDirection provided the RunwayVisualRange.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Location of the Runway Visual Range.

F.Name: RunwayBlastPad
F.Doc: Specially prepared surface placed adjacent to the end of a runway to eliminate the erosive affect of the high wind forces produced by airplanes at the beginning of their takeoff rolls.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: Overall length of the feature

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: Temporal description of the operational state of the feature. This attribute is used to describe real-time status

P.Name: UsedRunwayDirection
P.Doc: Identifies the runway direction on which the blast pad is used.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the runway blast pad.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of the runway blast pad.

O.Name: ArrestingGearExtent
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between a point, a curve or a surface to define the geometry of an ArrestingGear

P.Name: CurveExtent
P.Doc: Identifies the curve of the arresting gear extent.

P.Name: SurfaceExtent
P.Doc: Identifies the polygon of the arresting gear extent.

P.Name: PointExtent
P.Doc: Identifies the point of the arresting gear extent.

O.Name: NavaidEquipmentDistance
O.Doc: Captures the distances between various Runway Centreline Points and Navaid Equipment.

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: The measured or calculated distance between a Runway Centreline Point and a Navaid Equipment.

P.Name: DistanceAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the measured or calculated distance between a Runway Centreline Point and a Navaid Equipment piece.

O.Name: RunwayDeclaredDistance
O.Doc: A conventional operational distance declared for a runway direction. For example, TORA, TODA, LDA, ASDA.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of a conventional declared distance. For example, TORA, TODA, LDA, RTODAH, etc..

P.Name: DeclaredValue
P.Doc: Schedule of validity for the Declared Distances.

O.Name: RunwayDeclaredDistanceValue
O.Doc: The value of a conventional operational distance declared for a runway direction.

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: The value of the declared distance.

P.Name: DistanceAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the value of the declared distance.

O.Name: ManoeuvringAreaAvailability
O.Doc: Information about the operational status of the manoeuvring area elements (runway, taxiway, TLOF, etc.)

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Indicates the availability of the facility for specific flight operations.

P.Name: Warning
P.Doc: A reason for caution when operating at the facility.

P.Name: Usage
P.Doc: Rule which regulates the usage of the ManoeuvringArea.

O.Name: ManoeuvringAreaUsage
O.Doc: A rule governing the usage of the manoeuvring area element.

P.Name: Operation
P.Doc: A type of activity for which a usage rule is specified.

F.Name: TaxiHoldingPosition
F.Doc: A designated position intended for traffic control at which taxiing aircraft and vehicles shall stop and hold until further cleared to proceed, when so instructed by the aerodrome control tower.

P.Name: LandingCategory
P.Doc: Type of landing operations for which that holding position is relevant. For example, precision cat I, precision cat II, precision cat III.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: A code indicating the operational status of the holding position. For example, serviceable, unserviceable, closed, work in progress, etc.

P.Name: AssociatedGuidanceLine
P.Doc: (DO272/ED99) The value of a TaxiwayHoldingPosition features attribute idlin shall be identical to the value of the corresponding TaxiwayElement features attribute idlin (Rule 12).

P.Name: ProtectedRunway
P.Doc:
(DO272/ED99) The value of a TaxiwayHoldingPosition features attribute idp shall be identical to the idrwy object identifier value of the protected real world runway (Rule 6).
(DO272/ED99) The value of a TaxiwayHoldingPosition features attribute idp shall be identical to the value of the operationally corresponding RunwayThresholds features attribute idthr (Rule 20).

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: The location of the TaxiHoldingPosition.

F.Name: Taxiway
F.Doc: A defined path at an aerodrome/heliport established for the taxiing of aircraft/helicopters and intended to provide a link between one part of the aerodrome and another, including aircraft/helicopter stand taxi-lines, apron taxiways, rapid exit taxiways, air taxiways etc..

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The textual designator of the taxiway.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating a type of taxiway. For example: air taxiway, ground exit/turnoff, rapid exit/turnoff, stub, turn around, etc.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: The value of the physical width of the taxiway.

P.Name: WidthShoulder
P.Doc: The value of the taxiway shoulder width.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: Value for the length of the taxiway

P.Name: Abandoned
P.Doc: Indicating that the surface is no longer in operational use, but it is still physically present and visible, although usually in a degraded state.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of the taxiway.

P.Name: AssociatedAirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport where the Taxiway is situated.

P.Name: Contaminant
P.Doc: Identifies the contaminant of the taxiway.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the Taxiway.

F.Name: TaxiwayElement
F.Doc: Part of a Taxiway

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of element.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: The length of the runway element.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: The width of the runway element.

P.Name: GradeSeparation
P.Doc: A code that indicates the placement of the element at a different height from another element.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of the taxiway element.

P.Name: AssociatedTaxiway
P.Doc: (DO272/ED99) Each TaxiwayElement features attribute idlin shall provide the idlin object identifier value corresponding to the name of the real world taxiway (Rule 9).

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the taxiway element.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the TaxiwayElement.

F.Name: GuidanceLine
F.Doc: A line used to guide aircraft on and between airport movement areas.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The free-text identifier of the Guidance Line.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of guidance line.

P.Name: MaxSpeed
P.Doc: Maximum speed on Taxiway

P.Name: UsageDirection
P.Doc: Indicates the direction in which the guidance line can be used with reference to the start and end points of the associated ElevatedCurve.

P.Name: ConnectedTouchDownLiftOff
P.Doc: Identifies the touch down lift off area that the guidance line connects to.

P.Name: ConnectedRunwayCentrelinePoint
P.Doc: (OD272/ED99) The value of a RunwayExitLine features attribute idthr shall be identical to the value of the operationally corresponding RunwayThresholds features attribute idthr (Rule 21).

P.Name: ConnectedApron
P.Doc: Identifies the apron that the guidance line connects to.

P.Name: ConnectedStand
P.Doc: (DO272/ED99) Each StandGuidanceLine features attribute idstd shall provide object identifier values for all corresponding ParkingStandLocations (Rule 22).

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the guidance line.

P.Name: ConnectedTaxiway
P.Doc: Identifies the taxiway that the guidance line connects to.

F.Name: Apron
F.Doc: A defined area, on a land aerodrome/heliport, intended to accommodate aircraft/helicopters for purposes of loading and unloading passengers, mail or cargo, and for fuelling, parking or maintenance.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The full textual name or designator used to identify an apron at an aerodrome/heliport which has more than one.

P.Name: Abandoned
P.Doc: Indicating that the surface is no longer in operational use, but it is still physically present and visible, although usually in a degraded state.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of which the Apron is described by.

P.Name: AssociatedAirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport where the Apron is situated.

P.Name: Contaminant
P.Doc: Identifies the contaminant of the apron.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the Apron.

F.Name: ApronElement
F.Doc: Parts of a defined apron area. ApronElements may have functional characteristics defined in the ApronElement type. ApronElements may have jetway, fuel, towing, docking and groundPower services.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of an apron based upon its location on an aerodrome and its general purpose.

P.Name: JetwayAvailability
P.Doc: Availability of jet-way

P.Name: TowingAvailability
P.Doc: Availability of towing service

P.Name: DockingAvailability
P.Doc: Availability of docking station system

P.Name: GroundPowerAvailability
P.Doc: Availability of ground power

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: The length of the runway element.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: The width of the runway element.

P.Name: AssociatedApron
P.Doc:
(DO272/ED99) The value of a ParkingStandArea features attribute idapron shall be identical to the value of the operationally corresponding ApronElement features attribute idapron (Rule 23).
(DO272/ED99) The value of a DeicingArea features attribute idbase shall be identical to the value of the underlying ApronElement features attribute idapron (Rule 26).

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of which the Apron Element is described by.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the apron element.

P.Name: SupplyService
P.Doc: The AirportSupplyService provided at the ApronElement.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the ApronElement.

F.Name: AircraftStand
F.Doc: A designated area on an apron intended to be used for parking an aircraft.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The textual designator of the gate/stand. For example, 13, 84 A, etc..

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code identifying the characteristics of a stand. Examples: parking position on the apron, isolated aircraft stand, terminal building gate.

P.Name: VisualDockingSystem
P.Doc: A device used at the aircraft stands in order to help the pilot align and position the aircraft.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the Surface Characteristics for which the Gate Stand is described by.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: The geographical reference position for the parking position.

P.Name: ApronLocation
P.Doc: (DO272/ED99) Each ParkingStandArea features attribute idstd shall provide an idstd object identifier value that holds the idstd object identifier values of all corresponding ParkingStandLocations (Rule 13)

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the surface area of the Gate Stand.

P.Name: Contaminant
P.Doc: Identifies the contaminant of the gate stand.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the AircraftStand.

F.Name: Road
F.Doc: An established surface route on the aerodrome meant for the exclusive use of authorized vehicles and personnel.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The designator or name of the service road.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: A code indicating the operational status of a service road. For example, serviceable, unserviceable, work in progress, etc.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Type of road

P.Name: Abandoned
P.Doc: Indicating that the surface is no longer in operational use, but it is still physically present and visible, although usually in a degraded state.

P.Name: AssociatedAirport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport where the Road is situated.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the Surface Characteristics of the Road.

P.Name: AccessibleStand
P.Doc: Identifies the Gate Stand(s) for which the Road gives access.

P.Name: SurfaceExtent
P.Doc: Identifies the surface area of the Road.

O.Name: ApronAreaAvailability
O.Doc: Information about the operational status of an element situated in the apron area.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Indicates the availability of the facility for specific flight operations.

P.Name: Warning
P.Doc: A reason for caution when operating at the facility.

P.Name: Usage
P.Doc: Rule which regulates the usage of the ApronArea.

O.Name: ApronAreaUsage
O.Doc: A rule governing the usage of an element situated in the apron area.

F.Name: DeicingArea
F.Doc: An area comprising an inner area for the parking of an aircraft to receive de-icing treatment and an outer area for the manoeuvring of two or more mobile de-icing equipment.

P.Name: AssociatedApron
P.Doc: Identifies the Apron on which the Deicing Area is located on.

P.Name: TaxiwayLocation
P.Doc: Identifies the taxiway where the deicing area is located.

P.Name: StandLocation
P.Doc: Identifies the Gate Stand at which the Deicing Area is located.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the surface characteristics of which the Deicing Area is described by.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the deicing area.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the DeicingArea.

F.Name: PassengerLoadingBridge
F.Doc: Bridge for loading/unloading access to airplanes for passengers and crew.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Type of bridge used passengers to board and deplane

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the surface area of the Passenger Loading Bridge.

P.Name: AssociatedStand
P.Doc: Identifies the gate stand associated with the passenger loading bridge.

P.Name: Annotation
P.Doc: A free text annotation concerning the feature/object or one of its properties

F.Name: TouchDownLiftOffSafeArea
F.Doc: An obstacle free zone area situated in the vicinity of a touch down and lift-off area, provided to protect helicopters during manoeuvring, take-off and/or landing operations.

P.Name: ProtectedTouchDownLiftOff
P.Doc: Identifies the Touch Down Lift Off area that is protected by the Safe Area.

F.Name: TouchDownLiftOff
F.Doc: A load bearing area on which a helicopter may touch down or lift-off.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The textual designator of the touch down and lift-off area.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: The value of the physical length of the touchdown and lift-off area.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: The value of the physical width of the touchdown and lift-off area.

P.Name: Slope
P.Doc: The slope (rate of upward inclination of the surface from the horizontal) of the surface of a feature.

P.Name: HelicopterClass
P.Doc: The class of a helicopter based on its performance during a critical power unit failure after take-off.

P.Name: Abandoned
P.Doc: Indicating that the surface is no longer in operational use, but it is still physically present and visible, although usually in a degraded state.

P.Name: AimingPoint
P.Doc: Locates the aiming point of the TLOF.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the surface area of the Touch Down Lift Off area.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the Surface Characteristics that describe the Touch Down Lift Off area.

P.Name: AssociatedAirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport where the Touch Down Lift Off is situated.

P.Name: ApproachTakeOffArea
P.Doc:
Only for runways of type FATO
(DO272/ED99) Each FinalApproachAndTakeOff features attribute idrwy shall provide the idrwy object identifier value of the corresponding TouchDownAndLiftOff (Rule 14).

P.Name: Contaminant
P.Doc: Identifies the contaminant of the touch down lift off area.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the TouchDownLiftOff area.

F.Name: GroundLightSystem
F.Doc: One or more light sources located on the ground and that provide visual assistance for air and ground navigation.

P.Name: EmergencyLighting
P.Doc: The availability of a back-up lighting system to be used in case of failure of the main lighting system.

P.Name: IntensityLevel
P.Doc: A code indicating the relative intensity of the lighting system.

P.Name: Colour
P.Doc: A code indicating the global colour of the lighting system.

P.Name: Element
P.Doc: Identifies the Light Elements that make up the Ground Light System

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the GroundLightSystem.

F.Name: ApronLightSystem
F.Doc: The lighting system provided for an apron.

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: A code indicating the part of the apron served by the lighting system.

P.Name: LightedApron
P.Doc: Identifies the Apron for which the Lighting System is provided.

F.Name: TaxiwayLightSystem
F.Doc: The lighting system provided for a taxiway at an aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: A code indicating the part of the TWY surface the lighting system is serving. For example, centre line, edge, etc..

P.Name: LightedTaxiway
P.Doc: Identifies the Taxiway for which the Lighting System is provided.

F.Name: RunwayDirectionLightSystem
F.Doc: The lighting system provided for a landing and take-off direction, including the stopway lights.

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: A code indicating the part of the runway the lighting system is serving.

P.Name: AssociatedRunwayDirection
P.Doc: Identifies the Runway Direction for which the Lighting System is provided.

F.Name: TouchDownLiftOffLightSystem
F.Doc: The lighting system provided for a TLOF surface at an aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: A code indicating the part of the TLOF surface the lighting system is serving. For example, TDZ, THR, centre line, edge, etc..

P.Name: LightedTouchDownLiftOff
P.Doc: Identifies the Touch Down Lift Off area for which the Lighting System is provided.

F.Name: GuidanceLineLightSystem
F.Doc: The lighting system for the centreline guidance line.

P.Name: LightedGuidanceLine
P.Doc: Identifies the Guidance Line for which the Lighting System is provided.

F.Name: RunwayProtectAreaLightSystem
F.Doc: The lighting for the runway project area.

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: Location of the lighting.

P.Name: LightedArea
P.Doc: Identifies the Runway Protect Area for which the Lighting System is provided.

F.Name: TaxiHoldingPositionLightSystem
F.Doc: Lighting system for a taxiway hold position.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The kind of lighting aid provided for the taxiway holding position.

P.Name: TaxiHolding
P.Doc: Identifies the Taxi Holding Position for which the Lighting System is provided.

O.Name: LightActivation
O.Doc: The result and the intensity of the lighting system when activated by the pilot.

P.Name: Clicks
P.Doc: The number of clicks on the microphone required for activation of the lights at a particular intensity step.

P.Name: IntensityLevel
P.Doc: The intensity step of the lighting system activated by the pilot, depending on the number of clicks.

P.Name: Activation
P.Doc: The status of the system (on or off) as result of the number of clicks.

O.Name: GroundLightingAvailability
O.Doc: Information about the operational status of a ground light.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: An indication of the operational status of the lighting system. The list of values include: "in construction", "operational", "unavailable".

F.Name: ApproachLightingSystem
F.Doc: An airport lighting facility which provides visual guidance to landing aircraft by radiating light beams in a directional pattern by which the pilot aligns the aircraft with the final approach path for landing.

P.Name: ClassICAO
P.Doc: Classification of the approach lighting system using as criteria the ICAO Annex 14 standards and recommended practices

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A regional or organisation specific classification of the approach lighting system equipment. Could also be a brand name

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: The overall length of the approach lighting system.

P.Name: SequencedFlashing
P.Doc: A code indicating whether sequenced flashing is available for the approach lighting system.

P.Name: AlignmentIndicator
P.Doc: A code indicating whether a runway alignment indicator is available for the approach lighting system.

P.Name: ServedRunwayDirection
P.Doc: Identifies the Runway Direction that the ALS serves.

F.Name: Marking
F.Doc: A group of symbols displayed on an aerodrome or heliport surface in order to convey aeronautical information.

P.Name: MarkingICAOStandard
P.Doc: Indicates if the marking is ICAO standard as described in Annex 14.

P.Name: Condition
P.Doc: The quality of the marking such as good, fair, poor and other.

P.Name: Element
P.Doc: Identifies the Marking Elements of which the Marking is made.

O.Name: MarkingElement
O.Doc: A symbol displayed on an aerodrome or heliport surface.

P.Name: Colour
P.Doc: The colour of the marking.

P.Name: Style
P.Doc: The style of the marking line, such as continuous, dotted, etc.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the the extent of the Marking Element.

F.Name: TaxiwayMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the surface of the taxiway.

P.Name: MarkingLocation
P.Doc: A code indicating the location of the marking relative to the surface.

P.Name: MarkedTaxiway
P.Doc:
(DO272/ED99) The value of a TaxiwayGuidanceLine features attribute idlin shall be identical to the value of the corresponding TaxiwayElement features attribute idlin (Rule 10).
(DO272/ED99) The value of a TaxiwayIntersectionMarking features attribute idlin shall be identical to the value of the corresponding TaxiwayElement features attribute idlin (Rule 11).

P.Name: MarkedElement
P.Doc: Identifies the taxiway element that is marked.

F.Name: ApronMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the surface of the apron.

P.Name: MarkingLocation
P.Doc: A code indicating the location of the marking relative to the surface.

P.Name: MarkedApron
P.Doc: Identifies the Apron on which the Apron Marking is marked.

F.Name: AirportProtectionAreaMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the edge of the landing protection area.

P.Name: MarkingLocation
P.Doc: The location of the marking.

P.Name: MarkedProtectionArea
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport Heliport Protection Area that is marked.

F.Name: TouchDownLiftOffMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the surface of the touch down and lift-off area.

P.Name: MarkingLocation
P.Doc: A code indicating the location of the marking relative to the surface.

P.Name: MarkedTouchDownLiftOff
P.Doc: Identifies the Touch Down Lift Off area that is marked.

F.Name: RunwayMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the surface of the runway.

P.Name: MarkingLocation
P.Doc: A code indicating the location of the marking relative to the surface.

P.Name: MarkedRunway
P.Doc:
The runway having the runway markings.
(DO272/ED99) Each RunwayMarking features attribute idrwy shall provide the idrwy object identifier value of the real world runway (Rule 4).

O.Name: MarkingExtent
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between a point, a curve or a surface to define the geometry of a Marking Element

P.Name: SurfaceExtent
P.Doc: Identifies the marked polygon.

P.Name: CurveExtent
P.Doc: Identifies the marked curve.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Identifies the marked point.

F.Name: GuidanceLineMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed as the guidance line.

P.Name: MarkedGuidanceLine
P.Doc: Identifies the Guidance Line on which the Guidance Marking Line is marked.

F.Name: DeicingAreaMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the surface of a Deicing Area

P.Name: MarkedDeicingArea
P.Doc: Identifies the Deicing Area that is marked.

F.Name: TaxiHoldingPositionMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the surface of a Taxiway indicating the location of the TaxiHoldingPosition.

P.Name: MarkedTaxiHold
P.Doc: Identifies the Taxi Holding Position that is marked.

F.Name: StandMarking
F.Doc: A symbol or group of symbols displayed on the surface of the Aircraft Stand.

P.Name: MarkedStand
P.Doc: Identifies the Gate Stand at which the Gate Stand Markings are marked.

O.Name: SurfaceContamination
O.Doc: Presence or removal of hazardous conditions on movement areas due to snow, ice, slush, water.

P.Name: ObservationTime
P.Doc: The date and time of the measurement completion (UTC).

P.Name: Depth
P.Doc: The depth of the contamination on the surface.

P.Name: FrictionCoefficient
P.Doc: The average friction coefficient.

P.Name: FrictionEstimation
P.Doc: A qualitative estimate of the friction.

P.Name: FrictionDevice
P.Doc: The type of equipment used to determine the reported friction coefficient.

P.Name: ObscuredLights
P.Doc: Indicates that the surface lights are obscured.

P.Name: FurtherClearanceTime
P.Doc: The date and time (UTC) when it is expected to complete further clearance.

P.Name: FurtherTotalClearance
P.Doc: Indicates that the further total clearance is expected.

P.Name: NextObservationTime
P.Doc: The date and time of the next intended measurement report (UTC).

P.Name: Proportion
P.Doc: The percentage of the contaminated area from the overall extent of the surface.

P.Name: CriticalRidge
P.Doc: Identifies the critical bank associated to the contaminant.

P.Name: Layer
P.Doc: A layer of contaminant.

O.Name: Ridge
O.Doc: Describes ridges of deposited material (such as a snow-bank) to the left or right of the runway (relative to the runway direction with the lowest designation number).

P.Name: Side
P.Doc: The side of the runway where the deposited material is located.

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: Distance from the edge of the movement area.

P.Name: Depth
P.Doc: Height of the ridges of deposited material.

O.Name: RunwayContamination
O.Doc: The presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush, water, etc. on the runway surface.

P.Name: ClearedLength
P.Doc: Length of runway cleared of contamination, if less than the total length.

P.Name: ClearedWidth
P.Doc: Width of runway cleared of contamination, if less than the total width.

P.Name: ClearedSide
P.Doc: Indicates that the cleared width is offset left or right of centre line.

P.Name: FurtherClearanceLength
P.Doc: Length of runway that is expected to be cleared of contamination, if less than the total length.

P.Name: FurtherClearanceWidth
P.Doc: Width of runway that is expected to be cleared of contamination, if less than the total width.

P.Name: ObscuredLightsSide
P.Doc: Indicates the side on which the lights are obscured.

P.Name: ClearedLengthBegin
P.Doc: The distance from the threshold with the lowest designator number to the point where the cleared portion starts, in case of partial clearance.

P.Name: TaxiwayAvailable
P.Doc: An indication whether there are cleared taxiways available serving that runway.

P.Name: ApronAvailable
P.Doc: An indication whether there are cleared aprons available serving that runway.

O.Name: TaxiwayContamination
O.Doc: The presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush, water, etc. on the taxiway surface.

P.Name: ClearedWidth
P.Doc: Width of taxiway cleared of contamination.

O.Name: SurfaceContaminationLayer
O.Doc: An operationally significant contaminant of homogeneous type such as snow, ice, slush, water, sand, etc., which is present on a large surface of the airport/heliport area.

P.Name: LayerOrder
P.Doc: The order of the layer, starting from the uppermost (value "1") towards the movement area surface, in case overlapping contaminants are present.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of contaminating substance on the movement area surface.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: The surface covered by the contamination. For runways this can be a runway third, such as in the current SNOWTAM reporting style..

O.Name: RunwaySectionContamination
O.Doc: The presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush, water, etc. on a section of the runway surface.

P.Name: Section
P.Doc: Indicates the part of the runway that is affected. This attribute supports the current SNOWTAM practice, which consists in reporting the contamination information on each third of the runway length, starting from the threshold of the runway direction having the lower designation number.

O.Name: TouchDownLiftOffContamination
O.Doc: The presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush, water, etc. on the TLOF surface.

O.Name: ApronContamination
O.Doc: The presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush, water, etc. on the Apron surface.

O.Name: AircraftStandContamination
O.Doc: The presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush, water, etc. at an AircraftStand.

O.Name: AirportHeliportContamination
O.Doc: The presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush, water, etc. on the airport surfaces.

F.Name: FloatingDockSite
F.Doc: Floating facility which can serve as a mooring place for vessels or as a floating dry dock

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the floating dock site.

F.Name: MarkingBuoy
F.Doc: Floating marker which is moored to the bottom at a specific known location, which is used as an aid to navigation or for other special purpose

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: Official number of the buoy

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of the buoy

P.Name: Colour
P.Doc: Colour of the buoy

P.Name: MarkedSeaplaneLandingArea
P.Doc: The seaplane landing area which is marked by the buoy

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Identifies the geographical location of the marking buoy.

F.Name: SeaplaneLandingArea
F.Doc: Area specifically designated for take-offs and landings of seaplanes

P.Name: RampSite
P.Doc: Identifies the ramp site associated to the seaplane landing area.

P.Name: DockSite
P.Doc: Identifies the dock site(s) associated with the seaplane landing area.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the seaplane landing area.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the SeaplaneLandingArea.

F.Name: SeaplaneRampSite
F.Doc: Ramps specifically designed to transit seaplanes from land to water and vice versa

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the ramp site.

P.Name: Centreline
P.Doc: Identifies the centreline of the ramp site.

F.Name: WorkArea
F.Doc: Part of a movement area under construction

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of work performed in the work area.

P.Name: PlannedOperational
P.Doc: Date when the activities in the construction area are expected to be operational.

P.Name: AssociatedAirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport where the Work Area is situated.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: The extent of the WorkArea.

P.Name: Activation
P.Doc: Time period during which the building site is active or not.

F.Name: SurveyControlPoint
F.Doc: A monumented survey control point

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The identifier of the control survey point.

P.Name: AssociatedAirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport at which the Survey Control Point is located.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Identifies the geospatial location of the Survey Control Point.

O.Name: SurfaceCharacteristics
O.Doc: An entity grouping together the attributes that model characteristics of an airport surface, such as strength, material, etc.

P.Name: Composition
P.Doc: The type of the predominant material of which a surface of the movement area is composed.

P.Name: Preparation
P.Doc: The preparation technique(s) applied to a surface composition.

P.Name: SurfaceCondition
P.Doc: The quality of the surface, as a category.

P.Name: ClassPCN
P.Doc: The bearing strength of a pavement for unrestricted operations.

P.Name: PavementTypePCN
P.Doc: The pavement behaviour (rigid or flexible) used for the Pavement Classification Number (PCN) determination, as a category.

P.Name: PavementSubgradePCN
P.Doc: A categorized indication of the pavement subgrade strength related to the Pavement Classification Number (PCN).

P.Name: MaxTyrePressurePCN
P.Doc: The maximum allowable tire pressure category related to the Pavement Classification Number (PCN), as a category.

P.Name: EvaluationMethodPCN
P.Doc: The method used to rate a runway pavement.

P.Name: ClassLCN
P.Doc: A value which denotes the peak bearing moment the surface can handle repeatedly without shortening its service life.

P.Name: WeightSIWL
P.Doc: The maximum calculated load on each tire of a landing gear assembly that a movement area surface can support.

P.Name: TyrePressureSIWL
P.Doc: The maximum aircraft tire pressure that a movement area surface can support.

P.Name: WeightAUW
P.Doc: The maximum total value of the weight of an aircraft that a movement area surface may support, regardless of the landing gear configuration of the aircraft.

F.Name: NonMovementArea
F.Doc: Area where aircraft cannot be seen by a control tower and therefore are restricted to move

P.Name: AssociatedAirportHeliport
P.Doc: Indicates the Airport where the Non-movement Area is situated.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the surface area of the Non-movement Area.

O.Name: City
O.Doc: A city or location that may be served by an airport/heliport.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The full free text name of the city or town the aerodrome/heliport is serving.

O.Name: UsageCondition
O.Doc: A rule governing the usage of an Airport/Heliport or of one of its surfaces.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating whether the limitation is a permission or an interdiction.

P.Name: PriorPermission
P.Doc:
For a Conditional Permission, this indicates that a prior permission is required. Positive values indicate prior permission required before using the airport movement area.
Note: this can only be specified for limitations of type "conditional permission".

P.Name: Contact
P.Doc: The contact information for a person or group.

P.Name: Selection
P.Doc: The selection of flights, environmental conditions and times for which the usage is specified.

F.Name: AirportHeliportProtectionArea
F.Doc: An area situated in the vicinity of a runway, FATO or TLOF, provided to protect aircraft during manoeuvring, take-off and/or landing operations.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: The value of the physical width of the protection area.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: The value of the physical length of the protection area.

P.Name: Lighting
P.Doc: The availability of a lighting system that visually identified the Protection Area in low visibility conditions.

P.Name: ObstacleFree
P.Doc: Indicates if the protection area is obstacle free.

P.Name: SurfaceProperties
P.Doc: Identifies the Surface Characteristics that describe the Airport Heliport Protection Area.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Identifies the surface area of the Airport Heliport Protection Area.

F.Name: AirportHeliportCollocation
F.Doc: Two aerodromes/heliports may be co-located sharing some or all of their ground facilities. E.g. a civil and a military aerodrome using the same runway.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the extent of the collocation situation of the two aerodrome/heliports.

P.Name: HostAirport
P.Doc: This is the main aerodrome.

P.Name: DependentAirport
P.Doc: This is the dependant airport which is using the facilities of the host airport.

F.Name: AirportHeliport
F.Doc: A defined area on land or water (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft/helicopters.

P.Name: Designator
Name
P.Doc: The primary official name of an aerodrome as designated by an appropriate authority.

P.Name: LocationIndicatorICAO
P.Doc: The four letter ICAO location indicator of the aerodrome/heliport, as listed in ICAO DOC 7910.

P.Name: DesignatorIATA
P.Doc: The identifier that is assigned to a location in accordance with rules (resolution 767) governed by the International Air Transport Association (IATA).

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code specifying the type of aerodrome. For example, aerodrome only, combined aerodrome/heliport or simple landing site.

P.Name: CertifiedICAO
P.Doc: Indicating that the airport is certified according to the ICAO rules.

P.Name: PrivateUse
P.Doc: An aerodrome or heliport not open for the public. Only for the use of the owners.

P.Name: ControlType
P.Doc: The primary organization type in terms of civil or military, which controls the airport.

P.Name: FieldElevation
P.Doc: The vertical distance above Mean Sea Level (MSL) of the highest point of the landing area.

P.Name: FieldElevationAccuracy
P.Doc: The vertical distance from the stated elevation within which there is a defined confidence of the true position falling.

P.Name: VerticalDatum
P.Doc: A reference surface with respect to which elevations and/or depths are specified.

P.Name: MagneticVariation
P.Doc: The angular difference between True North and Magnetic North measured at a given position and date.

P.Name: MagneticVariationAccuracy
P.Doc: The accuracy of the Magnetic Variation in angle degrees.

P.Name: DateMagneticVariation
P.Doc: The date on which the magnetic variation had this value.

P.Name: MagneticVariationChange
P.Doc: The annual rate of change of the magnetic variation.

P.Name: ReferenceTemperature
P.Doc: The monthly mean of the daily maximum temperatures for the hottest month of the year at an aerodrome.

P.Name: AltimeterCheckLocation
P.Doc: The availability of a point or area designated at an aerodrome where the checking of an altimeter system can be accomplished.

P.Name: SecondaryPowerSupply
P.Doc: The availability of emergency power supply for the airport/heliport.

P.Name: WindDirectionIndicator
P.Doc: The availability of a device that indicates the direction and the intensity of the wind.

P.Name: LandingDirectionIndicator
P.Doc: The availability of a device that indicates visually the direction currently designated for landing and for take-off.

P.Name: TransitionAltitude
P.Doc: The altitude at or below which the vertical position of an aircraft is controlled by reference to altitudes.

P.Name: TransitionLevel
P.Doc: The lowest flight level available for use above the transition altitude.

P.Name: LowestTemperature
P.Doc: The mean lowest temperature of the coldest month of the year.

P.Name: Abandoned
P.Doc: Indicating that the airport is no longer in operational use, but it's infrastructure is still present and visible from the air.

P.Name: CertificationDate
P.Doc: The date when the airport certification has been issued by the supervising authority.

P.Name: CertificationExpirationDate
P.Doc: The date when the airport certification will become invalid.

P.Name: Contaminant
P.Doc: Overall contamination of an airport.

P.Name: ServedCity
P.Doc: Identifies the Cities that the Airport serves.

P.Name: ResponsibleOrganisation
P.Doc: Identifes the Organisation Authority who manages the Airport.

P.Name: ARP
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport Reference Point.

P.Name: AviationBoundary
P.Doc: Defines the Airport boundaries.

P.Name: AltimeterSource
P.Doc: Indicates the Altimeter Source(s) located at a particular AirportHeliport.

P.Name: Contact
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport Contact.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: Information about the operational status of the airport/heliport.

F.Name: AltimeterSource
F.Doc: An instrument that measures and indicates the elevation at which an object, such as an airplane, is located

P.Name: IsRemote
P.Doc: Indications if the Altimeter is Remote or Local.

P.Name: IsPrimary
P.Doc: Indicates if the Altimeter is Primary or Secondary.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: Information about the operational status of the AltimeterSource.

O.Name: AirportHeliportResponsibilityOrganisation
O.Doc: Characterises the role of the organisation or authority which is responsible for the AirportHeliport

P.Name: Role
P.Doc: An indication of the responsibility that the Organization or Authority has over the facility.

F.Name: AirportHotSpot
F.Doc: A location on aerodrome movement area with a history or potential risk of collision or runway incursion, and where heightened attention by pilots/drivers is necessary.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: A coded identifier by which the hot spot is labelled on airport maps.

P.Name: Instruction
P.Doc: Action to be taken by the crew and/or vehicle drivers when approaching the hot spot.

P.Name: Area
P.Doc: The area on the airport/heliport that has been identified as a hot spot

P.Name: AffectedAirport
P.Doc: The AirportHeliport where the hot spot has been identified.

O.Name: AltimeterSourceStatus
O.Doc: Information about the operational status of an Altimeter Source.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Operational status.

O.Name: WorkareaActivity
O.Doc: Work area activity information.

P.Name: IsActive
P.Doc: Work area is active or not.

O.Name: ConditionCombination
O.Doc: A set of filter criteria used to determine the subset of flights, environmental conditions and times for which the usage is specified.

P.Name: LogicalOperator
P.Doc: The type of operation combining an elementary condition or a previously defined combination with other elementary conditions or previously defined combinations.

P.Name: Weather
P.Doc: Weather conditions for which the usage is specified.

P.Name: Aircraft
P.Doc: A type of aircraft for which the usage is specified.

P.Name: Flight
P.Doc: A type of flight for which the usage is specified.

P.Name: SubCondition
P.Doc: A preceding combination of conditions.

O.Name: AirportHeliportAvailability
O.Doc: Information about the operational status of the airport/heliport.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Indicates the availability of the facility for specific flight operations.

P.Name: Warning
P.Doc: A reason for caution when operating at the facility.

P.Name: Usage
P.Doc: Rule which regulates the usage of the AirportHeliport.

O.Name: AirportHeliportUsage
O.Doc: A rule governing the usage of an AirportHeliport.

P.Name: Operation
P.Doc: A type of activity for which a usage rule is specified.

F.Name: AuthorityForAirspace
F.Doc: The responsibility that one organisation has for an airspace. Description: For example, this entity will indicate which State is de jure and which State is de facto responsible for the airspace.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A categorisation of the role that one organisation has for an airspace Description: For example, the airspace is under the jurisdiction of Organisation/Authority, the airspace is delegated to the Organisation/Authority for the provision of air traffic services.

P.Name: ResponsibleOrganisation
P.Doc: The organisation responsible for the airspace.

P.Name: AssignedAirspace
P.Doc: The airspace that the OrganizationAuthority has assigned authority over.

F.Name: Airspace
F.Doc: A defined three dimensional region of space relevant to air traffic.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the general structure or characteristics of a particular airspace.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: A published sequence of characters allowing the identification of the airspace. Description: Typical examples are the ID of the Danger, Prohibited, Temporary segregated Areas, etc.

P.Name: LocalType
P.Doc: A type designator used locally (inside a State or a Region) for a particular airspace sub-category.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The name given to an airspace by a responsible authority. Description: It should be written as published, with no significance to upper or lower case letters.

P.Name: DesignatorICAO
P.Doc: A code indicating the Airspace designator is recorded in ICAO Doc. 7910.

P.Name: ControlType
P.Doc: The primary organization type in terms of civil or military, providing air traffic services within a designated airspace.

P.Name: UpperLowerSeparation
P.Doc: A flight level that indicates the division of airspace defined as lower and upper.

P.Name: Class
P.Doc: A block of airspace with a specific class.

P.Name: ProtectedRoute
P.Doc: The route protected by the airspace.

P.Name: GeometryComponent
P.Doc: An portion of airspace that contributes to the defintion of an Airspace geometry.

P.Name: Activation
P.Doc: The operational status of the Airspace.

O.Name: AirspaceGeometryComponent
O.Doc: The role of the component in the airspace geometry. If the geometry of an airspace is composed of single volume, then the attributes of this association class may be left empty.

P.Name: Operation
P.Doc: A code indicating how the component participates in the aggregation, such as addition, subtraction or intersection.

P.Name: OperationSequence
P.Doc: A number indicating the order of the component in the aggregation.

O.Name: AirspaceVolume
O.Doc: A defined volume in the air, described as horizontal projection with vertical limits.

P.Name: UpperLimit
P.Doc: The vertical position of the airspace ceiling.

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the upper limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: MaximumLimit
P.Doc: When specified, the maximum limit overrides the upper limit, in those parts of the airspace where the upper limit is situated below the maximum limit.

P.Name: MaximumLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the maximum limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: LowerLimit
P.Doc: The vertical position of the airspace floor.

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the lower limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: MinimumLimit
P.Doc: When specified, the minimum limit overrides the lower limit, in those parts of the airspace where the lower limit is situated below the minimum limit. For example, an airspace that has "Upper FL 245, Lower 11 500 FT MSL but at least 2 000 FT GND'.

P.Name: MinimumLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the minimum limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc.

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: The width of the corridor, in case the AirspaceVolume has been originally defined as having a corridor shape.

P.Name: HorizontalProjection
P.Doc: The surface defining the horizontal shape of the AirspaceVolume.

P.Name: Centreline
P.Doc: The centerline of an AirspaceVolume, in case the AirspaceVolume has been originally defined as having a corridor shape.

P.Name: ContributorAirspace
P.Doc: A (parent) Airspace, whose geometry has an impact on the geometry of the AirspaceVolume.

O.Name: AirspaceActivation
O.Doc: Information about the operational status of the airspace.

P.Name: Activity
P.Doc: The primary situation or reason on the ground or in the air, which may have an impact on air traffic.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: The activation status of the airspace block.

P.Name: Levels
P.Doc: The level and time associated with the airspace usage part.

P.Name: User
P.Doc: The Organisation that uses the Airspace layer.

P.Name: Aircraft
P.Doc: Indicates the type of Aircraft that are using the Airspace during its activation.

O.Name: AirspaceLayerClass
O.Doc: The airspace class for an airspace level block.

P.Name: Classification
P.Doc: A categorisation of airspace which determines the operating rules, flight requirements, and services provided. According to Annex 11, Appendix 4.

P.Name: AssociatedLevels
P.Doc: The levels and times associated with the airspace class.

F.Name: GeoBorder
F.Doc: A physical or political border. In general, it will be the border between two countries or States but could also be a coastline, the description of the bank of an important river, or any other geographical shape which can be named and used to describe the border of an airspace. If two countries/States have more than one common border, each one will be an occurrence of this entity.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The name of the common border. If the two countries (States) have more than one common border, each one will have a different name. For example, France-Germany, France-Switzerland, Croatia-Serbia-north, Croatia-Serbia-south, etc..

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of geographical border. The most common situation is the political boundary between two countries.

P.Name: Border
P.Doc: The shape (polyline) of the GeoBorder.

O.Name: AirspaceVolumeDependency
O.Doc: An association class that defines the dependency between the geometry of an AirspaceVolume and the geometry of another (parent) Airspace.

P.Name: Dependency
P.Doc: A code indicating how the geometry of the AirspaceVolume depends on the geometry of the contributor Airspace.

O.Name: Curve
O.Doc: An AIXM curve derived from GM_Curve and extended to include Horizontal Accuracy Properties

P.Name: HorizontalAccuracy
P.Doc: The difference between the recorded horizontal coordinates of a feature and its true position referenced to the same geodetic datum expressed as a circular error at 95 percent probability.

O.Name: ElevatedCurve
O.Doc: An AIXM elevated curve derived from, which extends curve with properties that represent the vertical position (elevation, datum, accuracy).

P.Name: Elevation
P.Doc: The vertical distance at the curve level, measured from Mean Sea Level (MSL).

P.Name: GeoidUndulation
P.Doc: The distance of the geoid above (positive) or below (negative) the mathematical reference ellipsoid at the location of the curve.

P.Name: VerticalDatum
P.Doc: The set of reference points or a mathematical model of the Earth's surface (a datum) against which vertical position measurements are made as basis for measuring elevations.

P.Name: VerticalAccuracy
P.Doc: The difference between the recorded elevation of a feature and its true elevation referenced to the same vertical datum expressed as a linear error at 95 percent probability.

O.Name: ElevatedPoint
O.Doc: An AIXM Point derived from GM_Point that includes properties for describing a point with elevation and vertical extent. Used in obstacles, navaids, etc.

P.Name: Elevation
P.Doc: The vertical distance of the point measured from Mean Sea Level (MSL).

P.Name: GeoidUndulation
P.Doc: The distance of the geoid above (positive) or below (negative) the mathematical reference ellipsoid at the location of the point.

P.Name: VerticalDatum
P.Doc: The set of reference points or a mathematical model of the Earth's surface (a datum) against which vertical position measurements are made as basis for measuring elevations.

P.Name: VerticalAccuracy
P.Doc: The difference between the recorded elevation of a feature and its true elevation referenced to the same vertical datum expressed as a linear error at 95 percent probability.

O.Name: ElevatedSurface
O.Doc: An AIXM elevated surface derived from, which extends Surface with properties that represent the vertical position (elevation, datum, accuracy).

P.Name: Elevation
P.Doc: The vertical distance of the surface level measured from Mean Sea Level (MSL).

P.Name: GeoidUndulation
P.Doc: The distance of the geoid above (positive) or below (negative) the mathematical reference ellipsoid at the location of the surface.

P.Name: VerticalDatum
P.Doc: The set of reference points or a mathematical model of the Earth's surface (a datum) against which vertical position measurements are made as basis for measuring elevations.

P.Name: VerticalAccuracy
P.Doc: The difference between the recorded elevation of a feature and its true elevation referenced to the same vertical datum expressed as a linear error at 95 percent probability.

O.Name: AixmPoint
O.Doc: AIXM Point containing horizontal accuracy data. In AIXM horizontal accuracy is considered a property of the geometry.

P.Name: HorizontalAccuracy
P.Doc: The difference between the recorded horizontal coordinates of a feature and its true position referenced to the same geodetic datum expressed as a circular error at 95 percent probability.

O.Name: Surface
O.Doc: An AIXM surface derived from GM_Surface and extended to include Horizontal Accuracy Properties

P.Name: HorizontalAccuracy
P.Doc: The difference between the recorded horizontal coordinates of a feature and its true position referenced to the same geodetic datum expressed as a circular error at 95 percent probability.

F.Name: PrecisionApproachRadar
F.Doc: Primary radar equipment used to determine the position of an aircraft during final approach, in terms of lateral and vertical deviations relative to a nominal approach path, and in range relative to touchdown.

P.Name: PrecisionApproachRadarType
P.Doc: Denotes the type of Precision Approach Radar.

P.Name: Slope
P.Doc: The glideslope angle at which the PAR provides landing assistance.

P.Name: SlopeAccuracy
P.Doc: The accuracy of the glideslope angle at which the PAR provides landing assistance.

P.Name: Reflector
P.Doc: Identifies the Reflectors utilized with a PAR.

F.Name: PrimarySurveillanceRadar
F.Doc: Primary Surveillance Radar is a radar system which detects the position of all the objects within its coverage that can reflect its transmitted radio signals.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Defines the type of Primary Surveillance Radar (i.e. ASR or ARSR).

O.Name: RadarComponent
O.Doc: Indicates radar use of a RadarEquipment as a component of the radar service provided by a RadarSystem.

P.Name: CollocationGroup
P.Doc: Set of radar equipments that are collocated. All Radar equipment that has the same value for this property are collocated together.

F.Name: RadarEquipment
F.Doc: Physical radar equipment like PAR, ARSR, ASR, SECRA, etc..

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: Textual name of the equipment.

P.Name: SerialNumber
P.Doc: Serial number of the equipment.

P.Name: Range
P.Doc: The applicable range of the equipment to detect aircraft.

P.Name: RangeAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the applicable range of the equipment to detect aircraft.

P.Name: DualChannel
P.Doc: Indicates whether the component has dual frequency.

P.Name: MovingTargetIndicator
P.Doc: Indicates whether a Moving Target Indicator (MTI) is available for the component. The MTI function eliminates ground clutter.

P.Name: StandbyPower
P.Doc: Indicates how the component is powered if the primary power fails.

P.Name: Digital
P.Doc: Indicates if the radar equipment is digital or analogue.

P.Name: MilitaryUseOnly
P.Doc: Indicates the equipment is for military use only.

P.Name: SpecialUseOnly
P.Doc: Indicates the equipment is for special use procedures only such as Helipads, etc.

P.Name: SpecialAircraftOnly
P.Doc: Indicates the equipment is to be only used for certain type of aircraft that are capable of using it. In some instances, the slope angle or procedure can only be flown by high performance aircraft.

P.Name: MagneticVariation
P.Doc: The angular difference between True North and Magnetic North measured at a given position and date.

P.Name: MagneticVariationAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the magnetic variation.

P.Name: DateMagneticVariation
P.Doc: The date on which the magnetic variation had this value.

P.Name: Contact
P.Doc: Identifies the contact information of the group or individual associated with the Radar Equipment. This will be a contact who is outside of the associated Organisation Authority for the Radar System. It could be the maintenance technician for the radar system.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: The geographical point at which the radar is located.

F.Name: RadarSystem
F.Doc: One or more Radar Equipment providing radar services.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Defines the type of service for the Radar System.

P.Name: Model
P.Doc: Model of the equipment ( ASR-11, etc)

P.Name: GeneralTerrainMonitor
P.Doc: General Terrain Monitors (GTM) monitor aircraft clearance above the highest terrain and obstacles in a general area

P.Name: BroadcastIdentifier
P.Doc: The Identifier broadcasted for a Secondary Radar.

P.Name: RadarEquipment
P.Doc: Identifies the component(s) associated to a Radar System

P.Name: Office
P.Doc: Defines the Offices that manage the Radar Equipment.

P.Name: AirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport Heliport at whicht the system is located or is near.

P.Name: PARRunway
P.Doc: Indicates what runway(s) the radar services.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: This is the location used when the radar system acts as a significant point. This location is usually the location of one of the radar equipments.

O.Name: Reflector
O.Doc: Describes the various reflectors used with Precision Approach Radars.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Indicates if the reflector is for Touchdown or a Runway End.

P.Name: TouchdownReflector
P.Doc: The geographical point at which the Touchdown Reflector is located.

F.Name: SecondarySurveillanceRadar
F.Doc: Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR aka Secondary Radar (SECRA)) is a radar system in which the object to be detected is fitted with the cooperative equipment in the form of a radio receiver/transmitter (transponder). Radar pulses transmitted from the searching transmitter/receiver (interrogator) site are received in the cooperative equipment and used to trigger a distinctive transmission from the transponder. This reply transmission, rather than a reflected signal, is then received back at the transmitter/receiver site for processing and display at an air traffic control facility.

P.Name: Transponder
P.Doc: Mode S, or mode select, despite also being called a transponder radar system replacement for Air Traffic Control Radar Beacon System (ATCRBS), is actually a data packet protocol which can be used to augment ATCRBS transponder positioning equipment (radar and TCAS). Mode S is designed to fully interface with ATCRBS systems: mode S SSRs can interrogate ATCRBS transponders, and AIS-P transponders will also reply to older ATCRBS and TCAS interrogations.

P.Name: Autonomous
P.Doc: Indicates the SRR is autonomous or independent.

P.Name: Monopulse
P.Doc: Monopulse radar is an adaptation of conical scanning radar which sends additional information in the radar signal in order to avoid problems caused by rapid changes in signal strength. The system also makes jamming more difficult. Most radars designed since the 1960s are monopulse systems.

F.Name: SurveillanceRadar
F.Doc: An abstract class gathering the properties that are common to both Primary and Secondary Surveillance Radar.

P.Name: VerticalCoverageAltitude
P.Doc: Altitude for which the Radar provides vertical coverage.

P.Name: VerticalCoverageDistance
P.Doc: Distance for which the Radar provides vertical coverage.

P.Name: VerticalCoverageAzimuth
P.Doc: Azimuth for which the Radar provides vertical coverage.

P.Name: AntennaTiltFixed
P.Doc: Indicates whether the antenna tilt is Variable or Fixed.

P.Name: TiltAngle
P.Doc: Angle at which the antenna is tilted.

P.Name: AutomatedRadarTerminalSystem
P.Doc:
The Automated Radar Terminal System (ARTS) is a system in the air traffic control system using radar intelligence to detect and display pertinent data such as flight identification, altitude, and position of aircraft operating in the terminal area.
A Radar with this attribute automatically tracks controlled aircraft and presents alpha-numeric information adjacent to their targets. It may even automatically calculate the separation between different aircrafts and provide an alert if that separation is compromised as per the set standards.

P.Name: GroundStation
P.Doc: Identifies the Ground Station locations where the Radar Scope is utilized.

O.Name: SurveillanceGroundStation
O.Doc: Characterizes the ground station where the Radar Scope is utilized.

P.Name: VideoMap
P.Doc: Indicates whether a Video Map is available for the component.

O.Name: ObstacleAssessmentArea
O.Doc: The geometry of surfaces used to define the altitude the length of a segment, holding pattern, etc., in function of the obstructions located in the area.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Indicated the type of area being assessed such as 40:1, 72:1, MA, Final, etc

P.Name: SectionNumber
P.Doc: a sequence number indicating a part of an assessment area.

P.Name: Slope
P.Doc: The slope value of the extent

P.Name: AssessedAltitude
P.Doc: Highest of the minimum altitudes in controlling obstacles plus the altitude adjustments (operational factors)

P.Name: SlopeLowerAltitude
P.Doc: The altitude at the bottom of the assessment area

P.Name: GradientLowHigh
P.Doc: Low to high gradient within the airspace

P.Name: SurfaceZone
P.Doc: Specifies zones within obstruction identification surfaces (OIS)

P.Name: SafetyRegulation
P.Doc: Identifier for the safety regulations in effect within the zone

P.Name: AircraftCategory
P.Doc: Identifies the aircraft category for which the Obstacle Assessment Area is evaluated for.

P.Name: SignificantObstacle
P.Doc: The obstacle that controls the altitude definition of the assessment area would penetrate the 40:1 OCS

P.Name: Surface
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the Obstacle Assessment Area.

P.Name: StartingCurve
P.Doc: The curve that starts the ObstacleAssessmentArea.

O.Name: Obstruction
O.Doc:
[FAA 8260.3] The highest airspace, obstacle or terrain relative to a prescribed plane within a specified area.
NOTE: In precision approach procedures where obstacles penetrate the approach surface, the controlling obstacle is the one which results in the requirement for the highest decision height (DH).

P.Name: RequiredClearance
P.Doc: Required altitude adjustment above any obstacle or terrain within a defined safety buffer region. The safety buffer allows for errors in the air and in the accuracy of data such as obstacle accuracy. This together with other adjustments (human factor adjustments, lighting adjustments, altimeter adjustments, etc). give the minimum altitude.

P.Name: MinimumAltitude
P.Doc: The value of the minimum obstacle clearance altitude.

P.Name: SurfacePenetration
P.Doc: A code indicating whether the controlling obstacle penetrates the assessment surfaces. Rule: if surfacePenetration is "NO", then slopePenetration will not have a value.

P.Name: SlopePenetration
P.Doc: A value calculated by dividing 102.0 (a constant) with the angle of the glidepath

P.Name: Controlling
P.Doc: Indication whether it is a "controlling obstruction" for the associated ObstacleAssessmentArea.

P.Name: CloseIn
P.Doc: "Close-In Obstacles" are those that would penetrate the 40:1 OCS and would require a climb gradient to 200 feet or less above the departure end of runway. So if an aircraft climbs at the minimum standard 200 feet per NM, "Close-In Obstacles" are those within 1 NM from the end of the runway.

P.Name: VerticalStructureObstruction
P.Doc: Vertical assessment controlling obstacle.

P.Name: Adjustment
P.Doc: Operational factors applied to obstacle clearance altitudes to produce the safest usable altitude.

P.Name: ObstaclePlacement
P.Doc: location of obstacle in relation to a given point.

O.Name: AltitudeAdjustment
O.Doc: Operational factors applied to obstacle clearance altitudes to produce the safest usable altitude.

P.Name: AltitudeAdjustmentType
P.Doc: Ability to adjust the segment altitude

P.Name: PrimaryAlternateMinimum
P.Doc: Adjustments applicable to either local altimeter or secondary altimeter. Applicable to the final minimums based on altimeter settings. Set to Y if primary altimeter. Not applicable for TAA or MSA.

P.Name: AltitudeAdjustmentP
P.Doc: The adjustment value

F.Name: HoldingAssessment
F.Doc: The geometry of surfaces that define altitude levels and the structure of an area used to evaluate obstacles for determining holding patterns.

P.Name: UpperLimit
P.Doc: Max altitude allowed for all aircraft categories at all defined speeds

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance.

P.Name: LowerLimit
P.Doc: Minimum altitude allowed for all aircraft categories at all defined speeds

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance.

P.Name: SpeedLimit
P.Doc: Restricted speed for containment in a smaller pattern

P.Name: PatternTemplate
P.Doc: Number of the holding template

P.Name: TurbulentAir
P.Doc: Evaluation is for turbulentAir

P.Name: LegLengthToward
P.Doc: Leg length for when holding is toward the navaid

P.Name: LegLengthAway
P.Doc: Leg length for when holding is away the navaid

P.Name: HoldingPoint
P.Doc: Identifies the point for which safe holding id designed for.

P.Name: UnplannedHolding
P.Doc: Identifies the Unplanned Holding determined by the Holding Assessment.

P.Name: AssessedHoldingPattern
P.Doc: The HoldingPattern assessed by the HoldingAssessment.

P.Name: ObstacleAssessment
P.Doc: ObstacleAssessmentArea used in a HoldingAssessment.

O.Name: ObstaclePlacement
O.Doc: Provides the location relative to

P.Name: ObstacleBearing
P.Doc: Used only for MSA/ESA. The bearing from a given point to the obstruction.

P.Name: ObstacleDistance
P.Doc: The distance from a given point to the obstruction.

P.Name: PointType
P.Doc: The type of point referenced when determining the bearing and distance to the obstruction. Example MSA/ESA centre point, DER

P.Name: ObstaclePlacementP
P.Doc: Indicates the obstacle position relative to the centreline

F.Name: StandardLevelTable
F.Doc: A table of consecutive cruising levels described under vertical separation criteria limited by an upper and lower level and used by General Air Traffic.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: A code identifying the table of discrete cruising levels. For example, ICAO IFR, ICAO VFR, ICAO IFR RVSM, etc.

P.Name: StandardICAO
P.Doc: An indication whether the table is according to the ICAO SARPS.

F.Name: StandardLevelSector
F.Doc: The general rule by which standard level columns are used in a national airspace or within a region. For example, in France, IFR odd RVSM levels are used between 0 and 179 degrees.

P.Name: FlightRule
P.Doc: A code indicating the flight rules observed by the aircraft. For example IFR or VFR.

P.Name: FromTrack
P.Doc: The start angle of the sector relative to the North.

P.Name: ToTrack
P.Doc: The end angle of the sector relative to the North.

P.Name: AngleType
P.Doc: A code indicating the direction of the zero bearing. For example, magnetic north or true north.

P.Name: ApplicableAirspace
P.Doc: The Airspace for which the StandardLevelSector applies.

P.Name: ApplicableLevelColumn
P.Doc: The StandardLevelColumn for which the StandardLevelSector applies.

F.Name: StandardLevelColumn
F.Doc: A column of consecutive cruising levels within a standard level table.

P.Name: Series
P.Doc: A code identifying the column. For example, ODD or EVEN.

P.Name: UnitOfMeasurement
P.Doc: The unit of measurement used by the column.

P.Name: Separation
P.Doc: A code indicating that reduced vertical separation minima is applied in the column.

P.Name: Level
P.Doc: A StandardLevel in the StandardLevelColumn

P.Name: LevelTable
P.Doc: The StandardLevelTable that the StandardLevelColumn belongs to.

O.Name: StandardLevel
O.Doc: A specified cruising level, part of a column within a table of discrete cruising levels used by General Air Traffic.

P.Name: VerticalDistance
P.Doc: The value of the cruising level.

F.Name: RadioFrequencyArea
F.Doc: A limitation, such as coverage, usability, etc., of a navaid equipment or service frequency

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of radio navigation aid limitation.

P.Name: AngleScallop
P.Doc: The value of the scalloping angle, which may affect the radial reading of a VOR or TACAN in plus or minus.

P.Name: SignalType
P.Doc: The type of signal that is affected by the usage limitation.

P.Name: Equipment
P.Doc: Identifies a choice of a radio communication channel, a navigational aid or a special navigation station.

P.Name: Sector
P.Doc: Identifies the Circle Sector defined by a Radio Frequency Area.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: Designated part of a surface movement area where a specific frequency is required by air traffic control or ground control

O.Name: EquipmentChoice
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between a radio communication channel, a navigational aid, a radar system or a special navigation station which is impacted by the RadioFrequencyArea limitation

P.Name: NavaidEquipment
P.Doc: The component of a system used for air navigation.

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: A frequency in the range within which radio waves may be transmitted.

P.Name: SpecialNavigationStation
P.Doc: A land based station of a special navigation system.

P.Name: PrecisionApproachRadar
P.Doc: Identifies the signal restrictions associated with the PAR.

P.Name: Radar
P.Doc: The Radar (SSR) affected by the signal limitation.

O.Name: ContactInformation
O.Doc: Information required to enable contact with the responsible person and/or organisation. This model is derived from ISO19115-2003:Geographic Information- Metadata

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The official name of the contact.

P.Name: Title
P.Doc: The official title of the contact.

P.Name: Address
P.Doc: A postal address for the contact.

P.Name: NetworkNode
P.Doc: A direct link for the contact, over a data communication network.

P.Name: PhoneFax
P.Doc: A phone or fax number for the contact.

O.Name: OnlineContact
O.Doc: On-line or Network information that can be used to contact the individual or organisation, including eMail address and web site page.

P.Name: Network
P.Doc: The official name telecommunication network on which the resource is located.

P.Name: Linkage
P.Doc: Location (address) for on-line access using a Uniform Resource Locator address or similar addressing scheme such as http://www.statkart.no/isotc211

P.Name: Protocol
P.Doc: The connection protocol to be used.

P.Name: EMail
P.Doc: The address of the electronic mailbox of the responsible organisation or individual.

O.Name: PostalAddress
O.Doc: Physical address at which the organization or individual may be contacted. Derived from ISO19115-2003

P.Name: DeliveryPoint
P.Doc: The street address line for the location. More than one address line may be used.

P.Name: City
P.Doc: The city of the location or organisation.

P.Name: AdministrativeArea
P.Doc: The state or province of the location or organisation.

P.Name: PostalCode
P.Doc: The ZIP or other postal code for the location or organisation.

P.Name: Country
P.Doc: The country of the physical address for the location or organisation. Full name, not ISO 3166 abbreviations.

O.Name: TelephoneContact
O.Doc: Telephone numbers at which the organisation or individual may be contacted. From ISO19115-2003

P.Name: Voice
P.Doc: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the responsible organisation or individual.

P.Name: Facsimile
P.Doc: The telephone number of a facsimile machine for the responsible organisation or individual.

O.Name: AircraftCharacteristic
O.Doc: A specific aircraft type, such as airplane, balloon, helicopter, etc., and/or having specific equipment (certification), such as RNAV or RVSM.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Indicating the type of an aircraft.

P.Name: Engine
P.Doc: Indicating the type of aircraft engine.

P.Name: NumberEngine
P.Doc: A coded indication for the number of engines of an aircraft.

P.Name: TypeAircraftICAO
