P.Doc: A coded aircraft type designator assigned by ICAO to all aircraft heavier than micro-/ultra-light.

P.Name: AircraftLandingCategory
P.Doc: Classification of aircraft based on 1.3 times stall speed in landing configuration at maximum certified landing mass.

P.Name: WingSpan
P.Doc: The distance between the wing tips of the aircraft.

P.Name: WingSpanInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates whether the Aircraft Characteristic concerns aircraft with larger or smaller wingspan.

P.Name: ClassWingSpan
P.Doc: A classification of aircraft by wing span dimensions. It can be used to indicate the size of aircraft that a taxiway can handle.

P.Name: Weight
P.Doc: The maximum aircraft take-off weight.

P.Name: WeightInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates whether the Aircraft Characteristic concerns aircraft with bigger or smaller weight.

P.Name: Passengers
P.Doc: The maximum number of passengers

P.Name: PassengersInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates whether the Aircraft Characteristic concerns aircraft with larger or smaller number of passengers.

P.Name: Speed
P.Doc: A speed (IAS) that can be maintained by the aircraft.

P.Name: SpeedInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates whether the speed is a maximum or minimum imposed value.

P.Name: WakeTurbulence
P.Doc: The wake turbulence category of the aircraft.

P.Name: NavigationEquipment
P.Doc: An indication of the aircraft capability to use a certain ground based, satellite based or on-board system for aerial navigation.

P.Name: NavigationSpecification
P.Doc: A set of aircraft and flight crew requirements needed to support performance-based navigation operations.

P.Name: VerticalSeparationCapability
P.Doc: An indication of the aircraft capability to maintain a specified vertical separation.

P.Name: AntiCollisionAndSeparationEquipment
P.Doc: An indication of the aircraft equipment with collision avoidance systems.

P.Name: CommunicationEquipment
P.Doc: An indication of the aircraft equipment with voice and data communication devices.

P.Name: SurveillanceEquipment
P.Doc: An indication of the aircraft capability for operating with a certain surveillance system.

O.Name: FlightCharacteristic
O.Doc: A specific flight type, such as IFR/VFR, national/international, OAT/GAT, etc.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating a specified type of a flight, such as OAT/GAT.

P.Name: Rule
P.Doc: A code indicating a specific flight rule, such as IFR or VFR.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: The designation of a special status for a flight (e.g. ""HEAD"" for Head of State, ""STATE"" for State aircraft other than that of the Head of State).

P.Name: Military
P.Doc: A code indicating whether it is a military flight.

P.Name: Origin
P.Doc: A code indicating the origin of the flight with regard to the national borders.

P.Name: Purpose
P.Doc: A code indicating the purpose of the flight.

O.Name: LightElement
O.Doc: An elementary light source, part of a lighting system.

P.Name: Colour
P.Doc: A code indicating the colour of the lights in the group.

P.Name: IntensityLevel
P.Doc: A code indicating the relative intensity of the lights in the group.

P.Name: Intensity
P.Doc: The exact value of the intensity of the lights in the group.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of light source.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Identifies the geospatial location of the Light Element.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the LightElement.

O.Name: LightElementStatus
O.Doc: The description of the operational status of the LightElement.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: An indication of the operational status of the light element.

O.Name: AirspaceLayer
O.Doc: The portion of airspace between two specified vertical levels.

P.Name: UpperLimit
P.Doc: Upper limit of the block. The data type also allows a special non-numerical value "CEILING", meaning "the top of the airspace. This can useful in the case of Airspace that have a non-constant upper limit.

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

P.Name: LowerLimit
P.Doc: Lower limit of the block. The data type also allows a special non-numerical value "FLOOR" meaning "the bottom of the airspace". This can useful in the case of Airspace that have a non-constant lower limit.

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

P.Name: AltitudeInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates how the upper and/or lower altitude values should be interpreted.

P.Name: DiscreteLevelSeries
P.Doc: Restriction of the AirspaceLayer to a number of standard IFR or VFR levels.

O.Name: CircleSector
O.Doc: A group of properties that help describe a 3D pattern based on start angle, stop angle, inner distance, outer distance and upper/lower altitude.

P.Name: ArcDirection
P.Doc: Direction indicating clock-wise or counter-clockwise

P.Name: FromAngle
P.Doc: Beginning of angle

P.Name: ToAngle
P.Doc: Ending of angle

P.Name: AngleType
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of angle: magnetic, bearing, VOR radial.

P.Name: AngleDirectionReference
P.Doc: A code indicating a direction with regard to a reference point.

P.Name: InnerDistance
P.Doc: Angle sector volume inner limit

P.Name: OuterDistance
P.Doc: Angle sector volume outer limit

P.Name: UpperLimit
P.Doc: The uppermost altitude or level that is included in the sector.

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the upper limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: LowerLimit
P.Doc: The lowermost altitude or level that is included in the sector.

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the lower limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc.

O.Name: Timesheet
O.Doc: The definition of a single time interval, that occurs repeatedly as part of a schedule.

P.Name: TimeReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the time reference system (for example, 'UTC').

P.Name: StartDate
P.Doc: The start date of the validity of a timesheet. Used together with "endDate" to express repetitive time periods like 15 May to 15 November.

P.Name: EndDate
P.Doc: The end date of the validity of a timesheet. Used together with "startDate" to express repetitive time periods like 15 May to 15 November.

P.Name: Day
P.Doc: A code indicating the day the timesheet is referring to.

P.Name: DayTil
StartTime
P.Doc: The time of the day (specified in the "day" attribute) when the period described in the timesheet starts.

P.Name: StartEvent
P.Doc: A coded reference to an event (like sunset or sunrise), the occurrence of which indicates when the period described in the Timesheet starts.

P.Name: StartTimeRelativeEvent
P.Doc: The number of minutes before or after the event referred to in the "startEvent" attribute when the period described in the Timesheet starts.

P.Name: StartEventInterpretation
P.Doc: When both the "startTime" and "startEvent" values are not blank, this attribute explains how the combination of the two attributes should be interpreted, i.e. which of the two moments in time is the beginning of the period described by the timesheet.

P.Name: EndTime
P.Doc: The time of the day when the period described in the timesheet ends.

P.Name: EndEvent
P.Doc: A coded reference to an event (like sunset or sunrise), the occurrence of which indicates when the period described in the Timesheet ends.

P.Name: EndTimeRelativeEvent
P.Doc: The number of minutes before or after the event referred to in the "endEvent" attribute when the period described in the Timesheet ends.

P.Name: EndEventInterpretation
P.Doc: When both the "endTime" and "endEvent" values are not blank, this attribute explains how the combination of the two attributes should be interpreted, i.e. which of the two moments in time is the end of the period described by the timesheet.

P.Name: DaylightSavingAdjust
P.Doc: Indicates that the startTime and endTime values have to be decreased by one hour when Daylight Saving is in force (summer time).

P.Name: Excluded
P.Doc: Indicates that the time block indicated by the current Timesheet is excluded (subtracted) from the total schedule.

O.Name: PropertiesWithSchedule
O.Doc: An abstract class that is used for associating a group of feature properties with a repetitive time period, occurring cyclically inside the validity of the Feature Timeslice, during which these properties have specific values.

P.Name: TimeInterval
P.Doc: A component of the schedule.

P.Name: SpecialDateAuthority
P.Doc: Indicates that the SpecialDates associated with the related OrganisationAuthority are applicable to the schedule definition.

F.Name: SpecialDate
F.Doc: A calendar date that has a special meaning for a particular State/organisation and which may be referred to in the description of the schedules associated with various aeronautical features.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: An indication of the kind of the special dates.

P.Name: DateDay
P.Doc: The calendar date concerned.

P.Name: DateYear
P.Doc: The year concerned. If no year is indicated, then the same date will be concerned every year.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The name by which the date is known by the public (especially for public holidays).

P.Name: Authority
P.Doc: The State or organisation that observes the special date.

O.Name: Meteorology
O.Doc: A specific set of meteorological conditions.

P.Name: FlightConditions
P.Doc: An overall indication whether the meteorological conditions allow visual or instrumental operations.

P.Name: Visibility
P.Doc: The greatest distance at which lights of 1,000 candelas can be seen and identified against an unlit background (as reported by the airport).

P.Name: VisibilityInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates whether the visibility is a minimum or a maximum value.

P.Name: RunwayVisualRange
P.Doc: The distance over which a pilot of an aircraft on the centreline of the runway can see the runway surface markings or the lights delineating the runway or identifying its centre line.

P.Name: RunwayVisualRangeInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates whether the RVR is a minimum or maximum value.

F.Name: Service
F.Doc: The provision of tangible goods, information, instructions, guidance, etc. to pilots, flights, aircraft operators and other personnel and institutions concerned with flight operations.

P.Name: FlightOperations
P.Doc: The destination (arriving, departing, etc.) of the flights for which the information is provided.

P.Name: Rank
P.Doc: The order of priority of the service, such as "primary" or "alternate".

P.Name: CompliantICAO
P.Doc: A code indicating whether the service is compliant with the ICAO standards and recommended practices specified for this type of service.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: A free text name by which the service is identified.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: The location from where the service is provided.

P.Name: ServiceProvider
P.Doc: Identifies the Unit for which Services are provided.

P.Name: CallSign
P.Doc: In aeronautical radio communication the Unit providing a Service is identified by its CALL SIGN. Depending on the type of Service, a Unit may have more than one CALL SIGN, and with each an associated frequency.

P.Name: RadioCommunication
P.Doc: The radio frequency on which the service is provided.

P.Name: GroundCommunication
P.Doc: The point of contact on the ground for the service.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the Service.

F.Name: RadioCommunicationChannel
F.Doc: A radio frequency band of sufficient width and associated identification data used for one- or two-way communication from or to a transmitter on the ground or in the air.

P.Name: Mode
P.Doc: The type of communication channel.

P.Name: Rank
P.Doc: A code indicating the role of the communication channel, in terms of primary, alternate, emergency, etc.

P.Name: FrequencyTransmission
P.Doc: The value of the transmission frequency.

P.Name: FrequencyReception
P.Doc: The value of the reception frequency.

P.Name: Logon
P.Doc: A specified code used for data link, such as used for logon to an ATS unit.

P.Name: EmissionType
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of emission, as defined at the 1979 ITU World Administrative Radio Conference. For example, A3E, etc..

P.Name: SelectiveCall
P.Doc: A code indicating if whether or not a frequency treats "selective call".

P.Name: FlightChecked
P.Doc: Indicates if the communication channel has been flight checked.

P.Name: TrafficDirection
P.Doc: Indicates the eventual directionality of the communication channel.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: The location from where the radio are transmitted.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the RadioCommunicationChannel.

O.Name: CallsignDetail
O.Doc: Information about the operational identifier by which the provider of the service is called and the language used.

P.Name: CallSign
P.Doc: The full textual service provider identification or call-sign for a particular frequency. For example, Athinai Control, Malmoe Radar, etc..

P.Name: Language
P.Doc: A code indicating the language in which the service is provided on a particular frequency, as associated with a particular call-sign.

F.Name: PilotControlledLighting
F.Doc: Service providing airborne control of lights by keying the aircraft's microphone. Often available at locations without specified hours for lighting and where there is no control tower or Flight Service Station (FSS); or when the tower or FSS is closed (locations with part-time tower or FSS).

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Type of pilot controlled lighting service - standard or non-standard.

P.Name: Duration
P.Doc: The length of time the lighting is illuminated, normally 15 minutes.

P.Name: IntensitySteps
P.Doc: The number of intensity steps/levels for a particular type of lighting system.

P.Name: StandByIntensity
P.Doc: The intensity step/level of the lighting system when not in use.

P.Name: RadioFrequency
P.Doc: The radio frequency to be used by the pilot for the activation of the system.

P.Name: ActivationInstruction
P.Doc: Operational instructions for controlling the lighting systems.

P.Name: ControlledLightIntensity
P.Doc: Identifies the Light Activation that the Pilot Controlled Lighting controls.

P.Name: ActivatedGroundLighting
P.Doc: Identifies the Ground Light System that the Pilot Controlled Lighting activates.

F.Name: InformationService
F.Doc: A kind of service that consists in the provision of aeronautical, meteorological, traffic and related information to aircraft crew and other actors involved in flight operations, in flight or on the ground.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of information service provided.

P.Name: Voice
P.Doc: Indicating whether the service is provided as voice message.

P.Name: DataLink
P.Doc: Indicates whether the service is available via data-link.

P.Name: Recorded
P.Doc: Indicates that the information broadcast is recorded and played back rather than a live transmission.

P.Name: NavaidBroadcast
P.Doc: The VOR navaid on which the information service is broadcast. Typically for VOLMET.

P.Name: ClientAirspace
P.Doc: The Airspace about which the information is provided.

P.Name: ClientAirport
P.Doc: The Airport for which the information service is provided.

P.Name: ClientRoute
P.Doc: The route portion for which the information is provided.

P.Name: ClientProcedure
P.Doc: Identifies the Procedure for which the Information Service is concerned.

P.Name: ClientHolding
P.Doc: The holding pattern for which the information is provided.

P.Name: ClientAerialRefuelling
P.Doc: The Aerial Refuelling procedure for which the information is provided.

F.Name: TrafficSeparationService
F.Doc: A kind of service that provides control and separation services, to aircraft in the air and on the ground.

P.Name: RadarAssisted
P.Doc: A code indicating if the service is provided with radar assistance.

P.Name: DataLinkEnabled
P.Doc: Indicates if Controller-Pilot Data-Link Communication (CPDLC) is available in support of the service.

F.Name: GroundTrafficControlService
F.Doc: A kind of service that provides control and separation services, to aircraft at the airport.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of ground traffic control service provided.

P.Name: ClientAirport
P.Doc: The Airport/Heliport where the surface traffic control service is provided.

F.Name: AirTrafficControlService
F.Doc: A kind of service that provides control and separation services to aircraft in the air.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of air traffic control service provided.

P.Name: ClientAirport
P.Doc: The Airport/Heliport around which the air traffic is controlled.

P.Name: ClientAirspace
P.Doc: The airspace for which the air traffic separation service is provided.

P.Name: ClientRoute
P.Doc: The route portion for which the air traffci control is provided.

P.Name: ClientProcedure
P.Doc: The procedure on which the air traffic control service is provided.

P.Name: ClientHolding
P.Doc: The Holding Pattern on which the air traffic control is provided.

P.Name: ClientAerialRefuelling
P.Doc: The Aerial Refuelling procedure controlled by the Service.

P.Name: AircraftLocator
P.Doc: The Direction Finder assisting the ATC service (such as APP, TWR, etc.).

F.Name: AirTrafficManagementService
F.Doc: A kind of service that provides flight planning and flow management operations.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of air traffic flow management service provided.

P.Name: ClientAirspace
P.Doc: The Airspace for which the flight planning and air traffic management service is provided.

P.Name: ClientAerialRefuelling
P.Doc: The Aerial Refuelling for which the scheduling service is provided.

P.Name: ClientRoute
P.Doc: The route protion for which the flight ploanning and air traffic flow management services is provided.

F.Name: SearchRescueService
F.Doc: The performance of distress monitoring, communication, coordination and search and rescue functions, initial medical assistance or medical evacuation, through the use of public and private resources, including cooperating aircraft, vessels and other craft and installations.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of air traffic flow management service provided.

P.Name: ClientAirspace
P.Doc: The airspace where the search and rescue service is available.

P.Name: ClientRoute
P.Doc: The route where the search and rescue service is provided.

F.Name: AirportGroundService
F.Doc: Services that provide maintenance of the airport infrastructure and direct support to aircraft on the ground.

P.Name: AirportHeliport
P.Doc: The airport/heliport where the service is provided.

F.Name: PassengerService
F.Doc: Passenger services and facilities available at an aerodrome/heliport (like medical facilities) or in the surrounding area (hotels in city etc.).

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of passenger facility/service available.

F.Name: AircraftGroundService
F.Doc:
A kind of maintenance, support or supply service provided to aircraft at the ground.
Note: instances should be grouped by provider (associated Unit)

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of ground service.

F.Name: FireFightingService
F.Doc: A kind of airport service that provides rescue and fire fighting capabilities for aircraft in emergency at and around the airport.

P.Name: Category
P.Doc: A standard categorisation of the rescue and fire-fighting capabilities of an aerodrome on the basis of the length and fuselage width of the largest aircraft to be rescued.

P.Name: Standard
P.Doc: A code indicating the standard referred to by the fire fighting category value.

F.Name: AirportClearanceService
F.Doc: A kind of service that provides clearance capabilities for airport surfaces.

P.Name: SnowPlan
P.Doc: Description of the snow removal priorities.

F.Name: AirportSuppliesService
F.Doc:
A kind of service that provides supplies (fuel, oil, oxygen, etc.) to aircraft.
Note: instances should be grouped by provider (associated Unit)

P.Name: FuelSupply
P.Doc: The types of fuel that are supplied.

P.Name: OilSupply
P.Doc: The types of oil supplied.

P.Name: NitrogenSupply
P.Doc: The types of nitorgen supplies.

P.Name: OxygenSupply
P.Doc: The types of oxygen supplies.

O.Name: Fuel
O.Doc: Fuel types used for aircraft/helicopters.

P.Name: Category
P.Doc: A code indicating a type of fuel for aircraft and helicopters (e.g. OCT73, OCT80-87, AVGAS, OCT100-130, OCT115-145, MOGAS, JET, A1, A1+, B, JP4, JP5).

O.Name: Nitrogen
O.Doc: NITROGEN supplies in aviation.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of nitrogen supplies for aviation usage.

O.Name: Oil
O.Doc: Oil types used for aircraft/helicopters.

P.Name: Category
P.Doc: A code indicating a category of oil used in aircraft (e.g. TURBO, AVIA, HYD).

O.Name: Oxygen
O.Doc: Oxygen supplies used in aviation.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of oxygen supplies for aviation usage.

O.Name: ServiceOperationalStatus
O.Doc: Service operational status.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Indicates the operational capability of the service.

O.Name: RadioCommunicationOperationalStatus
O.Doc: Radio communication channel operational status information.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Indicates the operational capability of the operational channel.

O.Name: PointReference
O.Doc:
Defines the location of a designated point using a combination of angles and distances based on the guidance service. The set of angles and distances must not under specify the location.
The indications that are part of the PointReference must locate the same designated point.

P.Name: Role
P.Doc: Describes the role of the defined point reference. Example: DME, INT, recommended navaid, fix tolerance

P.Name: PriorFixTolerance
P.Doc: Because the fix may be received early, protection against obstacles must be provided from a line perpendicular to the flight course. PriorFixTolerance indicates the error distance (from the fix to the earliest point where the fix may be received along the flight course.

P.Name: PostFixTolerance
P.Doc: Indicates the error distance (from the fix to the latest point where the fix may be received along the flight course.

P.Name: Point
P.Doc: The point reference occurs at (locates) DesignatedPoint.

P.Name: FacilityAngle
P.Doc: Indicates the angle from the navigation aid(s) or designated point on which the fix is based.

P.Name: FacilityDistance
P.Doc: Indicates the distance from the navigation aid(s) or designated point on which the fix is based.

P.Name: FixToleranceArea
P.Doc: The dimensions of the fix tolerance area are determined by the system use accuracy of the navigation aid(s) on which the fix is based, and the distance from the facility.

O.Name: SegmentPoint
O.Doc: Indicates a point associated with a defined segment.

P.Name: ReportingATC
P.Doc: Indicating the type of position report required by an ATC Unit. Eg.: compulsory or on request.

P.Name: FlyOver
P.Doc:
Indicates if the aircraft is required to fly directly over the fix. If code is Yes, then it is a 'fly-over' waypoint. If the code is No, then the associated fix is a 'fly-by' waypoint. [ICAO] Waypoints are identified as either flyover or fly-by.
Fly-by waypoint. A waypoint which requires turn anticipation to allow tangential interception of the next segment of a route or procedure
Flyover waypoint. A waypoint at which a turn is initiated in order to join the next segment of a route or procedure.

P.Name: Waypoint
P.Doc: A point used for RNAV procedures/routes.

P.Name: RadarGuidance
P.Doc: Radar guidance is possible for reaching this point.

P.Name: FacilityMakeup
P.Doc: Segment point is located using specific makeup known as a reference.

P.Name: PointChoice
P.Doc: Segments use a significant point as a point segment.

P.Name: ExtendedServiceVolume
P.Doc: An approved and flight checked extension to the standard service volume of a navaid

O.Name: TerminalSegmentPoint
O.Doc: Indicates a point or a condition associated with a defined segment leg.

P.Name: Role
P.Doc: Identifies the function or position the point plays in the approach procedure.

P.Name: LeadRadial
P.Doc: The lead radial provides information for aircraft with single receiving equipment to change the receiver to the localizer or other facility providing the course guidance and to ensure the aircraft is within the clearance coverage area of LOC facilities before changing frequency or accepting on-course indication.

P.Name: LeadDME
P.Doc: The lead DME , like the lead Radial, provides information for aircraft with single receiving equipment to change the receiver to the localizer or other facility providing the course guidance and to ensure the aircraft is within the clearance coverage area of LOC facilities before changing frequency or accepting on-course indication.

P.Name: IndicatorFACF
P.Doc: Indicates the point is also a Final Approach Course Fix (FACF).

O.Name: EnRouteSegmentPoint
O.Doc: Indicates a point associated with a defined EnRoute segment.

P.Name: RoleFreeFlight
P.Doc: Free flight is a an air traffic control method that uses no centralized control (e.g. air traffic controllers). Instead, parts of airspace are reserved dynamically and automatically in a distributed way using computer communication to ensure the required separation between aircraft

P.Name: RoleRVSM
P.Doc: A code indicating that the point has a specific role in the reduced vertical separation minima (RVSM) context.

P.Name: TurnRadius
P.Doc: The recommended turn radius when continuing on the previous segment of the route (start point) or when continuing on the next segment of the route(end point).

P.Name: RoleMilitaryTraining
P.Doc: A code indicating the usage of the point in the case of a military training route.

F.Name: AngleIndication
F.Doc: An angular reference from a navaid or with reference to a designated point.

P.Name: Angle
P.Doc: The indication of a bearing (at a given point) by the measurement of the angle between the bearing and either True North or Magnetic North (this should appear explicitly or implicitly). The angle is measured clockwise from 0 degrees up to but not including 360 degrees. The value can also be a VOR radial. For example, Westward is expressed as 270.

P.Name: AngleType
P.Doc: A code indicating the direction of the zero bearing. For example, magnetic north or true north.

P.Name: IndicationDirection
P.Doc: Code indicating the if the angle is TO or FROM the Navaid or Designated Point that is used.

P.Name: TrueAngle
P.Doc: The indication of a bearing (at a given point) by the measurement of the angle between the bearing and True North. The angle is measured clockwise from 0 degrees up to but not including 360 degrees. The value can also be a VOR radial. For example, Westward is expressed as 270.

P.Name: CardinalDirection
P.Doc: The angle expressed as compass direction.

P.Name: MinimumReceptionAltitude
P.Doc: The lowest altitude that an aircraft can receive signal.

P.Name: Fix
P.Doc: The angle indication occurs at (locates) DesignatedPoint.

P.Name: PointChoice
P.Doc: Indicates the navigation aid on which the fix is based.

F.Name: DistanceIndication
F.Doc: A distance reference from a navaid or with reference to a designated point.

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: The value of the distance.

P.Name: MinimumReceptionAltitude
P.Doc: The lowest altitude that an aircraft can receive signal.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: indicates the distance is from distance measuring equipment or just a simple distance

P.Name: Fix
P.Doc: The distance indication occurs at (locates) DesignatedPoint.

P.Name: PointChoice
P.Doc: Indicates the navigation aid on which the fix is based.

O.Name: AngleUse
O.Doc: Indicates the role of the AngleIndication in the PointReference (for example, along track versus intersecting).

P.Name: AlongCourseGuidance
P.Doc: Defines if the angle indication provides the course guidance for the segment.

O.Name: AuthorityForNavaidEquipment
O.Doc: Provides details about the level of responsibility of an OrganisationAuthority for a Navaid Equipment.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of relationship between the NavaidEquipment and the OrganisationAuthority.

O.Name: AuthorityForSpecialNavigationStation
O.Doc: Provides details about the level of responsibility of an OrganisationAuthority for a Special Navigation System Station.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of responsibility of the OrganizationAuthority for the Special Navigation System Station.

F.Name: Azimuth
F.Doc: A component of an MLS consisting of an SHF transmitter and associated equipment, radiating signals in a volume of airspace served by the MLS, thereby furnishing azimuth indications to aircraft approaching the runway or back azimuth indications to aircraft departing from the runway or performing a missed approach procedure.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating if it is 'normal' or 'back' azimuth equipment.

P.Name: TrueBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the azimuth beam and True North at the azimuth antenna.

P.Name: TrueBearingAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the measured angle between the azimuth beam and True North at the azimuth antenna

P.Name: MagneticBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the direction of the azimuth beam and Magnetic North at the azimuth antenna.

P.Name: AngleProportionalLeft
P.Doc: The value of the angle within which the azimuth indication is proportional to the deviation from the azimuth zero indication direction, and left of this direction from the azimuth antenna.

P.Name: AngleProportionalRight
P.Doc: The value of the angle within which the azimuth indication is proportional to the deviation from the azimuth zero indication direction, and right of this direction from the azimuth antenna.

P.Name: AngleCoverLeft
P.Doc: The value of the angle from the zero indication direction within which the azimuth indication is usable, and left of this direction from the azimuth antenna.

P.Name: AngleCoverRight
P.Doc: The value of the angle from the zero indication direction within which the azimuth indication is usable, and right of this direction from the azimuth antenna.

P.Name: Channel
P.Doc: A code indicating the channel on which the Microwave Landing System is operating.

F.Name: CheckpointINS
F.Doc: A point established to test the Inertial Navigation System in the aircraft.

F.Name: CheckpointVOR
F.Doc: A VOR test transmits a test signal used to determine the accuracy of a VOR receiver on the ground or airborne.

P.Name: CheckPointFacility
P.Doc: Indicates the navigation aid on which the fix is based.

O.Name: AuthorityForSpecialNavigationSystem
O.Doc: Provides details about the level of responsibility of an OrganisationAuthority for a Special Navigation System.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of responsibility of the OrganisationAuthority for the Special Navigation System.

F.Name: DME
F.Doc: Ultra High Frequency (UHF) ground equipment that is used in conjunction with airborne equipment to determine distance between the airborne and ground equipment.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The particular spectrum characteristics or accuracy of Ultra High Frequency (UHF) Distance Measuring Equipment (DME), as a category.

P.Name: Channel
P.Doc: The channel of the DME. See Annex 10, Table A, end of Chapter 3 for channelling details and for a list of allowable values.

P.Name: GhostFrequency
P.Doc: The frequency of a virtual VHF facility paired with the DME according to ICAO Annex 10, table A, ch.3.

P.Name: Displace
P.Doc: The distance from the DME antenna to the position where the zero range indication occurs in the DME receiver.

F.Name: Elevation
F.Doc: A component of an MLS consisting of an SHF transmitter, and associated equipment radiating signals within a volume of airspace served by the MLS, thereby furnishing elevation information as an angular value to aircraft approaching the runway.

P.Name: AngleNominal
P.Doc: The normal glide path angle for the MLS installation.

P.Name: AngleMinimum
P.Doc: The value of the lowest elevation angle authorized for an MLS procedure.

P.Name: AngleSpan
P.Doc: The value of the span angle of the elevation transmitter signal between the lower and the upper limits.

P.Name: AngleAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the elevation angle.

F.Name: Glidepath
F.Doc: A component of an ILS consisting of a UHF transmitter radiating signals and providing a straight line descent path in the vertical plane containing the centre line of the runway served by the ILS, and thereby furnishing descent information down to the lowest authorized decision height or to the surface of a runway, depending on the Facility Performance Category of the ILS.

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: The frequency value of the glide path indicator.

P.Name: Slope
P.Doc: The angle of the glide path.

P.Name: AngleAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the Glide path angle.

P.Name: Rdh
P.Doc: The value of the ILS Reference Datum Height (ILS RDH).

P.Name: RdhAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the value of the ILS Reference Datum Height (ILS RDH).

F.Name: Localizer
F.Doc: A component of an ILS consisting of a VHF transmitter, radiating signals in the direction served by the ILS, to provide a straight line descent path in the vertical plane containing the centre line of the runway.

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: The frequency of the localizer.

P.Name: MagneticBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the localizer beam and Magnetic North at the localizer antenna.

P.Name: MagneticBearingAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the measured angle between the localizer beam and Magnetic North at the localizer antenna.

P.Name: TrueBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the localizer beam and True North at the localizer antenna. Note : The True North is the north point at which the meridian lines meet.

P.Name: TrueBearingAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the measured angle between the localizer beam and True North at the localizer antenna.

P.Name: Declination
P.Doc: The angular difference between True North and the station declination (Magnetic North - as indicated by the station).

P.Name: WidthCourse
P.Doc: The localizer course width, in degrees.

P.Name: WidthCourseAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the localizer course width, in degrees.

P.Name: BackCourseUsable
P.Doc: A code indicating the usability of the localizer signal in the back course sector.

F.Name: MarkerBeacon
F.Doc: A marker beacon serving to identify a particular location in space by means of a 75MHz transmitter which transmits a directional signal to be received by aircraft flying overhead.

P.Name: Class
P.Doc: A code indicating the class of the radio marker. For example, fan marker, low-powered fan marker, Z marker.

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: The value of the radio emission frequency.

P.Name: AxisBearing
P.Doc: The true bearing of the minor axis of the marker beacon. (source: ARINC 424 Specification)

P.Name: AuralMorseCode
P.Doc: The Morse code transmitted by the beacon.

F.Name: Navaid
F.Doc: A service providing guidance information or position data for the efficient and safe operation of aircraft supported by one or more radio navigation aids.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Type of the navaid service such as ILS, MLS, VORTAC, VOR/DME, etc.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The coded identifier given to the navaid system.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The long name given to the composite navaid.

P.Name: FlightChecked
P.Doc: Indicates if the navaid has been flight checked.

P.Name: Purpose
P.Doc: Indication of the intended usage of the navaid (enroute or terminal)

P.Name: SignalPerformance
P.Doc: The signal performance level indicating the precision of an ILS or MLS system.

P.Name: CourseQuality
P.Doc: An indication of the signal quality of the ILS course structure based on the location the precision signal is usable to.

P.Name: IntegrityLevel
P.Doc: That quality which relates to the trust which can be placed in the correctness of the information supplied by the ILS facility.

P.Name: TouchDownLiftOff
P.Doc: Indicates that the navaid is installed at a particular landing area.

P.Name: NavaidEquipment
P.Doc: Navaid system can have components that perform a specific function for aircraft guidance.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: This is the location used when the navaid acts as a significant point. This location is usually the location of one of the navaid equipments.

P.Name: RunwayDirection
P.Doc: Indicates that the navaid is installed at a particular landing area. Typically used for ILS and MLS systems.

P.Name: ServedAirport
P.Doc: Indicates that the Navaid is used for homing at a particular AirportHeliport.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the navaid.

O.Name: NavaidComponent
O.Doc:
Indicates navigation use of a NavaidEquipment as a component of the navigation service provided by a Navaid.
For example the DME NavaidEquipment is a NavaidComponent of an ILS system. The DME may be collocated with the Localizer and the DME may provide the navigable location for the Navaid service.

P.Name: CollocationGroup
P.Doc: Set of navaid equipments that are collocated. All Navaid equipment that has the same value for this property are collocated together. For example in a VOR/DME Navaid the VOR and DME navaid equipment will be assigned the same collocationGroup number = 1. For example an ILS might have a Localizer with collocation Group number = 1 and collocated DME and Glidepath sharing collocationGroup number = 2.

P.Name: MarkerPosition
P.Doc: A code indicating the position, in a navaid landing system, of the markers situated on the centreline of a runway. For example: outer, middle, etc..

P.Name: ProvidesNavigableLocation
P.Doc: Indicates the navaid equipment used to specify the navigable location of the Navaid when the navaid is used as significant point

F.Name: NavaidEquipment
F.Doc: A physical navaid equipment like VOR, DME, localizer, TACAN, etc..

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The identifying code given to the navaid.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The long name given to the navaid equipment.

P.Name: EmissionClass
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of emission, as defined at the 1979 ITU World Administrative Radio Conference.

P.Name: Mobile
P.Doc: Indicates if the navaid equipment is mobile.

P.Name: MagneticVariation
P.Doc: The measured angle between Magnetic North and True North at the VOR and at the time reported in dateMagneticVariation. By convention, the measure is expressed as a positive number if Magnetic North is to the east of True North and negative if Magnetic North is to the west of True North. Therefore, magnetic bearing + magnetic variation = true bearing. The following rule of thumb applies: ""variation east-magnetic least, variation west-magnetic best"".

P.Name: MagneticVariationAccuracy
P.Doc: The accuracy of the measured angle between Magnetic North and True North at the VOR and at the time reported in dateMagneticVariation

P.Name: DateMagneticVariation
P.Doc: The year the magnetic variation was measured.

P.Name: FlightChecked
P.Doc: Indicates if the navaid equipment has been flight checked.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: This is the location where the navaid equipment resides.

P.Name: Authority
P.Doc: Represents the organization responsible for the equipment.

P.Name: Monitoring
P.Doc: Navaid equipment monitoring information.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the navaid equipment.

F.Name: NavigationSystemCheckpoint
F.Doc: A point established and marked on the surface of an aerodrome allowing the checking of a navigation system (like VOR, GNSS, etc.) or initialisation of an inertial navigation system.

P.Name: Category
P.Doc: Indicates the position of the checkpoint; airborne or ground

P.Name: UpperLimit
P.Doc: Indicating the upper limit of the block in which the check should be conducted.

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

P.Name: LowerLimit
P.Doc: Indicating the lower limit of the block in which the check should be conducted.

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

P.Name: AltitudeInterpretation
P.Doc: Indicates how the upper and/or lower altitude values should be interpreted.

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: The value of the distance from the checkpoint to the navaid.

P.Name: Angle
P.Doc: The indication of a bearing (at a given point) by the measurement of the angle between the checkpoint and the navaid equipment (VOR)

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: Identifies the point of he checkpoint.

P.Name: AirportHeliport
P.Doc: Identifies the airport for which the checkpoint is established.

F.Name: SDF
F.Doc: Simplified Directional Facility (SDF) provides a final approach course similar to that of the ILS localizer although is not as precise as Localizer. It does not provide glide slope information. The SDF transmits signals within the range of 108.10 to 111.95 MHz. The approach techniques and procedures used in an SDF instrument approach are essentially the same as those employed in executing a standard localizer approach except the SDF course may not be aligned with the runway and the course may be wider, resulting in less precision. Usable off-course indications are limited to 35 degrees either side of the course centreline. Instrument indications received beyond 35 degrees should be disregarded. This angle is generally not more than 3 degrees. The SDF signal is fixed at either 6 degrees or 12 degrees as necessary to provide maximum flyability and optimum course quality.

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: The frequency of the localizer.

P.Name: MagneticBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the localizer beam and Magnetic North at the localizer antenna.

P.Name: TrueBearing
P.Doc: The measured angle between the localizer beam and True North at the localizer antenna. Note : The True North is the north point at which the meridian lines meet.

F.Name: NDB
F.Doc: A Non-directional radio beacon. A low or medium frequency radio beacon which transmits signals whereby the pilot of an aircraft properly equipped can determine bearings and 'home in' on the station.

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: The frequency of the NDB emission.

P.Name: Class
P.Doc: The class of the NDB. For example, NDB or Locator.

P.Name: EmissionBand
P.Doc: The emission band for the NDB

F.Name: SpecialNavigationStation
F.Doc: A land based station of a special navigation system.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The textual name of the station.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of service within the chain. E.g. Master, Red Slave (DECCA), Slave (LORAN) etc..

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: The value of the emission frequency.

P.Name: Emission
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of emission, as defined at the 1979 ITU World Administrative Radio Conference.

P.Name: SystemChain
P.Doc: Station provides a service in a special navigation system chain

P.Name: ResponsibleOrganisation
P.Doc: Special navigation system station - Version is under responsibility of Organisaton or authority

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: Represents the graphical location of the Special Navigation Station.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the Special Navigation Station.

F.Name: VOR
F.Doc: A VHF omnidirectional radio range beacon. A short-range, very-high-frequency omnidirectional beacon which provides an indication in the aircraft of the bearing of the beacon, or left-right track indication.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating a type of VOR, e.g. conventional VOR or Doppler VOR.

P.Name: Frequency
P.Doc: The value of the frequency.

P.Name: ZeroBearingDirection
P.Doc: A code indicating the direction of the 'zero bearing' provided by the station. For example: magnetic north, true north.

P.Name: Declination
P.Doc: The angular difference between True North and the station declination (Magnetic North - as indicated by the station).

F.Name: TACAN
F.Doc: A UHF Tactical Air Navigation beacon. A navigation system developed by military and naval forces providing, as far as the navigating pilot is concerned and for suitably equipped aircraft, the same indication as a VOR/DME system.

P.Name: Channel
P.Doc: A code indicating the channel of the TACAN system.

P.Name: Declination
P.Doc: The angular difference between the direction of the 'zero bearing' indicated by the station and the direction of the True North.

F.Name: SpecialNavigationSystem
F.Doc: A wide area (worldwide) navigation system based on a chain of land stations or a satellite constellation providing radio frequency signals which can be used by airborne equipment to determine at least, the aircrafts two-dimensional position or, depending on the capability of the system, the three-dimensional position.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of special navigation system. For example, LORAN, DECCA, GNSS, etc.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The designator (coded identifier) of a special navigation system chain.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The textual name of the chain of a special navigation system. For example, Mangern Chain

P.Name: ResponsibleOrganisation
P.Doc: Special navigation system - Version is under the responsibility of Organisaton or authority

O.Name: NavaidOperationalStatus
O.Doc: Navaid operational status information.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Indicates the state of the navaid.

P.Name: SignalType
P.Doc: The type of signal that is affected by the operational status.

O.Name: NavaidEquipmentMonitoring
O.Doc: Navaid equipment monitoring information.

P.Name: Monitored
P.Doc: Navaid equipment is monitored or not.

O.Name: SpecialNavigationStationStatus
O.Doc: Special Navigation Station Status information.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Operational status.

F.Name: DirectionFinder
F.Doc: An electronic device used to determine the position of a radio source by means of directional antennas, which receives the strongest radio signal when it is pointing directly at the transmitter.

P.Name: Doppler
P.Doc: Indicates whether the equipment uses the Doppler effect for higher precision.

P.Name: InformationProvision
P.Doc: An Information Service (such as TWEB, ASOS, AWOS, etc.) associated with the Direction Finder.

F.Name: DesignatedPoint
F.Doc: A geographical location not marked by the site of a radio navigation aid, used in defining an ATS route, the flight path of an aircraft or for other navigation or ATS purposes.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The coded designator of the point. For example, the five-letter ICAO name of the point, etc..

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The kind of point designator, indicating the rules by which the designator has been created.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The full textual name of a designated point, if any. For example, 'GOTAN Intersection' for GOTAN. Name may also be used to identify an unnamed point (See ARINC 424 for unnamed points.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Represents the graphical location of the designated point

P.Name: AimingPoint
P.Doc: The DesignatedPoint is located above the centre of the TLOF.

P.Name: AirportHeliport
P.Doc: The designated Point indentifier is unique within all other designated points associated with the same aerodrome/heliport. Typically, such points are used for RNAV procedures at that aerodrome/heliport.

P.Name: RunwayPoint
P.Doc: The DesignatedPoint is over a centreline point.

O.Name: SignificantPoint
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between a navaid system, a runway point, an airport reference point, an aiming point or a fix designated point. SignificantPoint accounts for a specified geographical location used to define an ATS route, the flight path of an aircraft or for other navigation/ATS purposes.

P.Name: FixDesignatedPoint
P.Doc: The association to a designated point

P.Name: NavaidSystem
P.Doc: The association to a navaid

P.Name: AimingPoint
P.Doc: This association should be used for a SignificantPoint located at the centre of a TLOF and which is not declared as DesignatedPoint, because it is unnamed and does not have references (distance and/or angle indications)

P.Name: RunwayPoint
P.Doc: This association should be used for a SignificantPoint located at the runway direction threshold and which is not declared as DesignatedPoint, because it is unnamed and does not have references (distance and/or angle indications)

P.Name: AirportReferencePoint
P.Doc: This association should be used for a SignificantPoint located at the Airport/Heliport ReferencePoint and which is not declared as DesignatedPoint, because it is unnamed and does not have references (distance and/or angle indications)

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: This choice should be used when the SignificantPoint is a simple unnamed latitude/longitude location and it does not have references (angle and/or distance indications). Typical examples are the North Atlantic track points, flight restrictions that refer to an arbitrary geographical position. Otherwise, use DesignatedPoint (when it is named and/or when it has references).

F.Name: SignificantPointInAirspace
F.Doc: A significant point's use and relative location to an airspace.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the way a significant point is used in association to airspace. Description: Ex: entry point, exit point, etc.

P.Name: RelativeLocation
P.Doc: A code indicating the location of a significant point in relation to airspace. Description: Ex: In, Out, On Border.

P.Name: ContainingAirspace
P.Doc: defines a point in the airspace

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Associates the type of Significant Point with the Airspace (such as "entry point", "border point", etc.

O.Name: GuidanceService
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between a navaid system, a radar system or a special navigation system to define the guidance service on which a Procedure is based

P.Name: Navaid
P.Doc: The guidance service is using a Navaid.

P.Name: SpecialNavigationSystem
P.Doc: The guidance service is using a special navigation system.

P.Name: Radar
P.Doc: The guidance service is using a radar system.

F.Name: AeronauticalGroundLight
F.Doc: A light specifically provided as an aid to air navigation, with the exception of obstacle lights and lights forming part of surface or approach lighting systems

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The name by which the ground light is known

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A classification of the light based on the kind of item that it visually identifies

P.Name: Colour
P.Doc: The primary colour of the light source.

P.Name: Flashing
P.Doc: An indication whether the light is steady or flashing.

P.Name: StructureBeacon
P.Doc: The vertical structure (such as airport tower) identified by the ground light.

P.Name: AerodromeBeacon
P.Doc: The airport/heliport in the area of which the light is situated.

O.Name: Note
O.Doc: A general text note for a feature or for one of its properties.

P.Name: PropertyName
P.Doc: The name of the feature property for which this note is relevant, if applicable. If no propertyName is specified, then the Note is relevant for the feature as a whole.

P.Name: Purpose
P.Doc: An indication of the goal which led to the provision of the free text note.

P.Name: TranslatedNote
P.Doc: The Note written linguistically.

O.Name: LinguisticNote
O.Doc: The note content expressed in a specific language. As a minimum, all Notes shall be expressed in English.

P.Name: Note
P.Doc: The text of the Note, in a specific language.

F.Name: OrganisationAuthority
F.Doc: A feature used to model various Organisations and Authorities. For example: ATS Organisations, Aircraft Operating Agencies, States, Groups of States, etc.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The full official name of the State, Organisation, Authority, aircraft operating agency, handling agency etc.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: A coded identifier of the organisation, authority, agency or unit. Description: CA= Canada, FAA= Federal Aviation Administration, UK = United Kingdom, ICAO = International Civil Aviation Organization

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the nature of an authority in terms of its status or business role in ATM. For example: State, group of States, organisation within a State, aircraft operating agency, etc.

P.Name: Military
P.Doc: Information on the type of operations allowed.

P.Name: Contact
P.Doc: Identifies the contact for the Organisation.

P.Name: RelatedOrganisationAuthority
P.Doc: The related organisation, authority or agency.

O.Name: OrganisationAuthorityAssociation

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The kind of association between two Organisations/Authorities.

F.Name: Unit
F.Doc: A generic term meaning variously all types of 'units' providing all types of services. This includes particularly Air Traffic Management (ATM) Units but also units which are not express verbs included in ATM such as SAR, MET, COM etc.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The full textual name of a unit. This name must be established according to the rules specified by ICAO, viz.: in the official language of the country, transposed into the Latin Alphabet where necessary.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A type by which the Unit is recognised, usually related to the standard type of services provided by it (e.g. area control centre, advisory centre, aeronautical information services office).

P.Name: CompliantICAO
P.Doc: A code indicating whether the Unit is setup according to the ICAO SARPS.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: A coded designator associated with the Unit. For example, the ICAO Location Indicator of an ACC, as listed in DOC 7910.

P.Name: Military
P.Doc: Indicates whether the Unit is civil, military or joint.

P.Name: Position
P.Doc: Identifies the geographical point of the Unit.

P.Name: AirportLocation
P.Doc: Identifies the Airport of Heliport where the Unit is located.

P.Name: OwnerOrganisation
P.Doc: Identifies the Organisation that supervises the Unit.

P.Name: Contact
P.Doc: Contact details for the unit (phone, postal address, e-mail, etc.)

P.Name: RelatedUnit
P.Doc: The related unit.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational status of the Unit.

O.Name: UnitDependency
O.Doc: This association class describes the operational/functional relation that exists between a Unit and a RelatedUnit.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The kind of dependency between the Unit and the RelatedUnit.

O.Name: UnitAvailability
O.Doc: Unit availability information.

P.Name: OperationalStatus
P.Doc: Operational status information.

O.Name: VerticalStructurePartGeometry
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between the three different possibilities for describing the horizontal projection of an obstacle: point, line or polygon

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: The horizontal projection of an obstacle is a Point.

P.Name: LinearExtent
P.Doc: The horizontal projection of an obstacle is a Curve.

P.Name: SurfaceExtent
P.Doc: The horizontal projection of an obstacle is a Shape.

O.Name: VerticalStructurePart
O.Doc: A part of the vertical structure that can be represented as point, line or polygon with vertical extent.

P.Name: VerticalExtent
P.Doc: The extent of the vertical structure part.

P.Name: VerticalExtentAccuracy
P.Doc: Accuracy of the value of the declared vertical extent.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of vertical structure, such as building, tower, cable, etc.

P.Name: ConstructionStatus
P.Doc: This property enables the provision of information about the construction of the man-made object that constitutes the vertical structure.

P.Name: MarkingPattern
P.Doc: The general layout of the external paint or another marking element, intended to increase the visibility of the vertical structure.

P.Name: MarkingFirstColour
P.Doc: The principal colour of the marking.

P.Name: MarkingSecondColour
P.Doc: The secondary colour for the marking.

P.Name: Mobile
P.Doc: A flag indicating whether the vertical structure is expected to move around its nominal location. The accuracy property of the related Point, Surface or Point can be used to provide the maximum displacement range.

P.Name: Frangible
P.Doc: Boolean indicating whether the obstruction is easily broken

P.Name: VisibleMaterial
P.Doc: The type(s) of material that compose the load-bearing structure and/or exterior facing of a vertical construction (for example: a building or non-building structure).

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: An alphanumeric code by which the structure is identified locally.

P.Name: HorizontalProjection
P.Doc: Indicates the horizontal projection of the VerticalStructurePart and the elevation of its top.

P.Name: Lighting
P.Doc: Identifies the Light Elements installed on the Vertical StructurePart.

F.Name: ObstacleArea
F.Doc: An area defined by ICAO for the purpose of collecting obstacle data in electronic format, as necessary to satisfy requirements of air navigation systems or functions.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Indicates the type of the obstacle coverage area. Examples: Area 1, 2, 3 or 4.

P.Name: ObstructionIdSurfaceCondition
P.Doc: Obstruction identification surface that obstructing area represents

P.Name: Reference
P.Doc: Identifies the feature for which the Obstacle Area has been defined.

P.Name: SurfaceExtent
P.Doc: Identifies the extent of the Obstacle Area.

P.Name: Obstacle
P.Doc: Identifies the obstacle(s) associated with the obstacle area.

O.Name: ObstacleAreaOrigin
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting the feature for which the Obstacle Area has been defined

P.Name: OwnerAirport
P.Doc: Used to identify obstacles within Area 2 or Area 3 (ICAO Annex 15).

P.Name: OwnerRunway
P.Doc: Used to identify obstacles within a Area 4 (ICAO Annex 15)

P.Name: OwnerOrganisation
P.Doc: Used to identify obstacles within a State Territory (Area 1 - ICAO Annex 15)

F.Name: VerticalStructure
F.Doc: All fixed (whether temporary or permanent) and mobile objects, or parts thereof that extend above the surface of the Earth. Those vertical structures that are located on an area intended for the surface movement of aircraft or that extend above a defined surface intended to protect aircraft in flight are considered obstacles.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: The name of the vertical structure, if applicable,

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of vertical structure, such as building, tower, cable, etc.

P.Name: Lighted
P.Doc: A simple indication that the obstacle is lighted, when no further details are available.

P.Name: MarkingICAOStandard
P.Doc: Indicates if the markings comply with the ICAO standard, as described in Annex 14.

P.Name: Group
P.Doc: A flag indicating whether the vertical structure consists of a number of closely situated similar objects.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: Overall length of the obstruction

P.Name: Width
P.Doc: Overall width of the obstruction

P.Name: Radius
P.Doc: The overall radius of an obstacle that has a relatively circular shape

P.Name: LightingICAOStandard
P.Doc: Indicates if the lighting is ICAO standard as described in Annex 14.

P.Name: SynchronisedLighting
P.Doc: Indicates that the flashing light elements that compose the lighting of the vertical structure (could be a group) are synchronised (flash in unison).

P.Name: Marker
P.Doc: Identifies the Marker Beacon associated to the Vertical Structure.

P.Name: Part
P.Doc: Identifies a part(s) that makes up the Vertical Structure.

P.Name: HostedPassengerService
P.Doc: Identifies the passenger service hosted by the vertical structure.

P.Name: SupportedGroundLight
P.Doc: Identifies the ground light system supported by the vertical structure.

P.Name: HostedNavaidEquipment
P.Doc: Identifies the Navigation Aid Equipment hosted by the Vertical Structure.

P.Name: HostedSpecialNavStation
P.Doc: Identifies the Special Navigation Station hosted by the vertical structure.

P.Name: HostedUnit
P.Doc: Identifies the unit hosted by the vertical structure.

P.Name: HostedOrganisation
P.Doc: Identifies the OrganisationAuthority hosted by the vertical structure.

P.Name: SupportedService
P.Doc: Identifies the service supported by the vertical structure.

P.Name: LightingAvailability
P.Doc: The operational status of the vertical structure lighting.

O.Name: VerticalStructureLightingStatus
O.Doc: The description of the operational status of the Vertical Structure lighting.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: A code indicating the operational status of the lighting. For example, serviceable, unserviceable, work in progress, etc.

O.Name: CirclingRestriction
O.Doc: Describes a (sub)sector used to restrict flight within a circling area.

P.Name: SectorDescription
P.Doc: depicts the attributes that describe the geometry for the restricted area

P.Name: RestrictionArea
P.Doc: depicts the geometry for the restricted area

F.Name: CirclingArea
F.Doc: [FAA 8260.3] The area in which aircraft circle to land under visual conditions after completing an instrument landing approach.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: depicts the geometry for the circling area

P.Name: Approach
P.Doc: Circling is used on approach procedure to safely provide visual guidance to other runways.

P.Name: Condition
P.Doc: Obstacle assessment of circling areas can define specific conditions causing restrictions or different minimums.

P.Name: AircraftCategory
P.Doc: A different circling area is constructed and evaluated by aircraft category

P.Name: DesignSurface
P.Doc: Identifies the Obstacle Assessment Area for which the Circiling Area is evaluated by.

O.Name: Minima
O.Doc: Vertical and horizontal visual minimums for a procedure segment conditions such as aircraft category, navigation equipment usage, procedure type, altimeter, etc.

P.Name: Altitude
P.Doc: The lowest altitude used in establishing compliance with obstacle clearance criteria. The lowest altitude an aircraft flies before making a decision to land or abort and take the missed approach. (Highest of the lower limit altitudes in controlling obstacles plus the altitude adjustments (operational factors))

P.Name: AltitudeCode
P.Doc: An indication of the meaning of the altitude value, such as obstacle clearance altitude or decision altitude.

P.Name: AltitudeReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for the altitude.

P.Name: Height
P.Doc: The height value for the minimum

P.Name: MilitaryHeight
P.Doc: The height value for the minimum used by militaries, such as DoD in United States.

P.Name: RadioHeight
P.Doc: The height reported by a radio altimeter. Applies to CAT II.

P.Name: HeightCode
P.Doc: An indication of the meaning of the height value, such as obstacle clearance height or decision height.

P.Name: HeightReference
P.Doc: The reference surface for the height value.

P.Name: Visibility
P.Doc: The minimum visibility needed to land at the airport when using the specified altitude and/or height.

P.Name: MilitaryVisibility
P.Doc: The visibility value applicable to the military height.

P.Name: MandatoryRVR
P.Doc: Indicates visibility measurement type.

P.Name: RemoteAltimeterMinima
P.Doc: Indicates if this minima is the primary.

P.Name: AdjustmentINOP
P.Doc: Minimums are adjusted when equipment is unavailable.

O.Name: EquipmentUnavailableAdjustment
O.Doc: Used to describe adjustments to minimums when equipment is not available

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Indicates if the specified altitude/height is adjusted for the case when certain equipment is unavailable.

P.Name: ApproachLightingInoperative
P.Doc: Indicates if the specified altitude/height is adjusted for the case when the approach lighting is inoperative.

P.Name: AdjustmentINOPCol
P.Doc: contains the adjusted values

O.Name: EquipmentUnavailableAdjustmentColumn
O.Doc: Adjustments that need to be applied in case equipment is inoperative.

P.Name: GuidanceEquipment
P.Doc: The guidance equipment which is inoperative

P.Name: LandingSystemLights
P.Doc: Indicates if landing System Lights are available

P.Name: EquipmentRVR
P.Doc: RVR reading equipment is unavailable.

P.Name: VisibilityAdjustment
P.Doc: Adjusted for the corresponding visibility value.

P.Name: ApproachLightingInoperative
P.Doc: Indicates of the approach lighting is INOPERATIVE

O.Name: TerminalArrivalAreaSector
O.Doc: Subdivision of the TAA to allow for lower altitudes. The lowest altitude will provide a minimum clearance of 300m (1000ft) above all objects located in the sector.

P.Name: FlyByCode
P.Doc: Indicates if the aircraft is not required to fly directly over the fix. If code is Yes, then it is a 'flyby' waypoint. If the code is No or nil, then the associated fix is a 'fly-over' waypoint. [ICAO] Waypoints are identified as either flyover or fly-by.

P.Name: ProcedureTurnRequired
P.Doc: Indicates that a course reversal is not required. If the code is Yes, then the products will indicate 'NoPT'.

P.Name: AltitudeDescription
P.Doc: A code indicating how the altitude attributes should be interpreted: 'at' the lower altitude, 'at or above' the lower altitude, 'at or below' the lower altitude or 'between' the altitudes specified in the attributes lowerAltitude and upperAltitude distances.

P.Name: SectorDefinition
P.Doc: Identifies the circle sector that describes the terminal arrival area sector.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: depicts the geometry of the TAA sector geometry

P.Name: SignificantObstacle
P.Doc: Obstacle assessment resolves the need for TAA sectors.

F.Name: TerminalArrivalArea
F.Doc: The lowest altitude that will provide a minimum clearance of 300 metres (1000 feet) above all objects located in an arc of a circle defined by a 46 kilometre (25 nautical mile) radius centred on the initial approach fix (IAF), or where there is no IAF then centred on the intermediate approach fix (IF), delimited by straight lines joining the extremity of the arc to the IAF/IF.

P.Name: ArrivalAreaType
P.Doc: Indicates the base type of the arrival area. Types include: Left Base, Right Base, Straight In

P.Name: OuterBufferWidth
P.Doc: Buffer size of the outer arc boundary

P.Name: LateralBufferWidth
P.Doc: Buffer size of the lateral (or inner) boundary

P.Name: IF
P.Doc: TAA lateral boundaries are defined by the extension of the left and right base initial segments.

P.Name: IAF
P.Doc: The TAA reference points are the initial approach and/or intermediate fixes. The outer area boundaries are determined by arc radius centered on each of the three reference points.

P.Name: Buffer
P.Doc: depicts the geometry of the TAA buffer area.

P.Name: Sector
P.Doc: Terminal Arrival Area may be subdivided into sectors.

P.Name: ApproachRNAV
P.Doc: TAA supplies shift from the enroute environment to the approach procedure.

O.Name: FASDataBlock
O.Doc: Final Approach Segment Data Block. The additional information about the Precision Final Segment. Most attributes describe the LPV path point record required for WAAS procedures.

P.Name: HorizontalAlarmLimit
P.Doc: (ARINC) Horizontal Alert Limit (HAL) is the radius of a circle in the horizontal plane (the local plane tangent to the WGS-84 ellipsoid), with its centre being at the true position, which describes the region which is required to contain the indicated horizontal position with the required probability for a particular navigation mode assuming the probability of a GPS satellite integrity failure being included in the position solution is less than or equal to E-4 per hour.

P.Name: VerticalAlarmLimit
P.Doc: (ARINC) Vertical Alert Limit (VAL) is half the length of a segment on the vertical axis (perpendicular to the horizontal plane of WGS-84 ellipsoid), with its centre being at the true position, which describes the region which is required to contain the indicated vertical position with a probability of 1-E-7 per approach, assuming the probability of a GPS satellite integrity failure being included in the position solution is less than or equal to E-4 per hour.

P.Name: ThresholdCourseWidth
P.Doc: The width of the lateral course at the Landing Threshold Point (LTP). This width, in conjunction with the location of the Flight Path Alignment Point (FPAP) defines the sensitivity of the lateral deviations throughout the approach.

P.Name: LengthOffset
P.Doc: Distance from the stop end of the runway to the Flight Path Alignment Point

P.Name: CRCRemainder
P.Doc: Hexadecimal representation of the 32-bit CRC used to check the integrity of the FAS data block.

P.Name: OperationType
P.Doc: Operation Type. A number from 0 to 15 that indicates the type of the final approach segment.

P.Name: ServiceProviderSBAS
P.Doc: SBAS Service Provider Identifier. A number from 0 to 15 that associates the approach procedure to a particular satellite based approach system service provider.

P.Name: ApproachPerformanceDesignator
P.Doc: Approach Performance Designator. A number from 0 to 7 that identifies the type of approach.

P.Name: RouteIndicator
P.Doc: Route Indicator. A single alpha character (A through Z or blank, omitting I and O) used to differentiate between multiple final approach segments to the same runway or heliport.

P.Name: ReferencePathDataSelector
P.Doc: Reference Path Data Selector (RPDS). A number (0-48) that enables automatic tuning of a procedure by LAAS avionics.

P.Name: ReferencePathIdentifier
P.Doc: Reference Path Identifier. A four-character identifier that is used to confirm selection of the correct approach procedure.

P.Name: CodeICAO
P.Doc: The first two designators of the ICAO location identifier, as identified in ICAO Doc 7910.

O.Name: ApproachAltitudeTable
O.Doc: Other altitudes (not defined by a segment) that are to be depicted on the profile view, such as HAT for ILS CAT II approaches.

P.Name: MeasurementPoint
P.Doc: Indicates the point of the altitude measurement as reporting on a terminal procedure chart.

P.Name: Altitude
P.Doc: The calculated altitude at the indicated point.

P.Name: AltitudeReference
P.Doc: The reference for the altitude.

O.Name: ApproachDistanceTable
O.Doc: Other distances (not defined by a segment) that are to be depicted on the profile view, such as HAT for ILS CAT II approaches.

P.Name: StartingMeasurementPoint
P.Doc: Indicates starting point of the vertical or horizontal measurement

P.Name: ValueHAT
P.Doc: The altitude of the start point at the distance given. Used to indicate the distance from the threshold for a specified descent altitude.

P.Name: EndingMeasurementPoint
P.Doc: Indicates ending point of the vertical or horizontal measurement

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: Calculated distanced between the start and end point.

O.Name: ApproachTimingTable
O.Doc: Table of timings usually between final approach fix and the missed approach point.

P.Name: StartingMeasurementPoint
P.Doc: Indicates starting point of the vertical or horizontal measurement

P.Name: EndingMeasurementPoint
P.Doc: Indicates ending point of the vertical or horizontal measurement

P.Name: Time
P.Doc: The duration of the flight between the start point and the end point.

P.Name: Speed
P.Doc: The speed of the aircraft used to calculate the time.

O.Name: FinalProfile
O.Doc: The profile view of a final segment defined for an approach procedure.

P.Name: Altitude
P.Doc: declared altitudes

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: declared distances

P.Name: Timing
P.Doc: declared timing

F.Name: InstrumentApproachProcedure
F.Doc: A series of predetermined manoeuvres by reference to flight instruments with specified protection from obstacles from the initial approach fix, or where applicable , from the beginning of a defined arrival route to a point from which a landing can be completed and thereafter, if a landing is not completed, to a position at which holding or en route obstacle clearance criteria apply.

P.Name: ApproachPrefix
P.Doc: Prefix used in support of current naming conventions

P.Name: ApproachType
P.Doc: A name describing the type of radio navigational aid/system

P.Name: MultipleIdentification
P.Doc: One character code for multiple approaches of the same approach type; Z-A

P.Name: CopterTrack
P.Doc: The final approach track value for copter procedures, 1 - 360.

P.Name: CirclingIdentification
P.Doc: A suffix letter for circling only procedures, A - Z.

P.Name: CourseReversalInstruction
P.Doc: Operational instructions that must be observed for procedure turns and tear drops.

P.Name: AdditionalEquipment
P.Doc: the additional equipment needed to fly the procedure not listed in approachType

P.Name: ChannelGNSS
P.Doc: Operating channel of electronic transceiving equipment

P.Name: WAASReliable
P.Doc: Indicates an expected level of service, e.g., LNAV/VNAV or LPV may not be available. Wide Area Augmentation System (WAAS).

P.Name: Landing
P.Doc: Approach procedure designates the landing areas

P.Name: MissedInstruction
P.Doc: Approach procedure will include missed approach instructions for safety

P.Name: FinalProfile
P.Doc: Approach Procedure declares distances, altitudes and timing for safe landing.

O.Name: MissedApproachGroup
O.Doc: Properties of the Missed Approach

P.Name: Instruction
P.Doc: Operational instructions that must be observed when flying the Missed Approach.

P.Name: AlternateClimbInstruction
P.Doc: A second climb-to-altitude provided on a missed approach based off the remote altimeter source. It is provided when the 40:1 surface can not be cleared. For example, (6,100 when using Denver/Stapleton altimeter setting) is a parenthetical instruction.

P.Name: AlternateClimbAltitude
P.Doc: The altitude for the alternate climb instruction. (In PANS-OPS and TERPS design this is the 40:1 surface penetration - second climb to altitude.)

P.Name: Altimeter
P.Doc: Typical services for a procedure are: 1. The unit providing altimeter service.

O.Name: ApproachCondition
O.Doc: The final approach condition that must be met to use the set of minima. For example, straight in approach to runway 9R Localizer only. (S-LOC 9R) (circling 8,16)

P.Name: FinalApproachPath
P.Doc: Enumerant indicating final approach path.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc:
[ICAO] Required navigation performance (RNP). [ICAO] Specifies the minimum navigation performance accuracy required in an airspace. It is the navigation performance accuracy of all the user and navigation system combinations within an airspace.
Note: It is a tolerance factor for flying. The factor is taken into consideration when determining protected airspace for aircraft.

P.Name: ClimbGradient
P.Doc: The capability of an aircraft to climb with a certain gradient in take-off configuration.

P.Name: MinimumSet
P.Doc: minimums may be created for a set of conditions

P.Name: CirclingRestriction
P.Doc: restrictions may be created for a set of conditions

P.Name: AircraftCategory
P.Doc: Defines the approved aircraft categories.

P.Name: LandingArea
P.Doc: Minimum Final Approach Condition may apply to one or more Runway Directions;final and sidestep

P.Name: Altimeter
P.Doc: The altimeter that the Minimum Final Approach Condition applies to.

P.Name: DesignSurface
P.Doc: Relationship exists when multiple RNP minimas exist

F.Name: StandardInstrumentDeparture
F.Doc: A designated instrument flight rule (IFR) departure route linking the aerodrome or a specific runway of the aerodrome with a specified significant point, normally on a designated ATS route, at which the en-route phase of a flight commences.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The full textual designator of the SID. For example, - KOGAL1A - a Standard Instrument Departure ending at a designated point KOGAL.

P.Name: ContingencyRoute
P.Doc: flag indicating the departure is a contingency route

P.Name: Takeoff
P.Doc: Departure procedure designates the take off area.

F.Name: NavigationArea
F.Doc: An area specified by sectors with altitude or procedure descent gradient limitations for omnidirectional departures or Pilot navigation area.

P.Name: NavigationAreaType
P.Doc: Indicates what type of area is defined; omnidirectional area, pilot navigation area.

P.Name: MinimumCeiling
P.Doc: The minimum cloud base needed when using this departure navigation area.

P.Name: MinimumVisibility
P.Doc: The minimum visibility needed when using this departure navigation area.

P.Name: Departure
P.Doc: Identifies the SID for which the Navigation Area protects.

P.Name: Sector
P.Doc: Defines a subdivision of the Navigation Area designed to provide safety.

P.Name: CentrePoint
P.Doc: For RADAR procedures the Pilot Navigation area is centered on the IF. For Omnidirectional departures the area is centered on a point on the runway centre line 600 m from the start of takeoff (Cat H, the beginning of the runway or the FATO).

O.Name: NavigationAreaSector
O.Doc: Subdivision of a sector to allow for different altitudes or gradients.

P.Name: SectorDefinition
P.Doc: Defines a non graphical definition describing a portion of a navigation area.

P.Name: SignificantObstacle
P.Doc: Identifies the obstacle that control the altitude definition of the sector or would penetrate the 40:1 OCS.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: The surface extent of the navigation area sector.

P.Name: SectorCriteria
P.Doc: Identifies the Sector Design defined by the Navigation Area Sector.

O.Name: DepartureArrivalCondition
O.Doc: A condition which is established for a departure or an arrival

P.Name: MinimumEnrouteAltitude
P.Doc: Minimum en-route altitude (MEA). The altitude for an en-route segment that provides adequate reception of relevant navigation facilities and ATS communications, complies with the airspace structure and provides the required obstacle clearance.

P.Name: MinimumCrossingAtEnd
P.Doc: The lowermost vertical position at the end point, when flying on the route portion in the direction indicated in the RoutePortionUsage.

P.Name: MinimumCrossingAtEndReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the minimumCrossingAtEnd. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: MaximumCrossingAtEnd
P.Doc: The uppermost vertical position at the end point, when flying on the route portion in the direction indicated in the RoutePortionUsage.

P.Name: MaximumCrossingAtEndReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the maximumCrossingAtEnd. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: EngineType
P.Doc: Identifies th type of aircraft engine allowed for the condition

O.Name: SectorDesign
O.Doc: Design criteria used for the NavigationAreaSector.

P.Name: TurnDirection
P.Doc: A code indicating the direction of the turn.

P.Name: DesignGradient
P.Doc: Procedure design Gradient

P.Name: TerminationAltitude
P.Doc: Termination Altitude

P.Name: TurnPermitted
P.Doc: Indicates if the sector is clear for the direction of turn.

F.Name: StandardInstrumentArrival
F.Doc: A designated instrument flight rule (IFR) arrival route linking a significant point, normally on an ATS route, with a point from which a published instrument approach procedure can be commenced.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: The textual designator of the STAR. For example, - FUL3A - a Standard Arrival beginning at designated point FUL.

P.Name: Arrival
P.Doc: Indicates the runways available from the arrival

O.Name: ProcedureAvailability
O.Doc: Information about the status of the procedure for flight planning/operations.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: A code indicating the status of the procedure for flight planning/operations.

F.Name: Procedure
F.Doc: A series of predetermined manoeuvres with specified protection from obstacles.

P.Name: CommunicationFailureInstruction
P.Doc: Operational instructions which must be observed in case of communication failure.

P.Name: Instruction
P.Doc: Some free text to describe operational instructions (other than communication failure instructions) which must be respected when flying the Procedure.

P.Name: DesignCriteria
P.Doc: Rules used in the design of the procedure.

P.Name: CodingStandard
P.Doc: The set of rules followed when encoding the procedure legs

P.Name: FlightChecked
P.Doc: Indicates if the procedure has been flight checked.

P.Name: Name
