P.Doc: The name of the instrument procedure.

P.Name: RNAV
P.Doc: Indicates the procedure is an RNAV procedure

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational availability of the Procedure.

P.Name: AirportHeliport
P.Doc: Procedure services one or more aerodromes and/or heliports.

P.Name: AircraftCharacteristic
P.Doc: Procedure may be limited to aircraft categories and/or aircraft capabilities

P.Name: FlightTransition
P.Doc: A transition contains and is flown by a equential series of segment legs.

P.Name: GuidanceFacility
P.Doc: Identifies the guidance service(s) the procedure uses.

P.Name: SafeAltitude
P.Doc: A series of minimum altitudes in the area where the procedure is executed.

F.Name: NavigationAreaRestriction
F.Doc: Areas that are restricted from use for a procedure. Example is restricted areas defined for an omnidirectional departure.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Indicated the type of restriction area

P.Name: Procedure
P.Doc: Identifies the Procedure which the restriction applies to.

P.Name: DesignSurface
P.Doc: Identifies the Obstacle Assessment Area that evaulates the restriction.

P.Name: SectorDefinition
P.Doc: Identifies the Circle Sector for which the restriction is described by.

F.Name: SegmentLeg
F.Doc: A portion of a procedure as defined by two consecutive significant points.

P.Name: EndConditionDesignator
P.Doc: An indication of the event that allows identifying the end of the leg and the start of the next leg on the procedure. For example, reaching an altitude or outbound timing.

P.Name: LegPath
P.Doc: A code defining a specific type of flight path such as arc, base turn outbound, base turn inbound, track, proc turn, hold in lieu.

P.Name: LegTypeARINC
P.Doc: A comprehensive description of the 'path and terminator' concept is given in ARINC Specification 424, Attachment 5, Path and Terminator.

P.Name: Course
P.Doc: The value of the course angle in degrees.

P.Name: CourseType
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of course to be observed. E.g. true track, magnetic track, heading, VOR radial, true bearing, magnetic bearing.

P.Name: CourseDirection
P.Doc: Indicates flight direction to/from the navaid providing the course guidance.

P.Name: TurnDirection
P.Doc: A code indicating the direction of the turn.

P.Name: SpeedLimit
P.Doc:
The value of the speed limit on the procedure leg.
Rules: As a plausibility rule, value should be equivalent to between 0 and 400, when expressed in Km/h.

P.Name: SpeedReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference system for a speed value.

P.Name: SpeedInterpretation
P.Doc: A code indicating how the speed attributes of a procedure leg should be interpreted.

P.Name: BankAngle
P.Doc:
The recommended bank angle of the aircraft on the turn.
Rules: As a plausibility rule, value should be between 5 and 35 degrees.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: Length of the segment

P.Name: Duration
P.Doc: Segment duration

P.Name: ProcedureTurnRequired
P.Doc: Indicates if a procedure turn is required at the end of the segmentleg. Default is No.

P.Name: UpperLimitAltitude
P.Doc: The value of the upper altitude used with codeDescrDistVer: At or below the higher altitude. Between the lower and the upper altitude.

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

P.Name: LowerLimitAltitude
P.Doc:
The lower limit altitude.
used with codeDescrDistVer: At or above the lower altitude. At the lower altitude Between the lower and the upper altitude. Lower altitude is recommended. Expect lower altitude by ATC.

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

P.Name: AltitudeInterpretation
P.Doc: A code indicating how the altitude attributes of a procedure leg should be interpreted.

P.Name: AltitudeOverrideATC
P.Doc: Alternate altitude when directed by Air Traffic Control

P.Name: AltitudeOverrideReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

P.Name: VerticalAngle
P.Doc:
The value of the vertical climb angle of the aircraft on the procedure leg. A negative value means descent.
Rules: As a plausibility rule, value should be between -10 and +50 degrees.

P.Name: StartPoint
P.Doc: determines the starting point of the segment

P.Name: EndPoint
P.Doc: determines the ending point of the segment

P.Name: Trajectory
P.Doc: Segment Leg is depicted by the trajectory

P.Name: ArcCentre
P.Doc: An segment known as an Arc can be defined as a radius and distance around a center point.

P.Name: Angle
P.Doc: Aircraft trajectory must not cross the angle indication.

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: Aircraft trajectory must not cross this distance indication.

P.Name: AircraftCategory
P.Doc: A segment leg can be established for specific aircraft characteristics.

P.Name: Holding
P.Doc: The segment leg uses a holding pattern for arrival holding, missed approach holding or hold in lieu of procedure turn.

P.Name: DesignSurface
P.Doc: An evaluation area used when designing a procedure segment to insure safety of aircraft

O.Name: ProcedureTransition
O.Doc: A group of consecutive segments that are part of a branch on an approach procedure, SID or STAR.

P.Name: TransitionId
P.Doc: Used strictly for ARINC coding. The identifier will be the initial point for each transition. A transition includes multiple segment legs.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of transition.

P.Name: Instruction
P.Doc: Operational instructions that must be observed when flying the ProcedureTransition part.

P.Name: VectorHeading
P.Doc: A heading provided for use, when a departure is designed to incorporate radar vectors at the termination point, in the event ATC instructions are not received prior to or at the termination fix.

P.Name: DepartureRunwayTransition
P.Doc: Business Rule: This relationship is only used for Departure Runway Transitions.

P.Name: Trajectory
P.Doc: Transition is graphically represented by curve

P.Name: TransitionLeg
P.Doc: Identifies the Segment Legs that compose the Procedure Transition.

O.Name: HoldingUse
O.Doc: Describes how the holding pattern is used on a segment.

P.Name: HoldingUseP
P.Doc: Indicates how the holding is used on the approach segment.

P.Name: Instruction
P.Doc: Operational instructions concerning the use of the Holding Pattern in relation with a Procedure.

P.Name: InstructedAltitude
P.Doc: An altitude referenced in the holding use instructions.

P.Name: InstructionAltitudeReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance: QFE, QNH, STD.

F.Name: ApproachLeg
F.Doc: A portion of a terminal approach procedure as defined by two consecutive significant points.

P.Name: Approach
P.Doc: Approaches have defined segments (Initial, Intermediate, etc.) that can have stepdown legs.

F.Name: ArrivalFeederLeg
F.Doc: A type of SegmentLeg designed in accordance with the rules for arrival feeder segments having the properties specific to a arrival feeder approach segment.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc:
[ICAO] Required navigation performance (RNP). [ICAO] Specifies the minimum navigation performance accuracy required in an airspace. It is the navigation performance accuracy of all the user and navigation system combinations within an airspace.
Note: It is a tolerance factor for flying. The factor is taken into consideration when determining protected airspace for aircraft.

F.Name: ArrivalLeg
F.Doc: A portion of an arrival procedure (STAR) as defined by two consecutive significant points.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc:
[ICAO] Required navigation performance (RNP). [ICAO] Specifies the minimum navigation performance accuracy required in an airspace. It is the navigation performance accuracy of all the user and navigation system combinations within an airspace.
Note: It is a tolerance factor for flying. The factor is taken into consideration when determining protected airspace for aircraft.

P.Name: Arrival
P.Doc: Arrivals have defined legs.

F.Name: DepartureLeg
F.Doc: A portion of an departure procedure as defined by two consecutive significant points.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc:
[ICAO] Required navigation performance (RNP). [ICAO] Specifies the minimum navigation performance accuracy required in an airspace. It is the navigation performance accuracy of all the user and navigation system combinations within an airspace.
Note: It is a tolerance factor for flying. The factor is taken into consideration when determining protected airspace for aircraft.

P.Name: MinimumObstacleClearanceAltitude
P.Doc: Minimum obstacle clearance altitude (MOCA). The minimum altitude for a defined segment of flight that provides the required obstacle clearance.

P.Name: Departure
P.Doc: Departures have defined Legs.

P.Name: Condition
P.Doc: Identifies the established conditions for the departure

F.Name: FinalLeg
F.Doc: A type of SegmentLeg designed in accordance with the rules for final segments having the properties specific to a final approach segment..

P.Name: GuidanceSystem
P.Doc: Guidance system used on the final approach segment of an instrument approach procedure. (Commonly used to differentiate lines in a minima table.)

P.Name: LandingSystemCategory
P.Doc: Landing system category for use of the minima.

P.Name: MinimumBaroVnavTemperature
P.Doc:
[FAA-H-8261-1] The temperature at which a Baro-VNAV is noted NA. It is the minimum temperature limitation published for each procedure for which Baro-VNAV minimums are published. This temperature represents the airport temperature below which the use of Baro-VNAV is not authorized to the LNAV/VNAV DA.
For example, the note Baro-VNAV NA below -20 deg. C (-5 deg. F) implies that the approach may not be flown at all using Baro-VNAV when the temperature is below -20 deg. Celsius. However, Baro-VNAV may be used for approach guidance down to the published LNAV MDA.
Note: Used in the LNAV final segment.

P.Name: RnpDMEAuthorized
P.Doc:
Applies to RNAVguidance. Indicates if DME/DME RNP 0.3 is allowed.
DME/DME based RNP-.03 systems may be used only when a chart note indicates DME/DME availability, for example, "DME/DME RNP-0.3 Authorized." Specific DME facilities may be required, for example, "DME/DME RNP-0.3 Authorized, ABC, XYZ required."
Note: Used on RNAV final segment.

P.Name: CourseOffsetAngle
P.Doc: Final Approach Course Offset Angle. Indicates the offset angle between the final approach course and the extended runway centreline.

P.Name: CourseOffsetSide
P.Doc: Final Approach Course Offset Side. Indicates on which side of the extended runway centreline that the final approach course lies, when viewed from the Final Approach Fix.

P.Name: CourseCentrelineDistance
P.Doc: Final Approach Course Centre Line Distance. Indicates the distance from the Landing Threshold Point (LTP) to the point where the extended runway centreline intersects the final approach course.

P.Name: CourseOffsetDistance
P.Doc: Final Approach Course Offset Distance. Indicates the distance between the final approach course and extended runway centreline at a point located 3000 ft from the Landing Threshold Point (LTP), measured perpendicular to the extended runway centreline

P.Name: CourseCentrelineIntersect
P.Doc: Indicates if the intersection of the final approach course with the extended runway centreline is located before or after the Landing Threshold Point (LTP).

P.Name: Condition
P.Doc: Final Leg of an approach establishes conditions to be applied.

P.Name: FinalPathAlignmentPoint
P.Doc: Identifies the point defined by a latitude, longitude and MSL elevation used in conjunction with the LTP and the geometric center of the WGS-84 ellipsoid to define the vertical plane of a PA RNAV final approach course.

P.Name: VisualDescentPoint
P.Doc: Identifies the point on the final approach course of a nonprecision straight-in approach procedure from which normal descent from the MDA to the runway touchdown point may be commenced, provided visual reference is established.

P.Name: FASData
P.Doc: An RNAV precision approach has a final approach segment data block.

F.Name: InitialLeg
F.Doc: A type of segmentleg designed in accordance with the rules for initial segments having the properties specific to a initial approach segment.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc:
[ICAO] Required navigation performance (RNP). [ICAO] Specifies the minimum navigation performance accuracy required in an airspace. It is the navigation performance accuracy of all the user and navigation system combinations within an airspace.
Note: It is a tolerance factor for flying. The factor is taken into consideration when determining protected airspace for aircraft.

F.Name: IntermediateLeg
F.Doc: A type of SegmentLeg designed in accordance with the rules for intermediate segments having the properties specific to an intermediate approach segment.. The intermediate segment begins at the point where the initial approach intercepts the FAC.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc:
[ICAO] Required navigation performance (RNP). [ICAO] Specifies the minimum navigation performance accuracy required in an airspace. It is the navigation performance accuracy of all the user and navigation system combinations within an airspace.
Note: It is a tolerance factor for flying. The factor is taken into consideration when determining protected airspace for aircraft.

F.Name: MissedApproachLeg
F.Doc: A type of SegmentLeg designed in accordance with the rules for missed approach segments having the properties specific to a missed approach segment.. The missed approach segment begins at DA and ends at the clearance limit.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Indicates if the missed approach leg is part of the primary instruction.

P.Name: ThresholdAfterMAPT
P.Doc: Indicates if MAP is before or after the Threshold

P.Name: HeightMAPT
P.Doc: Elevation of the missed approach surface at the missed approach point.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc:
[ICAO] Required navigation performance (RNP). [ICAO] Specifies the minimum navigation performance accuracy required in an airspace. It is the navigation performance accuracy of all the user and navigation system combinations within an airspace.
Note: It is a tolerance factor for flying. The factor is taken into consideration when determining protected airspace for aircraft.

P.Name: Condition
P.Doc: A particular set of final approach conditions that must be met for the assessed missed approach

O.Name: ProcedureTransitionLeg
O.Doc: Characterises a SegmentLeg which is part of a Procedure Transition

P.Name: SeqNumberARINC
P.Doc: Indicates the order of the segment legs within a transition.

O.Name: LandingTakeoffAreaCollection
O.Doc: The grouping of Landing Areas or Takeoff Areas serviced by the procedure.

P.Name: Runway
P.Doc: Procedure may allow landing at multiple runways.

P.Name: TLOF
P.Doc: Procedure may allow landing at multiple TLOF

F.Name: ProcedureDME
F.Doc: DME facilities that are used for a particular segments for DME/DME navigation.

P.Name: CriticalDME
P.Doc: An indication that the DME is critical for navigation on a procedure segment.

P.Name: Satisfactory
P.Doc: Specifies whether the critical DME passed satisfactory or unsatisfactory.

P.Name: DME
P.Doc: Identifies the DME used for a procedure.

P.Name: SegmentLeg
P.Doc: Identifies the Segment Leg used for evaluating the Distance Measuring Equipment

F.Name: SafeAltitudeArea
F.Doc: A set of Minimum Sector Altitudes which completely describe an area centred on a significant point, usually contained within a sector of 46km (25NM) radius.

P.Name: SafeAreaType
P.Doc: Indicates the type of area, either MSA or ESA

P.Name: CentrePoint
P.Doc: Safe Altitude Area references a significant point as its base.

P.Name: Sector
P.Doc: Safe Altitude area may be subdivided into sectors.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Indicates the localisation of the safe altitudes area at a specific airport

O.Name: SafeAltitudeAreaSector
O.Doc: Subdivision of the MSA to allow for lower altitudes.

P.Name: BufferWidth
P.Doc: Width of the secondary area used to evaluate the lowest usable altitude for obstacle assessment.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: depicts the geometry for the MSA

P.Name: SignificantObstacle
P.Doc: Obstacle assessment resolves the need for MSA sectors.

P.Name: SectorDefinition
P.Doc: depicts the attributes that describe the geometry for the MSA

F.Name: HoldingPattern
F.Doc: A predetermined manoeuvre which keeps an aircraft within a specified airspace while awaiting further clearance.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of holding procedure. E.g. en-route holding, terminal area holding.

P.Name: OutboundCourse
P.Doc: The radial, course, bearing or magnetic directional course (if navaid is a localizer) from the facility or waypoint on which holding is based.

P.Name: OutboundCourseType
P.Doc: The type of course to be observed. E.g. true track, magnetic track, heading, VOR radial, true bearing, magnetic bearing

P.Name: InboundCourse
P.Doc: The course of the inbound leg.

P.Name: TurnDirection
P.Doc: Direction of the turn

P.Name: UpperLimit
P.Doc: Max altitude allowed for all aircraft categories at all defined speeds

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance.

P.Name: LowerLimit
P.Doc: Minimum altitude allowed for all aircraft categories at all defined speeds

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference for a vertical distance. Two series of values exist: 1) real distance: from GND, from the MSL, from the WGS-84 ellipsoid 2) pressure distance.

P.Name: SpeedLimit
P.Doc: Restricted speed for containment in a smaller pattern

P.Name: Instruction
P.Doc: Operational instructions that must be observed when flying the HoldingPattern.

P.Name: NonStandardHolding
P.Doc: ndicates whether the HoldingPattern is non-standard, for example because it uses left-hand turns.

P.Name: OutboundLegSpan
P.Doc: Span of the holding pattern as duration, length, or outbound to a significant point.

P.Name: HoldingPoint
P.Doc: holding occurs at this point

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: A race track pattern depicts a holding pattern.

O.Name: HoldingPatternLength
O.Doc: Representation of a span for a holding pattern that can be defined using either duration, distance or as outbound to a Significant Point. Note: abstract types will be ignored in XML encoding.

P.Name: EndTime
P.Doc: Identifies the span is timing.

P.Name: EndDistance
P.Doc: Identifies the span is a length

P.Name: EndPoint
P.Doc: Identifies the second waypoint of a two point holding, used to define the end of the outbound leg.

F.Name: UnplannedHolding
F.Doc: First time a point is established in Enroute environment at a navaid, all radials are checked for holding; 360 deg. (A circle is used for assessment) If the point is a designated point, holding along the course guidance radial is checked. If no restrictions are found, holding on any radial (unplanned) is approved. If restrictions are found, holding restrictions may be noted or holding may be restricted to defined holding patterns.

P.Name: UnplannedHoldingP
P.Doc:
Indicates if the holding pattern is used as an unplanned holding.
Note: Enroute use only.

P.Name: AuthorizedAltitude
P.Doc: value of the altitude approved based on unplanned holding assessment.

P.Name: AltitudeReference
P.Doc: Indicates: "HEI" = The distance measured from the ground,(AGL) "ALT" = The distance measured from mean sea level (MSL)

P.Name: ControlledAirspace
P.Doc: Indicates unplanned holding is completely contained within controlled airspace.

P.Name: HoldingPoint
P.Doc: Identifies the point used to clear safe holding.

O.Name: HoldingPatternDuration
O.Doc: Representation of the span for a holding pattern that is defined using a time

P.Name: Duration
P.Doc: Duration of the holding pattern outbound leg.

O.Name: HoldingPatternDistance
O.Doc: Representation of the span for a holding pattern that is defined using a distance

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: Length of the holding pattern outbound leg.

F.Name: AirspaceBorderCrossing
F.Doc: A type of traffic flow condition element which consist of crossing the common border between two adjacent airspace, when flying directly from one airspace into the other airspace.

P.Name: ExitedAirspace
P.Doc: The airspace the aircraft crosses from

P.Name: EnteredAirspace
P.Doc: The airspace the aircraft enters.

O.Name: DirectFlight
O.Doc: A direct flight (DCT) between two significant points, outside the existing route network.

O.Name: DirectFlightClass
O.Doc: A category of direct flights (DCT), having some particular characteristics, such as a minimum length.

P.Name: ExceedLength
P.Doc: A value used to indicate that only Direct Flights (DCT) that exceed this value are concerned.

O.Name: DirectFlightSegment
O.Doc: A direct flight (DCT) between two specified significant points.

P.Name: End
P.Doc: End point of a direct flight segment.

P.Name: Start
P.Doc: Start of a direct flight segment.

O.Name: FlightConditionCombination
O.Doc: A combination of conditions involving: 1) an operator such as \"AND\", \"OR\", \"AND NOT\", \"SEQUENCE\", \"NONE\" and 2) one or more operands, each of these being either a condition element or another combination of conditions.

P.Name: LogicalOperator
P.Doc: The type of operation combining an elementary condition or a previously defined combination with other elementary conditions or previously defined combinations.

P.Name: Element
P.Doc: An element of the Flight Condition.

O.Name: FlightConditionCircumstance
O.Doc: Circumstance related to the elementary condition (such as departing from an aerodrome), which is used to further refine the selection of flights being affected by the restriction.

P.Name: ReferenceLocation
P.Doc: A code indicating if the condition element is a reference location for the flight restriction, i.e. if the time schedule associated with the restriction must be considered as applicable for that flight condition element.

P.Name: RelationWithLocation
P.Doc: A code qualifying a location (such as an airspace, aerodrome, point, etc.) when used as condition element. For example, departing from that location, crossing the location, activation hours of the location are used as condition, etc..

O.Name: FlightRestrictionLevel
O.Doc: A single level or a level band associated with a flight restriction, either condition or routing element.

P.Name: UpperLevel
P.Doc: The value of the uppermost cruising level. The data type also allows a special non-numerical value "CEILING", meaning "the top of the airspace. This can useful in the case of Airspace that have a non-constant upper limit.

P.Name: UpperLevelReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the upper level. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: LowerLevel
P.Doc: The value of the lowermost cruising level. The data type also allows a special non-numerical value "FLOOR" meaning "the bottom of the airspace". This can useful in the case of Airspace that have a non-constant lower limit.

P.Name: LowerLevelReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the lower level. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

F.Name: FlightRestriction
F.Doc: A rule meant to regulate the use of the route network, by identifying a set of flights which fulfil a combination of elementary flow conditions and either forbidding them on a particular routing or obliging them to follow one routing out of a set of mandatory alternatives.

P.Name: Designator
P.Doc: A coded value which identifies the restriction.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A code indicating if the restriction is an interdiction or a mandatory routing.

P.Name: Instruction
P.Doc: Some free text to describe the operational instructions which form the FlightRestriction.

P.Name: Flight
P.Doc: The Flight affected by the Flight Restriction.

P.Name: RegulatedRoute
P.Doc: The Route regulated by the Flight Restriction

O.Name: FlightRestrictionRoute
O.Doc: A sequence of routing elements (points, route portions or airspace) that must/must not appear in the specified order in the flight plan of an aircraft fulfilling the conditions of the related Flight Restriction (according to its type attribute).

P.Name: PriorPermission
P.Doc: The minimum lead time required for contacting the relevant authority in order to get permission for using the routing.

P.Name: RouteElement
P.Doc: Routing element concerned by a specified flight restriction.

P.Name: Contact
P.Doc: The contact information of the relevant authority which can grant the permission for using the routing.

O.Name: FlightRoutingElement
O.Doc: An airspace, route or point that is concerned by a specified flight restriction.

P.Name: OrderNumber
P.Doc: A number in sequence used to indicate the order of the routing element in the flight restriction routing to which it belongs.

P.Name: Speed
P.Doc: The value of the speed limit imposed on a routing element.

P.Name: SpeedReference
P.Doc: A code indicating the reference system for the speed value. For example: IAS, TAS or GS (ground speed).

P.Name: SpeedCriteria
P.Doc: A code indicating whether the speed is a maximum, a minimum or an imposed value.

P.Name: FlightLevel
P.Doc: Level associated with the routing element.

P.Name: Element
P.Doc: Flight routing based on an element.

O.Name: FlightConditionElement
O.Doc: An operand in a flight condition combination.

P.Name: Index
P.Doc: A sequence number used to indicate the order of the operand when composing the FlightConditionCombination.

P.Name: FlightCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on a flight condition.

P.Name: OperationalCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on operational circumstances.

P.Name: FlightLevel
P.Doc: Flight level associated with a Flight Condition Element.

O.Name: FlightConditionElementChoice
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between an elementary condition and a preceding combination of conditions, to be used as operand in a subsequent combination of flight conditions

P.Name: AirportHeliportCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on an AirportHeliport.

P.Name: StandardInstrumentDepartureCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on an SID.

P.Name: RoutePortionCondition
P.Doc: If the route portion is "ID irellevant", then it will not be associated with any specific EnRouteRoute.

P.Name: OrganisationCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on an Organisation or Authority.

P.Name: SignificantPointCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on a SignificantPoint.

P.Name: DirectFlightCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on a direct flight.

P.Name: Aircraft
P.Doc: A condition based on an aircraft.

P.Name: BorderCrossingCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on the crossing of the common border between two adjacent airspaces.

P.Name: AirspaceCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on an Airspace.

P.Name: Flight
P.Doc: Condition based on a flight.

P.Name: StandardInstrumentArrivalCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on an Standard Instrument Arrival.

P.Name: Operand
P.Doc: A combination of flight conditions.

P.Name: Weather
P.Doc: A condition based on the weather.

P.Name: AerialRefuellingCondition
P.Doc: A condition based on an Aerial Refuelling.

O.Name: FlightRoutingElementChoice
O.Doc: A link class that allows selecting between an AirportHeliport, an airspace, a fix, a procedure or an aerial refuelling which is impacted by a flight restriction

P.Name: StandardInstrumentArrivalElement
P.Doc: Standard Instrument Arrival which is impacted by a flight restriction.

P.Name: AirspaceElement
P.Doc: Airspace which is impacted by a flight restriction.

P.Name: PointElement
P.Doc: Significant Point which is impacted by a flight restriction.

P.Name: DirectFlightElement
P.Doc: Direct Flight Segment which is impacted by a flight restriction.

P.Name: StandardInstrumentDepartureElement
P.Doc: SID which is impacted by a flight restriction.

P.Name: RoutePortionElement
P.Doc: Route Portion which is impacted by a flight restriction.

P.Name: AerialRefuellingElement
P.Doc: Aerial Refuelling Element which is impacted by a flight restriction.

F.Name: RouteSegment
F.Doc: A portion of a route to be flown usually without an intermediate stop, as defined by two consecutive significant points.

P.Name: Level
P.Doc: A code indicating if the route segment is in the upper airspace, the lower airspace or both.

P.Name: UpperLimit
P.Doc: The vertical position of the route segment ceiling.

P.Name: UpperLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the upper limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: LowerLimit
P.Doc: The vertical position of the route segment floor.

P.Name: LowerLimitReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the lower limit. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: MinimumObstacleClearanceAltitude
P.Doc: Minimum obstacle clearance altitude (MOCA). The minimum altitude for a defined segment of flight that provides the required obstacle clearance.

P.Name: PathType
P.Doc: The type of segment path. For example, great circle, rhumbline, geodesic line, etc.

P.Name: TrueTrack
P.Doc: The initial true track.

P.Name: MagneticTrack
P.Doc: The initial magnetic track.

P.Name: ReverseTrueTrack
P.Doc: The reverse initial true track.

P.Name: ReverseMagneticTrack
P.Doc: The reverse initial magnetic track.

P.Name: Length
P.Doc: The length of the path (depending on the type of the path).

P.Name: WidthLeft
P.Doc: The distance from the centreline of the route segment to the left edge, when considering the direction from the start point to the end point.

P.Name: WidthRight
P.Doc: The distance from the centreline of the route segment to the right edge, when considering the direction from the start point to the end point.

P.Name: TurnDirection
P.Doc: Indicates the turn direction (if any) at the end of the current segment, in order to continue on to the next segment of the same route.

P.Name: SignalGap
P.Doc: indicates a signal gap in the segment

P.Name: MinimumEnrouteAltitude
P.Doc: Minimum en-route altitude (MEA). The altitude for an en-route segment that provides adequate reception of relevant navigation facilities and ATS communications, complies with the airspace structure and provides the required obstacle clearance.

P.Name: MinimumCrossingAtEnd
P.Doc: The lowermost vertical position at the end point, when flying on the route portion in the direction indicated in the RoutePortionUsage.

P.Name: MinimumCrossingAtEndReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the minimumCrossingAtEnd. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: MaximumCrossingAtEnd
P.Doc: The uppermost vertical position at the end point, when flying on the route portion in the direction indicated in the RoutePortionUsage.

P.Name: MaximumCrossingAtEndReference
P.Doc: The reference surface used for the value of the maximumCrossingAtEnd. For example, Mean Sea Level, Ground, standard pressure, etc..

P.Name: NavigationType
P.Doc: Classification of the Route Portion for navigational purposes. Examples: conventional, RNAV.

P.Name: RequiredNavigationPerformance
P.Doc: A code indicating the required navigation performance for the route portion

P.Name: DesignatorSuffix
P.Doc: A suffix for the route designator (according ICAO Annex 11), indicating whether advisory service only is available on that portion, or the RNP status of the route portion.

P.Name: Start
P.Doc: The start EnRouteSegmentPoint for the Route Segment

P.Name: RouteFormed
P.Doc: The route formed by the Route Segments.

P.Name: EvaluationArea
P.Doc: The obstacle evaluation area for the route segment.

P.Name: CurveExtent
P.Doc: The extent of the route segment.

P.Name: End
P.Doc: The end EnRouteSegmentPoint for the Route Segment

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational availability of the RouteSegment.

O.Name: RouteAvailability
O.Doc: Information about the operational availability of a route.

P.Name: Direction
P.Doc: A code indicating the direction in which the route segment is considered when a specific usage is described, ie. forward or backward.

P.Name: CardinalDirection
P.Doc: The direction for which the usage is specified, expressed as compass angle.

P.Name: Status
P.Doc: The availability status of the route, in the direction indicated by the direction and/or cardinalDirection attribute.

P.Name: Levels
P.Doc: The level and time block referenced by the usage.

O.Name: RoutePortion
O.Doc: A group of two or more consecutive segments of the same route, which have the usage and/or the same flight restrictions.

P.Name: Start
P.Doc: The starting SignificantPoint for the route portion.

P.Name: IntermediatePoint
P.Doc: To be used when necessary to distinguish between alternative branches of a route.

P.Name: End
P.Doc: The ending SignificantPoint for the route portion.

F.Name: RouteDME
F.Doc: DME facilities that are used for a particular route for DME/DME navigation.

P.Name: CriticalDME
P.Doc: An indication that the DME is critical for navigation on the route portion.

P.Name: Satisfactory
P.Doc: Specifies whether the critical DME passed satisfactory or unsatisfactory.

P.Name: ReferencedDME
P.Doc: The DME referenced on the Route.

P.Name: ApplicableRoutePortion
P.Doc: The route portion that the routeDME applies to.

F.Name: Route
F.Doc: A specified route designed for channelling the flow of traffic as necessary for the provision of air traffic services, from the end of the take-off and initial climb phase to the commencement of the approach and landing phase.

P.Name: DesignatorPrefix
P.Doc: A prefix for the route designator, indicating whether the route is upper ATS, reserved for helicopters or reserved for supersonic flights.

P.Name: DesignatorSecondLetter
P.Doc: The letter of the route designator. Depending on the region, letters may have special significance with regard to the route usage limitations.

P.Name: DesignatorNumber
P.Doc: The number of the route designator.

P.Name: MultipleIdentifier
P.Doc: A suffix for the route designator, indicating alternates for homonymous routes (especially for military training routes).

P.Name: LocationDesignator
P.Doc: A textual description of the area in which a designated route is situated.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: A free text name by which the route is known.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: Route classification.

P.Name: FlightRule
P.Doc: A code indicating the flight rules to be observed by aircraft. For example, VFR and/or IFR.

P.Name: InternationalUse
P.Doc: A code indicating if the route segment is international or domestic.

P.Name: MilitaryUse
P.Doc: A code indicating whether the route is for exclusive use by military aircraft.

P.Name: MilitaryTrainingType
P.Doc: A code indicating the type of military training activity for which the route has been designed.

P.Name: UserOrganisation
P.Doc: Indicates the Organisation normally originating activity on a military training route.

F.Name: ChangeOverPoint
F.Doc: The distance from the start of the route portion to the position where change over occurs for VOR defined routes.

P.Name: Distance
P.Doc: The distance from the start of the route portion to position of the change over point.

P.Name: Location
P.Doc: Location of the change over point.

P.Name: ApplicableRoutePortion
P.Doc: The Route Portion that the change over point applies to.

F.Name: AerialRefuelling
F.Doc: A procedure used by the military to transfer fuel from one aircraft to another during flight.

P.Name: DesignatorPrefix
P.Doc: A group of characters that indicate that the designator is for an aerial refuelling route.

P.Name: DesignatorNumber
P.Doc: A number that identifies the Aerial Refuelling route.

P.Name: DesignatorSuffix
P.Doc: A group of characters that qualifies the Aerial Refuelling route.

P.Name: DesignatorDirection
P.Doc: The general cardinal direction of the Aerial Refuelling procedure, as a category.

P.Name: Name
P.Doc: A free text identifier by which the Aerial Refuelling route is known.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: The type of the Aerial Refuelling procedure based on its configuration.

P.Name: RadarBeaconSetting
P.Doc: The setting to be used by the Airborne Navigation Radar beacon during aerial Refuel operations.

P.Name: XbandRadarSetting
P.Doc: The setting to be used by the Airborne Identification Radar beacon during aerial Refuel operations.

P.Name: TankerChannel
P.Doc: A code indicating the tanker channel of the TACAN system.

P.Name: ReceiverChannel
P.Doc: The Tactical Air Navigation System (TACAN) channel assigned to the aircraft receiving fuel during air Refuel operations.

P.Name: HelicopterRoute
P.Doc: An indication that the Aerial Refuelling procedure is designed only for helicopter usage.

P.Name: SpecialRefuelling
P.Doc: An indication that the Aerial Refuelling procedure supports special missions/sortie.

P.Name: BidirectionalUse
P.Doc: An indication that the aerial Refuel track supports simultaneous opposite direction aerial Refuel.

P.Name: ReverseDirectionTurn
P.Doc: Once the aircraft reaches the end of aerial refuelling track, it can turn around right or left, which is referred to as the Direction of Course Reversal Turn. Then, it goes back on the same route that it came from. It only applies to bi-directional routes.

P.Name: Availability
P.Doc: The operational availability of the AerialRefuelling.

P.Name: ProtectingAirspace
P.Doc: Indicates either the airspace that protects or airspace that are crossed by the Aerial Refuelling procedure.

P.Name: Track
P.Doc: AerialRefuellingLeg may be either an anchor or a track. In either case, the points that make up an anchor or track are defined in the AerialRefuellingPoint. The Anchor class provides additional anchoring data related to only AR anchors. The geometry of a track is represented by the Curve object and geometryof an anchor is represented by Surface object.

P.Name: Anchor
P.Doc: The definition of the AerialRefuelling anchor.

P.Name: OppositeTrack
P.Doc: The opposite AerialRefuelling.

P.Name: ManagingOrganisation
P.Doc: The OrganisationAuthority that manages the AerialRefuelling.

O.Name: AerialRefuellingPoint
O.Doc: A geographic position or radio navigation fix along an air refuelling anchor pattern or air refuelling track.

P.Name: Sequence
P.Doc: This attribute defines the order of points that make up an aerial refuelling track or anchor.

P.Name: UsageType
P.Doc: The function(s) of the air Refuel point in relation to the air Refuel anchor pattern or air Refuel track.

O.Name: AerialRefuellingAnchor
O.Doc: A prescribed pattern, established by air refuelling points, along which air-to-air refuelling of aircraft is performed.

P.Name: OutboundCourse
P.Doc: The radial, course, bearing or magnetic directional course (if navaid is a localizer) from the facility or waypoint on which anchor is based.

P.Name: OutboundCourseType
P.Doc: The type of outbound course from the facility or waypoint on which anchor is based.

P.Name: InboundCourse
P.Doc: The course of the inbound leg.

P.Name: TurnDirection
P.Doc: Direction of the turn

P.Name: SpeedLimit
P.Doc: Restricted speed for containment in a smaller pattern

P.Name: LegSeparation
P.Doc: Distance between two parallel legs of the Aerial Refuelling racetrack.

P.Name: LegLength
P.Doc: The length of the Aerial Refuelling racetrack.

P.Name: RefuellingBaseLevel
P.Doc: The lowest altitude or flight level at which refuelling operations can be performed.

P.Name: RefuellingBaseLevelReference
P.Doc: The vertical reference system for the refuellingBaseLevel distance.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: The Surface extent of the AerialRefuellingAnchor.

P.Name: VerticalExtent
P.Doc: The vertical extent of the AerialRefuellingAnchor.

P.Name: Point
P.Doc: AerialRefuellingPoint on a AerialRefuellingAnchor.

O.Name: AerialRefuellingTrack
O.Doc: A sequence of points that define the trajectory to be flown during an aerial refuelling operation.

P.Name: Extent
P.Doc: The shape of the AerialRefueliingTrack.

P.Name: Point
P.Doc: AerialRefuellingPoint on the AerialRefuellingTrack

P.Name: VerticalExtent
P.Doc: The vertical extent of the AerialRefuellingTrack.

O.Name: AuthorityForAerialRefuelling
O.Doc: Provides details about the kind of authority that the Organisation has over the Aerial Refuelling route.

P.Name: Type
P.Doc: A categorisation of the role that one organisation has for an Aerial Refuelling route.

F.Name: RulesProcedures
F.Doc: The definition of an instruction or regulation that needs to be considered by personnel involved in flight operations in relation with an airport/heliport or an airspace.

P.Name: Category
P.Doc: An indication of the purpose of the rule or procedure

P.Name: Title
P.Doc: A general heading by which the rule or procedure is usually identified in the Aeronautical Information Publications (AIP) or similar/related documents.

P.Name: Content
P.Doc: The definition of the actual content of the rule or procedure

P.Name: AffectedLocation
P.Doc: Airport/Heliport where the rule or procedure is effective.

P.Name: AffectedArea
P.Doc: Airspace within which the rule or procedure is applicable.

E.Name: NilReasonEnumeration
E.Doc: Indicates the reason for a null value.

P.Name: Inapplicable
P.Doc: there is no value

P.Name: Missing
P.Doc: the correct value is not readily available to the sender of this data. Furthermore, a correct value may not exist

P.Name: Template
P.Doc: the value will be available later. The value is announced in advance. For example, the value is provided in a NOTAM.

P.Name: Unknown
P.Doc: the correct value is not known to, and not computable by, the sender of this data. However, a correct value probably exists

P.Name: Withheld
P.Doc: the value is not divulged

P.Name: Other
P.Doc: Other reason for null value.

O.Name: MDMetadata
O.Doc: Information about the metadata

O.Name: MessageMetadata
O.Doc: Information about the metadata

O.Name: MDConstraints
O.Doc: Restrictions on the access and use of a dataset or metadata

O.Name: MDIdentification
O.Doc: Basic information about data

O.Name: MDLegalConstraints
O.Doc: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the dataset.

O.Name: LegalConstraints
O.Doc: Restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the dataset.

O.Name: MDSecurityConstraints
O.Doc: Handling restrictions imposed on the dataset because of national security, privacy, or other concerns.

O.Name: SecurityConstraints
O.Doc: Handling restrictions imposed on the dataset because of national security, privacy, or other concerns.

O.Name: FeatureMetadata
O.Doc: Information about the feature metadata

O.Name: IdentificationFeature
O.Doc: Basic information about data

O.Name: FeatureTimeSliceMetadata
O.Doc: Information about the Feature Timeslice metadata

O.Name: IdentificationTimesliceFeature
O.Doc: Basic information about Tilmeslice Feature.
